Balance & mobility symptom reports

Female, 16 - 25 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
16 2021-01-09 dizziness on 1/9/2021 -, 16 year old female was given Moderna vaccine. 10 minutes after injection, this was d... Read more
Close
on 1/9/2021 -, 16 year old female was given Moderna vaccine. 10 minutes after injection, this was discovered. Pt reports no adverse reactions during the 15 minute observation period. Telephone call on 1/10/2021 at 3:00 pm mother reports child had some arm soreness and a little dizzy yesterday but today feels fine.
16 2021-01-30 dizziness 1/26/21-afternoon through evening dizziness, arm pain, body aches 1/27/21-after midnight-fever of 10... Read more
Close
1/26/21-afternoon through evening dizziness, arm pain, body aches 1/27/21-after midnight-fever of 100.3, chills, arm pain 1/28/21-severe headache 1/29/21-headache gone by end of day
16 2021-04-22 dizziness PT IS 16 YEARS OLD. SHE RECVEIVED MODERNA VACCINE. PATIENT COMPLAIN OF BEING TIRED AND HAVING DIZZIN... Read more
Close
PT IS 16 YEARS OLD. SHE RECVEIVED MODERNA VACCINE. PATIENT COMPLAIN OF BEING TIRED AND HAVING DIZZINESS.
16 2021-04-26 dizziness 5 minutes after vaccination, flushing/sweating, pallor, diaphoretic, dizziness. Patient stable, rele... Read more
Close
5 minutes after vaccination, flushing/sweating, pallor, diaphoretic, dizziness. Patient stable, released from vaccination site.
16 2021-05-21 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Additional Details: Pt felt dizzy after 10 minutes of si... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Additional Details: Pt felt dizzy after 10 minutes of sitting in the store. We decided to have the patient laid down for 10 extra minutes and she felt better after 20 mins. Pt was okay to leave the pharmacy with her parents.
16 2021-05-26 dizziness Headache, dizziness; Patient rested and took Tylenol and got better by 2PM oon 5/27
17 2021-01-20 dizziness Dizziness, Air felt heavy
17 2021-01-25 dizziness This event was not an adverse event, however, it was an invalid dose because the patient was less th... Read more
Close
This event was not an adverse event, however, it was an invalid dose because the patient was less than 18 years of age when she received her first dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine. Patient did state she experienced some light dizziness about 5 minutes after she was given the vaccine and that this has happened before with the influenza vaccine. She also stated that she did not have anything to eat or drink at all that morning so she may have been experiencing weakness from that as well. It resolved within 10-15 minutes and patient was fine to go home per other healthcare providers.
17 2021-02-21 dizziness Administered first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 to a 17 year old patient.; Dizziness; A spontaneous ... Read more
Close
Administered first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 to a 17 year old patient.; Dizziness; A spontaneous report was received from a healthcare provider (HCP) concerning a 17-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced dizziness and inappropriate age at vaccine administration. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant medications were not provided. On 21 JAN 2021, the patient received her first of two doses of mRNA-1273 (lot number 042L20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. The HCP reported that in order to not waste any doses, the facility calls on family and friends to get the vaccine for no shows. The HCP reported that the patient experienced dizziness a few minutes after the injection. The patient hadn't eaten for 16 hours prior to taking the shot. The patient was monitored, and it resolved within the hour. Treatment for this event was not reported. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the events, dizziness and inappropriate age at vaccine administration was recovered.; Reporter's Comments: This case report concerns a 17-year-old female patient who was administered mRNA-1273 vaccine Lot# 042L20A (inappropriate age at vaccine administration) and experienced dizziness. The event of dizziness is temporarily associated with the product use and a causal association cannot be excluded. The event of inappropriate age at vaccine administration is assessed as not applicable.
17 2021-02-28 dizziness Patient received dose one of Moderna vaccine and was told before injection what she was receiving. P... Read more
Close
Patient received dose one of Moderna vaccine and was told before injection what she was receiving. Patient was given her CDC card with vaccination information. Vaccination was given to Patient with out difficulty. Mother stated after injection that her daughter was supposed to get the Pfizer vaccine because she is only 17. Patient became light headed and dizzy post injection. She is a known diabetic who has had this same thing happen after blood work or other shots. Problem self corrected with no medical intervention. Mother stated she knew she was to get Pfizer and the website gave her this site as an option.
17 2021-03-03 dizziness Pt reports onset of dizziness, chest tightness, shortness of breath that started acutely 45 minutes ... Read more
Close
Pt reports onset of dizziness, chest tightness, shortness of breath that started acutely 45 minutes to 1 hour after receiving her second Moderna vaccination on 2/24/21. She reported that she was told by her employer that the symptoms were due to the Moderna vaccine. She reportedly developed fever and some throat discomfort as well. Symptoms became persistent and disrupted sleep and was unable to work. She sought medical attention in the ER for persistent symptoms on 2/26/21. Extensive workup was essentially normal. She received Zofran, Decadron, IVFs, and Albuterol inhaler while in the ER. She reported improvement in her chest tightness and SOB after Albuterol. She was discharged home with instructions to f/u with her PCP in a couple of days for recheck.
17 2021-03-16 dizziness Patient was under the minimum age of 18 at the time of vaccine by 2 months. Patient experienced mild... Read more
Close
Patient was under the minimum age of 18 at the time of vaccine by 2 months. Patient experienced mild dizziness after vaccination and called a family member to drive her home
18 2021-01-02 dizziness intense chills and arm pain starting ~5 hours after shot (child faded within 24 hours) arm soreness ... Read more
Close
intense chills and arm pain starting ~5 hours after shot (child faded within 24 hours) arm soreness lasted ~3 days general intense fatigue and light-headedness/ headache; decreased and went away after 48 hours
18 2021-01-11 fall, dizziness The patient became diaphoretic, pale, and dizzy. Fell on the floor. No injury. BP monitored every 5 ... Read more
Close
The patient became diaphoretic, pale, and dizzy. Fell on the floor. No injury. BP monitored every 5 minutes, low BP noted. Sprite offered, cold pack applied to the back of the neck. Laid patient on the couch. The patient rested for about half-hour and felt a little better. Patient BP returned to 121/74 prior to release. Father accompanied the client.
18 2021-01-15 dizziness fever, vomiting, chills, dizziness, headache, sweating,
18 2021-01-22 dizziness Patient reported lightheadedness, dizziness, and nausea. Patients vitals were normal, and cleared b... Read more
Close
Patient reported lightheadedness, dizziness, and nausea. Patients vitals were normal, and cleared by EMS.
18 2021-01-28 dizziness 10:02am client reported right eye twitching and lightheadedness. Then noted rash on hands, nausea, a... Read more
Close
10:02am client reported right eye twitching and lightheadedness. Then noted rash on hands, nausea, and DOB. 10:05am 0.5ml 1:1000 Aq Epinephrine given in left thigh as paramedics arrived on scene., vitals taken. 10:18am Oxygen started per face mask and client transported to hospital at 10:20am
18 2021-02-03 dizziness All was fine until she woke up the next morning. Flu like symptoms; dizzy, glassy eyed, sweaty, som... Read more
Close
All was fine until she woke up the next morning. Flu like symptoms; dizzy, glassy eyed, sweaty, somewhat disoriented, tired.
18 2021-02-04 mobility decreased I had a sore arm that restricted movement, but that left after two days. I had a lot of abdominal pa... Read more
Close
I had a sore arm that restricted movement, but that left after two days. I had a lot of abdominal pain, nausea, loss of apatite. I had diarrhea and a headache as well.
18 2021-02-05 dizziness on second shot i got alot of symptoms/bad reactions. nausea, feeling light headed, aches in my body ... Read more
Close
on second shot i got alot of symptoms/bad reactions. nausea, feeling light headed, aches in my body everywhere, a nose bleed, high fevers (102.9). My left arm from where i got the injection was really swollen after two days prior from getting the vaccine.
18 2021-02-08 dizziness The symptoms began 10 minutes after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: dizzy, lighth... Read more
Close
The symptoms began 10 minutes after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: dizzy, lightheaded but BP elevated to 140s systolic, chest tightness, globus sensation with some difficulty swallowing but able to swallow zyrtec then head pain / headache that radiates down to neck. Given zyrtec. Not SOB and not wheezing, no rash or objective swelling of the face or oropharynx. The nurse reports that she cannot move her tongue very well. The treatment of the reaction was: o Antihistamines: zyrtec 10mg o Sent patient to ED
18 2021-02-09 dizziness The symptoms began 10 minutes after administration of the vaccine on 2/9. The symptoms were: dizzy, ... Read more
Close
The symptoms began 10 minutes after administration of the vaccine on 2/9. The symptoms were: dizzy, lightheaded but BP elevated to 140s systolic, chest tightness, globus sensation with some difficulty swallowing but able to swallow zyrtec then head pain / headache that radiates down to neck. Given zyrtec. Not SOB and not wheezing, no rash or objective swelling of the face or oropharynx. The nurse reports that she cannot move her tongue very well. The treatment of the reaction was: o Antihistamines: zyrtec 10mg o Sent patient to ED
18 2021-02-15 dizziness Near syncopal episode; Pale Skin color and light headed feeling. Pt and Father admitted patient doe... Read more
Close
Near syncopal episode; Pale Skin color and light headed feeling. Pt and Father admitted patient does not like needles and has had similar episodes when getting her Flu shots in the past. Vitals obtained. Medic unit evaluated her and performed EKG with no negative findings. Pt signed refusal form. Pt released to her Father to drive her home. He will be with her tonight for continued monitoring.
18 2021-02-15 fall Patient found on floor pale, diaphoretic, unconscious approximately 3 minutes after receiving vaccin... Read more
Close
Patient found on floor pale, diaphoretic, unconscious approximately 3 minutes after receiving vaccine. patient became suddenly alert on first attempt to rouse. Noted 5 cm reddened area on forehead which was assumedto be a result of hitting her head on the nearby plastic trash bin. Pt Ox3 upon awakening. She was aware that she had lost conscousness during a syncopal episode. She denied smilar reactions in the past. Rapid Response called. Ice applies, 11:35 BP 104/66, HR 79, SpO2 99%. Assisted to a sitting position. 11:40am BP 108/70, HR 72, SpO2 99% RR arrived. Pt assisted to WC then to cot. Denied Further dizziness. To ED via security vehicle, accompanied by security officer and MA from clinic.
18 2021-02-23 dizziness Strong cough about two and a half hours after vaccine. Started to feel lightheaded and short of brea... Read more
Close
Strong cough about two and a half hours after vaccine. Started to feel lightheaded and short of breath shortly after. Took 25mg of Benadryl and two puffs of ProAir rescue inhaler. Was given epinephrine, Xyzal, 4 more puffs of ProAir rescue inhaler, and one inhalation of Breo 100mg. Symptoms subsided after treatment and I went back to normal health.
18 2021-02-25 fall vasovagal fainted, fell. Resolved
18 2021-03-01 gait disturbance, dizziness Roughly 16 hours after receiving the first Moderna vaccine for COVID, woke up with dizziness, loss... Read more
Close
Roughly 16 hours after receiving the first Moderna vaccine for COVID, woke up with dizziness, loss of vision for a few minutes, shakiness, low grade fever, paleness, shaky walking ability, nausea, and loss of bowels in her clothing.
18 2021-03-03 dizziness, impaired driving ability The patient described sudden onset of dizziness with visual disturbances, amplified photosensitivity... Read more
Close
The patient described sudden onset of dizziness with visual disturbances, amplified photosensitivity, and double vision that occurred about 25 minutes after receiving the COVID19 (Moderna) vaccine. This lasted for about 20 minutes and then the visual effects subsided and she was able to drive. She reported that the dizziness did subsist for several hours at a low and tolerable level.
18 2021-03-04 dizziness pt got very pale, dizzy, light headed, sweaty, talked the whole time , was shakey .....we layed her ... Read more
Close
pt got very pale, dizzy, light headed, sweaty, talked the whole time , was shakey .....we layed her down , elevated feet, used ice packs, checked BP 106/87 , called paramedics, pt was fine when leaving
18 2021-03-07 dizziness 1442 vs 118/80, 86, 20, 99%. Pt c/o lightheaded, dizzy and ringing in the ears. No SOB, rash, hives... Read more
Close
1442 vs 118/80, 86, 20, 99%. Pt c/o lightheaded, dizzy and ringing in the ears. No SOB, rash, hives. Skin W/D. Pt is drinking orange juice. Pt has her mother here with her. 1447 Pt is feeling better. Her symptoms are gone. Vs are 118/60,84,20,99%. No other medical attention is needed. Pt's mother will drive her home. Pt and mother were advised to call 911 if any other symptoms arise. Pt's skins W/D, vs are good and no distress. Pt left at 1510 after 40 min observation.
18 2021-03-07 dizziness immediate rash, redness over entire body, shortness of breath, swelling and tightening of chest, diz... Read more
Close
immediate rash, redness over entire body, shortness of breath, swelling and tightening of chest, dizziness, extreme nausea and faintness,? spacey ? feeling all within 30 seconds of vaccine. administered benadryl 50 IM by pharmacists immediately. dizziness continued 3 hours. 911 called paramedics arrived and assessed. allowed to go home with parents.
18 2021-03-10 mobility decreased Extreme soreness (couldn't move my arm fully), as well as fatigue and muscle pain, nausea, and heada... Read more
Close
Extreme soreness (couldn't move my arm fully), as well as fatigue and muscle pain, nausea, and headaches. I couldn't move half of the day and was in so much pain I could not leave my room. My joints felt like they were burning and I couldn't stay in one position too long (more than 15-30 minutes) or I would get back pain. I couldn't sleep due to the pain
18 2021-03-12 dizziness During vaccine monitoring, patient's mother concerned that her daughter does not feel well. Patient ... Read more
Close
During vaccine monitoring, patient's mother concerned that her daughter does not feel well. Patient was feeling whoosy and did not have anything to eat that morning. Patient spit in a plastic bag and was given alcohol swabs to smell. Requested water but was told to have nothing by mouth at this time. Patient monitored for an additional 30 minutes and was better.
18 2021-03-12 dizziness Pt received vaccination at 1:30pm, pt ambulated to observation area, began feeling "dizzy and nauseo... Read more
Close
Pt received vaccination at 1:30pm, pt ambulated to observation area, began feeling "dizzy and nauseous" while standing in observation area. Pt ambulated to chair, at which time pt lost consciousness and her body became stiff, gagging sounds noted. Removed pt's mask, applied oxygen at 10l/min via face mask. pt regained consciousness within 30 -60 seconds. Vital signs BP 124/82, unable to assess sp02 due to cold fingers and nail polish. HR 102. Pt stated she continued to feel dizzy, and had tingling in her fingers. Vital signs reassessed at 1:43, BP 128/78, HR 80, unable to asses sp02 due to monitor not giving a reading. Vitals reassessed at 1:46pm, sp02 100%, HR 94. , began titrating oxygen supply down by 2l/min. Pt seemed to tolerate well for a few minutes, At 2:00pm, pt complained of tingling returning to her fingers, pt was receiving o2 4l/min, sp02 noted at 80%, increased 02 to 10l/min, called nursing lead who called 911. 2:10, unable to obtain accurate sp02. 2:17pm pt continues to receive 02 10l/min, stated she "feels okay, just weird and foggy" no tingling in hands. 2:20pm, paramedics arrive, pt states she is "a little bit dizzy" 2:35pm pt taken to hospital via stretcher with paramedics. Pt en route to hospital. At 2:00pm sp02 80%
18 2021-03-14 fall patient had seizure and hit floor
18 2021-03-14 vertigo, dizziness post vaccine: sudden onset of dizziness, vertigo sensation with nausea, witnessed near-syncopal even... Read more
Close
post vaccine: sudden onset of dizziness, vertigo sensation with nausea, witnessed near-syncopal event, "everything going black in color" per patient, skin clammy and pale/warm and diaphoretic, spinning sensation, bradycardia and mild hypotension with abnormal cardiac rhythm- EMS called by on-site paramedic at 12:55 12:50 HR 42, BP 90/64, SaO2 97, Resp 18, sinus bradycardia. GCS=15 1306= HR 105, BP 102/64, SaO2 98, Resp 16, Sinus tachycardia, GCS=15 13:16 blood glucose 175 mg/dL No medications required
18 2021-03-16 dizziness Approximately 7-8 minutes after receiving the vaccine, started to feel light-headed, thought she was... Read more
Close
Approximately 7-8 minutes after receiving the vaccine, started to feel light-headed, thought she was going to pass out, and her heart was racing extremely high. The health care team at the site took her blood pressure, measured heart rate, gave her water, juice and chocolate and tried to get her heart rate to drop. It was fluctuating up and down and she couldn't stand up without dizziness; we waited 45 minutes and then drove her home as she was unable to drive her own car. She was experiencing significant lightheadedness, and consistent heart racing even while lying down on the sofa/bed. This continued for several days and she stayed home from school and sports. We called her primary care doctor on the 10th and they suggested she wait another day to see how she was feeling. She started to feel a bit better by Friday, was still experiencing a bit of the tiredness, nauseous, light-headed and heart spikes, but was able to drive, move around. On Sunday evening, she started to experience increased heart rate again, lymph nodes were very painful and started experiencing the light headedness all evening. On Monday we took her to her primary care provider and they then referred her to ER for the heart racing and a EKG. The increased light headedness, feeling like she will pass out even while laying in bed, dizziness has all increased and her lymph nodes continue to be swollen and painful. It has been over a week since the vaccine and there is no clear sign of her reaction getting any better, if not worse. The EKG results indicated a new abnormality and we are trying to get her to a cardiologist. She is and had been a very healthy, varsity athlete that runs over 30 hours a week with track, and since receiving the first dose of the Moderna vaccine is unable to move very far within the house without feeling that she is going to pass out or that her heart rate is shooting up uncontrollably.
18 2021-03-16 dizziness Pt had received a covid vaccine and had a reaction. Pt had dizziness, visual changes, nausea. Per pt... Read more
Close
Pt had received a covid vaccine and had a reaction. Pt had dizziness, visual changes, nausea. Per pt, it had happened before when she received other vaccines. Pt was transferred from the vaccination site to the observation area where pt was further evaluated and observed. Pt was laid down on the gurney to rest. Then, she was given crackers and orange juice. After, 30 mins in the observation area. Pt stated that she felt much better and able to go. V/S: 109/71, 100, 20, 02 100%RA. Pt was stable when she left the clinic. Time: 1340-1415
18 2021-03-16 dizziness Patient reports feeling nauseous, dizzy, flushing, no palpitations. Reported feeling better after 10... Read more
Close
Patient reports feeling nauseous, dizzy, flushing, no palpitations. Reported feeling better after 10 minutes- cleared by EMS
18 2021-03-18 mobility decreased, dizziness 30 minutes after injection, patient developed a headache. 8 hours after injection, she started to ex... Read more
Close
30 minutes after injection, patient developed a headache. 8 hours after injection, she started to experience chills, muscle aches, nausea, and shooting pains. Patient was treated with 400 mg Ibuprofen and one 750 mg Tums. 16 hours after injection, patient could hardly move. She was treated with 1000 mg of Tylenol, 50 mg of Benadryl, and 1000 mg of Tums. 18 hours after injection, patient had profuse sweating, but was feeling better. 24 hours after injection, patient was too lightheaded to be able to stand up for any length of time. 28 hours after injection, patient finally was able to eat, but chills and shooting pains 4 hours later. She was treated with 400 mg Ibuprofen and within an hour started feeling better. When I checked on her this morning 42 hours after injection, she stated she was feeling 'okay.'
18 2021-03-20 gait inability, dizziness, fall 2 minutes after injection, patient became dizzy and could not walk. eventually she collapsed, was sw... Read more
Close
2 minutes after injection, patient became dizzy and could not walk. eventually she collapsed, was sweating, flushed, said she lost her hearing, and right arm was numb. she stayed this way at least half an hour. paramedics came to assist about 15 min. after onset.
18 2021-03-21 dizziness Received first COVID shot on 3/19/21. On 3/20/21 presenting to ER with weakness, achiness, fever, ... Read more
Close
Received first COVID shot on 3/19/21. On 3/20/21 presenting to ER with weakness, achiness, fever, shortness of breath after having coronavirus vaccination yesterday. Patient is sure she had coronavirus back in November. Received the vaccination yesterday about 11 am. Within a couple hours she developed severe myalgias, low-grade fever. Reports she feels a little short of breath from a myalgias. No history of DVT or PE, urinary complaints. Patient has syncopal episode while in triage. No seizure activity. Felt lightheaded with standing. Clinical Impression: 1. Syncope 2. Vaccination reaction, initial encounter Presentation consistent with orthostatic, vasovagal episode from recent vaccination. Patient coronavirus previously stimulating a stronger immune response. doubt infection, PE, worrisome arrthymia. Advised against second vaccination. return if any problems, worsening
18 2021-03-22 dizziness dizziness, lightheadiness, flushing, sweating, anxious, offered juice, observation done, symptoms re... Read more
Close
dizziness, lightheadiness, flushing, sweating, anxious, offered juice, observation done, symptoms resolved, pt went home
18 2021-03-22 dizziness Vasovagal syncope- felt lightheaded, almost passed out twice, and vomited.
18 2021-03-24 dizziness Received dose #1 of the Moderna COVID19 vaccine. A few minutes later at 10:50 AM while sitting in ob... Read more
Close
Received dose #1 of the Moderna COVID19 vaccine. A few minutes later at 10:50 AM while sitting in observation the pt c/o feeling light headed, hot, and nauseous. Pt has a history of anaphylaxis with allergy shots when she was 6yo that required an epi pen. Pt triaged by an RN. Pt was laid on cot. BP 120/80 HR 104 O2sat 99% Repeat BP 118/80 HR 88 O2sat 99% Pt continued to report feeling flushed, light headed, and nauseous even after laying down. EMS was called at 10:58 AM. EMS arrived and evaluated the pt. Pt was still not feeling well and stating she wanted to close her eyes. Pt was transported to Center for evaluated. Pt was A&O x3 when she left. Pt?s mother was present and followed the ambulance. Pt was given high risk HHC clinic information for scheduling of her 2nd vaccine.
18 2021-03-24 dizziness Hx of anxiety with imms but no hx of syncope, has never had any jerking or an anxiety attack before,... Read more
Close
Hx of anxiety with imms but no hx of syncope, has never had any jerking or an anxiety attack before, 15 seconds after imm pt pale and asks if she can sit here for a few minutes, RN asks if feeling lightheaded-no response, then lowers her head and draws up bil arms and begins rythmic jerking of bil arms and torso, RN calls code blue and second RN responds right away, pt safely lowered to the ground by two RN's-feet elevated, 911 called and VS obtained 110/60 98 16 98% on RA, after 20 seconds jerking self resolves, pt opens her eyes and immediately asks what happened, pupils remain dilated, she remember events up to asking if she can sit here for a minute, denies any tightness to chest or throat, denies difficulty breathing, no wheezing or rash noted by RN, pt laid on ground for about 10 minutes and was then escorted with 2 person assist to the lobby to wait for EMS to arrive, pt remained pale and clammy and light headed, 1305- pt father notified of incident 1320-RN gives report to EMS in lobby, pt still laying on ground with feet elevated but laughing and talking to her friends, BP now 114/64 and color is improved, RN advised her to follow up with her PCP 1330-pt sitting up in chair and BP 110/60

Found on floor pale, diaphoretic, unconscious approximately 3 minutes. Suddenly became alert on first attempt to rouse. Noted 5 cm reddened area on forehead as result of fall and hitting a plastic trash can. 18 2021-03-25 dizziness Pt was waiting in observation area after receiving her covid vaccine. PT began feeling dizzy and lig... Read more
Close
Pt was waiting in observation area after receiving her covid vaccine. PT began feeling dizzy and lightheaded. Pt fainted briefly and EMS responded immediately. Fire/Rescue immediately responded shortly after. Pt regained consciousness and was evaluated by EMS and Fire/Rescue. Pt stated she has this kind of medical episode every so often. Last episode was 3 months ago. Pt and EMS do not believe this was directly related to the Covid vaccine. Pts vital were stable and exited premises on her own. Pt had family waiting for her in the the parking lot.

18 2021-03-31 dizziness Pain and soreness in vaccination arm was immediate for the rest of the day. Started feeling achey an... Read more
Close
Pain and soreness in vaccination arm was immediate for the rest of the day. Started feeling achey and feverish at the end of the day towards nighttime and bedtime. Took a Tylenol before going to bed. Woke up at 6:00a.m. feeling achey and feverish again, more severe this time. Attempted to walk to get another Tylenol and take my temperature, vision blurred and was extremely cold, immediate nausea, felt like I was going to pass out. Shaking and chills. After drinking Gatorade, ginger ale and water and eating peanut butter toast, nausea settled. After a bit, experienced severe stomach cramps. Drank more ginger ale and Gatorade and took a Tylenol to relieve pain. After 30-45 minutes, pain relieved and I was able to go back to bed. Rest of the day experienced pounding headache and feverish and achey body. Experienced fever highest at 99.8 during the day. After 24 hours passed, feel 100% better and all symptoms and side effects relieved. Only thing sustaining is a little bit of pain and soreness in the arm.

18 2021-04-04 dizziness Right eye twinching; lightheadedness; rash on hands; Nausea; DOB; This case was received via an unkn... Read more
Close
Right eye twinching; lightheadedness; rash on hands; Nausea; DOB; This case was received via an unknown source (no reference has been entered for a health authority or license partner) on 10-Feb-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 11-Feb-2021. This spontaneous case was reported by a nurse (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of BLEPHAROSPASM (Right eye twinching), DIZZINESS (lightheadedness), RASH (rash on hands), NAUSEA (Nausea) and DYSPNOEA (DOB) in an 18-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 037K20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. Concurrent medical conditions included Penicillin allergy since January 2021. On 29-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 29-Jan-2021, the patient experienced BLEPHAROSPASM (Right eye twinching) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), DIZZINESS (lightheadedness) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), RASH (rash on hands) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), NAUSEA (Nausea) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and DYSPNOEA (DOB) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). At the time of the report, BLEPHAROSPASM (Right eye twinching), DIZZINESS (lightheadedness), RASH (rash on hands), NAUSEA (Nausea) and DYSPNOEA (DOB) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Treatment for the events include 0.5ml Epinephrine on the left thigh This case concerns an 18 Y/O F hospitalized with serious unexpected events of blepharospasm, dizziness, rash, nausea, dyspnea. Event outcomes unknown. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Reporter did not allow further contact; Sender's Comments: This case concerns an 18 Y/O F hospitalized with serious unexpected events of blepharospasm, dizziness, rash, nausea, dyspnea. Event outcomes unknown. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Patient became dizzy, pale about 10 minutes following Moderna #1 vaccine. BP 85/47, P 53, patient laid flat with feet on chair. Five minutes later, second BP 128/78, patient's color resumed normal, reports no dizziness; Ten minutes later, third BP 123/72. Patient was drinking water and eating peanut butter crackers with mother, able to ambulate on own after waiting approximately 30 minutes from vaccination time.

Close
Pt had 2nd dose of covid vaccine moderna 1725. At 1735 pt complain of Dizziness and a little numbness on the right side. VS done BP 136/86, RR 16, HR 86, O2 sat 99% at RA. At 0540 Rash appeared on pt chest , PA notified, PA assess pt And rash begin to appear on pt neck and face, Verbal order of Benadryl 50 mg IM ordered by PA. Verbal orders from PA conveyed through department-approved policies and procedures. Given 50 mg Benadryl IM on pt right deltoid. Pt tolerated it well. 911 activated at 1740. PT BP 122/95, HR, 116, RR 16, O2 sat of 98 %. . 1745 911 on scene BP of 140/89 , HR 94, RR 17, O2 sat 98% at 2lpm via nasal canula. At 1750 Ambulance came and pt left with stable condition , rash getting better pt is alert oriented x4. Left clinic at 1750 with rig pt will go to ER. BP of 143/102, HR 83, RR 16 O2 sat 98% .

Close
Patient started feeling, nauseous, heated and lightheaded. She seemed like she was maybe going to faint, she never lost consciousness. Pharmacy staff placed the patient lying down on the floor, gave her a cool wet cloth and monitored her for worsening symptoms. 18 2021-04-07 fall, dizziness Patient is an 18 year old female with no PMHx that presented with lightheadedness and three subseque... Read more
Close
Patient is an 18 year old female with no PMHx that presented with lightheadedness and three subsequent episodes of syncope approximately 3-10 minutes post-vaccination. Patient was found to have an abrasion to the outer corner of her right eyebrow following an unwitnessed. It was unknown if patient was seated or standing at the time. The nurse first on scene states the patient lost consciousness briefly again and experienced approximately 10 seconds of upper extremity muscle contractions (described as convulsions). Patient experienced a loss of bladder control upon loss of consciousness. Patient was lowered to the ground to be in a supine position by healthcare staff. At this time, patient was alert and oriented without agitation or confusion. Patient denies memory of the event. She states she had prior episodes of fainting after blood draw. Patient has no allergies to medication or food. No past surgical history. No prior hospitalizations. Denies personal and family history seizure disorders, cardiac disturbances, and hypoglycemic or hyperglycemic events. Patient was hooked up to cardiac monitor and found to be in normal sinus rhythm with a heart rate of 64bpm. Vitals Orthostatic BP measurements Lying supine - 110/72 Seated - 124/76 Standing - 128/72 HR: 64 bpm RR: 16 breaths/min without distress SO2: 99% On examination, patient was A&Ox3 without lethargy, agitation, or confusion. Patient has an abrasion to the superior aspect of the right orbit (outer eyebrow) without laceration or bleeding. Patient was diaphoretic and pale following event. Normal cardiac rate and rhythm. Radial pulses intact, strong and equal bilaterally. No obvious nystagmus. Upon standing, patient steady on her feet without abnormal gait.
18 2021-04-07 fall Initially she passed out following the vaccine - within 90 seconds- she has a history of passing out... Read more
Close
Initially she passed out following the vaccine - within 90 seconds- she has a history of passing out with injections and blood draws. Around noon she had a seizure. She describes a feeling of darkness and dread closing in on her and she was unable to speak or move. She was on the stairs at the time. I witnessed her stiffen, then go limp and fall between the electric stair hair and the wall. She hit the hardwood floor face first then she began to shake/twitch. She was unconscious. She awoke screaming, incoherent speech, and flailing limbs. It took about 5 minutes to calm her and be able to understand her speech. She only remembers the darkness and waking up scared and feeling awful. She was put supine on the floor with feet elevated, blood pressure monitored, given juice to drink, and vitals checked routinely. After about an hour supine and conscious, she felt good enough to sit up. She sat up for 15 minutes before she was able to stand with assistance. Family physician was notified immediately and we are still waiting for a response. She has a goose egg sized knot on her forehead, a bruise on the side of her face and a black eye from hitting the floor. She has a huge bruise on her outer thigh and lower leg where she hit the stair chair and then seized and it it repeatedly on the metal. She has underarm pain from where her armpit hit the edge of the stairs when she fell and seized. She has no history of any types of seizures.

18 2021-04-10 mobility decreased I had horrible shaking/trembling in my arms, chest, and legs about six hours after the vaccine, and ... Read more
Close
I had horrible shaking/trembling in my arms, chest, and legs about six hours after the vaccine, and they continued for about four hours more, uncontrollably. I passed out briefly around 12 hours after the vaccine, and I'm not sure how long I remained unconscious. Through all of this, my left arm was difficult to move or use, I felt hot suddenly and then cold, and I was tired. The next day, the most serious side effects were gone, but I remained feverish, tired, and largely unable to move my left arm. Those side effects were gone on the third day and now I'm better.

18 2021-04-19 dizziness The 12:20 pm appointment today (4/20/21) had an adverse reaction to the IMZ. Patient was done receiv... Read more
Close
The 12:20 pm appointment today (4/20/21) had an adverse reaction to the IMZ. Patient was done receiving the vaccine at about 12:30 pm and I stated she would have to wait until 12:45 pm. Around 12:38 pm I noticed she looked a little pale and went to her side to check on her. The patient stated she was feeling light-headed, dizzy, nauseous, and had trouble with her vision. I had the patient lay down and elevate her feet. The technician also grabbed an ice pack to place behind her neck. Asked if she would like water. The patient then stated she was having trouble breathing/short of breath and her ears were ringing. Once the patient stated issues with breathing 911 was called. A code white had been called and management was in the pharmacy. The 911 operator continued to ask questions about the patient's status and stated to not give any water or medications. I continued to assess the patient's symptoms. Her vision improved; however, she continued to feel light-headed, nauseous, and having trouble breathing. A member of EMS was in the store and came over to assess the patient. He had the patient sit up but she continued to have the same symptoms. He assessed her IMZ site. She was not feeling itchy and had not developed any hives. The ambulance arrived. EMS evaluated the patient and then took her out of the store on the stretcher.
18 2021-04-20 dizziness, vertigo, gait inability Cannot even walk around normally; swollen lymph nodes; patient cannot walk with out dizziness; Dizzi... Read more
Close
Cannot even walk around normally; swollen lymph nodes; patient cannot walk with out dizziness; Dizziness with room spinning; Unstable blood pressure; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DIZZINESS POSTURAL (patient cannot walk with out dizziness) in an 18-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 036A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No medical history reported.). On 09-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 09-Feb-2021, the patient experienced DIZZINESS POSTURAL (patient cannot walk with out dizziness) (seriousness criterion disability), DIZZINESS (Dizziness with room spinning) and BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Unstable blood pressure). On 13-Feb-2021, the patient experienced LYMPHADENOPATHY (swollen lymph nodes). On an unknown date, the patient experienced GAIT INABILITY (Cannot even walk around normally). At the time of the report, DIZZINESS POSTURAL (patient cannot walk with out dizziness), DIZZINESS (Dizziness with room spinning), BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Unstable blood pressure), GAIT INABILITY (Cannot even walk around normally) and LYMPHADENOPATHY (swollen lymph nodes) had not resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 09-Feb-2021, Heart rate: increased (High) increased. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. Relevant Text: The Patient's mother reported that the patient received their first dose on 9 Feb 2021 and approximately 10 minutes post receiving the vaccine the patient developed severe dizziness and had an increase in their heart rate. The patient also had an unstable blood pressure. Few days later, the patient developed swelling in their lymph nodes. The reporter reported that the symptoms were still ongoing and now the patient cannot even walk without dizziness. It was also reported that the patient cannot even get back to the competitive sports and was not able to walk around anymore normally. The patient had multiple visits to the cardiologist, ENT, and pediatrician with no clear explanation of what happened to the patient. No Concomitant product use was reported. No treatment information was provided. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Looking at the clinical scenario, the event postural dizziness is persisting 6wks from onset with no clear explanation, it is assessed as a SAE (disability). However, medical history and concomitant medications, reports of tests/diagnostics are needed for further assessment. Additional information is requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Looking at the clinical scenario, the event postural dizziness is persisting 6wks from onset with no clear explanation, it is assessed as a SAE (disability). However, medical history and concomitant medications, reports of tests/diagnostics are needed for further assessment. Additional information is requested.

Stroke/left side of the body; Can't talk; can't walk; This spontaneous case was reported by a non-health professional and describes the occurrence of CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke/left side of the body) in a 19-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 011J20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (no medical history reported). On 31-Dec-2020, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 31-Dec-2020, the patient experienced CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke/left side of the body) (seriousness criteria disability and medically significant), APHASIA (Can't talk) and GAIT INABILITY (can't walk). At the time of the report, CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke/left side of the body), APHASIA (Can't talk) and GAIT INABILITY (can't walk) outcome was unknown. Not Provided The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown Route) was unknown. There was no concomitant medications reported. No treatment medications were provided. Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested. Reporter did not allow further contact; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
18 2021-04-23 dizziness Patient is an 18 year old female A & O x4 with chief complaint of feeling light headed and dizzy. P... Read more
Close
Patient is an 18 year old female A & O x4 with chief complaint of feeling light headed and dizzy. Patient was sitting in the observation area and began experiencing symptoms when she saw another patient have a syncopal episode. Patient was placed in a seated position and vital signs obtained. Vital signs stable and patient denied any other complaint. Patient denied any medical history, allergies and took prophylactic ibuprofen prior to coming to the vaccine. Medical staff already on scene immediately assumed patient care. Patient signed AMA and went home driven by a friend via private vehicle.

Patient seemed to be fine right after I administered the vaccine. She sat in our room for 15 minutes then left. She came back shortly saying she was feeling a little funny so she wanted to sit in our room. She left again after several minutes then came back around 5:20 saying she felt like she was going to pass out. I told her to sit in our waiting room. She said she felt faint and had tightness in her chest. I called the paramedics who arrived shortly after. They said she had anxiety. She was anxious before and after receiving the vaccine. She left on her own.

18 2021-04-26 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Nausea-Severe
18 2021-04-26 dizziness Patient had felt nervous prior to getting her 2nd shot. I asked if she had every had any serious rea... Read more
Close
Patient had felt nervous prior to getting her 2nd shot. I asked if she had every had any serious reactions from previous medicines or vaccines, she stated "no". I then asked how she did after her first shot and she said ok. While waiting her 15 min in the observation area she alerted us that she was feeling extremely hot. We brought her back into the IMZ booth and had her sit in the chair and turned a fan in her direction. I sat down with her an asked her questions and kept her talking to try to calm her down. She stated that she felt as if the chair was swaying a little. We laid out a yoga mat on the floor in the booth, had her lay down and elevate her feet in a chair. She began to get upset and I asked if she had anyone with her, she was able to open her phone and gave me permission to call her family member. Family member came in the store and was able to help calm her down. We gave her some water and had her rest. I monitored her pulse and face/lip color. She became a little flushed. She was able to leave on her own accord, I did walk out with her to ensure she made it safely. I called 2 hours later to check on her and she stated she was feeling better, less dizzy, but just a little tired.

18 2021-04-28 dizziness 19 years old female presented at COVID clinic (08210) for her second dose of COVID vaccine (Moderna)... Read more
Close
19 years old female presented at COVID clinic (08210) for her second dose of COVID vaccine (Moderna). Patient reported having needle anxiety. Pharmacist confirmed with the patient if she experienced any adverse reaction after she received her first dose. Patient stated after first dose she felt week but nothing major happened. About 8-10 minutes after vaccine was given, patients started having some side effect such as nausea/vomiting and dizziness. she stated that she feels burning up. She denied any shortness of breath. Pharmacist used cold wet towel to rub her forehead and back of her neck. Blood pressure was checked and it was128/80, HR was 70. Store manager and pharmacist manager were notified. One of the technician called patient's mom. Patient stated she had not ate any thing in the morning so she was given water and some protein bar. Patient waited until all symptoms resolved (with supervision of the pharmacist) and after she felt better patient's mom took her home.
18 2021-04-28 dizziness Approximately 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine the patient reported feeling lightheaded. Patie... Read more
Close
Approximately 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine the patient reported feeling lightheaded. Patient reported no vision changes, no problems breathing or talking. She said she does not like needles and that could have been the issue. I asked her to remain seated in observation and got her a cup of water. She drank with no problems swallowing. Reported no other symptoms. After approximately 5 minutes patient reported feeling about the same. After an additional approximate 5 minutes patient reported feeling much better. She remained in observation for approximately 5 more minutes, totaling approximately 30 minutes and reported feeling good. I offered for her to remain in observation as she felt comfortable but at that point she said she felt good and would call the pharmacy with any questions or concerns.

Seizure... 1/2 hour prior to incident patient was with friends in a classroom leisurely using PowerPoint. She reports she had pain in her teeth and her chest felt tight. She just didn't feel well. Closer to incident student felt dizzy, like she was "going to pass out". States she turned to someone to tell that person she was not feeling well "but I couldn't talk; the words would not come out". She felt herself sway and then knew she fell to the floor. She felt like she was lying still for a bit but she could hear people around her and she heard someone say "somebody start timing this" (as if they knew it was a seizure).

Close
Patient reported to immunizer that she did not like needles. Following her vaccine, the patient walked around the pharmacy shopping during wait time. Once at POS counter, she collapsed (did not hit head) ~5pm. Patient thought she half fell and half sat down. She sat on floor leaning against cupboard. She reported reduced vision and hearing. BP ~100/60mmHg at ~5:05pm. She was provided water and cool cloth. Friend was brought into store from parking lot to be with her as well. She reported vision improving and was able to go back into vaccination room to rest. She reported not eating much that day - patient was provided with Hershey candy bar and sucker. ~5:15pm her BP was 100/62 and she continued to feel better/improve. 5:35pm patient reported felt well enough to go home (with friend). Throughout event, patient declined call parents or anyone else.

Close
Febrile beginning at 1600, 100.5 degrees, peaking at 2100, 104degrees, accompanied with tightness in chest with mild difficulty breathing and extreme muscle weakness most notably in extremities, bilaterally. Needed assistance to stand and could not hold a pencil to write. Also numbness and tingling in hands and fingers. Face slightly swollen and red. 400 mg Ibuprofen was administered at 1530. Pushed fluids as soon as fever began. Cooling measures provided, cool shower, cold compress, change of clothes to light pajamas. We contacted our Insurance 24 hour Nurse line at approximately 2100 when symptoms peaked. The RN on staff instructed us to seek immediate medical care. We attempted to find an open Urgent Care unsuccessfully and tried to go to an ER but they were full. Fever began to come down around 2230, so we returned home. Continued with ibuprofen every six hours and cooling measures.

18 2021-05-22 dizziness Client received her 2nd Moderna shot (Lot# 024C21A) at 15:40 and client's mother was accompanying he... Read more
Close
Client received her 2nd Moderna shot (Lot# 024C21A) at 15:40 and client's mother was accompanying her. After receiving the shot, client went to observation room to sit in a chair. At 15:45 EMT noticed client feeling drowsy. EMT approached client and her mother. Client stated she felt like she was going to pass out. Mother helped client stay upright in chair while EMT grabbed recliner chair. EMT transferred client to recliner chair and notified Lead RNs over waki taki. EMT took client's vitals at 15:50 (BP: 122/82, HR: 78) and gave client a bottle of water. Lead RN arrived in observation room at 15:52. EMT communicated that client was clammy, diaphoretic and nauseous. Client stated she was already feeling better and that the symptoms only lasted 2 minutes. Client stated she was not experiencing SOB or difficulty breathing. Client was alert and oriented times 4. Client also stated she experienced the same exact symptoms after her 1st dose of Moderna. Client stated she feels like she is going to pass out when she gets shots, but that it passes quickly. Client stated she has no underlying conditions, takes no medications, and has no known allergies. Client also stated she did not take any medication or receive treatment for these symptoms after receiving her 1st Moderna dose. Client stated she ate and drank plenty prior to getting her 1st and 2nd shot and was feeling completely fine. Client sat up in the recliner chair and sat for a bit longer. EMT took vitals again at 16:14 (BP: 132/96 HR: 82, RR: 16). Client stood up from chair and felt fine. Client left with mother at 16:18. Client walked upright with a steady gait when leaving.

One hour after receiving vaccine complaint of itchy hands and felt as if "ants were crawling all over her". She said has an allergy to Latex and was previously wearing Lavender Nitrile gloves. No hives or erythema on exam, some mild erythema to area after scratching hands with nails, no raised wheals. Sensation of pruritis spread to back and neck without urticaria. Diphenhydramine 50mg was administered. Approximately 30 minutes patient complained of nausea and was give Ondansetron 4mg which alleviated nausea. Pruritis resolved but approx 30 min patient began to feel tired, dizzy and lightheaded. Vitals were taken and orthostatic blood pressures were performed. All vitals were normal, oxygen saturation was normal and injection site was without erythema and no evidence of urticaria. Physical exam was also performed and no abnormalities to heart or lungs were auscultated.

Close
Patient became woozy when she returned to her second floor work area. Her colleagues came to get me in the auditorium. When RN and I reached patient she was very weak, she was sitting in a chair. I instructed her colleauges to call 911 immediately. Patient was having a little trouble breathing. I think she was scared. I gave her 10 mlL of benedryl and RN administered a 0.5 mL dose of epinephine in her left arm. Patient was helped to the floor and her feet were elevated. RN put on a blood pressure cuff. Before she could get a reading, the paramedics were there and took over. Patient was transported to Hospital.

19 2021-01-17 dizziness The day of vaccination, the patient presented to the emergency room with a complaint of dizziness an... Read more
Close
The day of vaccination, the patient presented to the emergency room with a complaint of dizziness and syncope. Reported that she became dizzy, presyncopal feelings, and had a witnessed syncopal event. The patient stated she does have vasovagal syncopal events after blood draws in the past. The patient was assigned an overnight admission for a potential post-vaccination adverse event, new onset atrial fibrillation, dehydration, and syncope. Patient was discharged the following day.
19 2021-01-19 gait inability Approximately 15-20 minutes after vaccination patient developed weakness in her limbs. BP and gluco... Read more
Close
Approximately 15-20 minutes after vaccination patient developed weakness in her limbs. BP and glucose were normal. Approximately 10 minutes after the onset of symptoms the patient developed bright red rash on the face, increased breath rate, and swelling of the lips and tongue. She was having difficulty talking due to shortness of breath and swelling in the tongue. 911 was called and epinephrine 0.3mg IM was administered as well as diphenhydramine 100mg orally. Her rash improved fairly quickly, swelling went down a small amount. She stated breathing still felt labored and she was feeling like her heart was racing but she was also tired (likely due to medications administered). She was still having difficulty talking, taking short breaths between almost each word. Paramedics arrived approximately 12 minutes after epinephrine was administered. They attempted to walk her to the ambulance per her request, however she was unable to feel her legs. She was placed on a stretcher and into the ambulance. The patient stated she was given additional epinephrine in the ambulance as her condition had worsened by the time they got her in there. She was taken to the ER and given additional diphenhydramine and was observed until approximately midnight, when she said she was discharged. Follow up was completed the following day, and she had improved dramatically. She was still feeling a bit weak, but no longer had any issues breathing.

She cam back in side the room and we had a nurse assess her, her BP and heart rate were a little elevated. We gave her some water and had her sit for some extra time while we talked to her. She has a child hood trauma regarding vaccine and had just had a major panic attack before and during her vaccination. We were all pretty sure she had just worked her self up and was not feeling well because of that and she said as much herself. After about 15-20 more minutes her BP and heart rate were back to normal and although still feeling a little weak she was ready to go home with her mother.

19 2021-03-30 dizziness I got my shot, sat down, and was reading through the information that the clinic provided me. A few ... Read more
Close
I got my shot, sat down, and was reading through the information that the clinic provided me. A few minutes after, I noticed my right arm was getting warm, but I thought I was being paranoid (placebo effect). I began to feel nauseated. About another 5 minutes after feeling warm and nauseous, my ears began to ring and my vision went white. I was cold but sweating. I have passed out a handful of times before for various reasons, so I knew what was happening. I tried to signal to a volunteer from my seat that I needed help, but I ended up laying on the ground by my chair before someone came over. Once I laid down, the attention of the volunteers and nurses was on me. Three came over to assist me. They held my legs up, kept a hand on my wrist for a pulse, and fetched water. I talked myself through the dizziness and ringing in my ears. They put a cold rag on my forehead and had smelling salts on hand. Once I began to feel better, they helped me slowly sit up, and eventually helped me stand up and get into a chair. They kept a close eye on me for the next 30 minutes to make sure I didn?t have any other reactions.

C/O dizziness. BP 77/64, pulse 74, O2 Sat 100% on RA. Encouraged to stay for additional Observation & agreed. Sat in chair with feet elevated & had water to drink. Symptoms resolved, BP 88/62, Pulse 77, & O2 sat 100%. Encouraged to follow up with ER, Urgent Care, & Primary Physician. Verbalized Understanding. Awake, Alert, & Oriented.

19 2021-04-01 dizziness I received my second dose of the COVID 19 Moderna vaccine on Tuesday morning. By Tuesday night I sta... Read more
Close
I received my second dose of the COVID 19 Moderna vaccine on Tuesday morning. By Tuesday night I started to have virtually every side effect that Moderna listed including; fatigue, headache, muscle pain, joint pain, chills, nausea and vomiting, and extreme fever. The next morning as I woke up in attempt tp get ready for work, I was not feeling any better and began to feel light headed, and felt the need to vomit. As I had the feeling of needing to vomit, I turned to do so and fainted. From accounts by my family, I was told I woke up, and quickly passed out a second time. As I was awoken, there was probably a minute before I fainted for a third time. All three times I was told I lost consciousness. I was awoken and by that point my family had contacted emergency responders. Paramedics arrived and took all necessary vitals. I did not pass out after that third time. As I expected all side effects Moderna listed, I did not expect to feel as bad as I did and I thought it was worth reporting what happened to be the next day. It caused a panic and I was scared and nervous as I was unsure why that was happening. I've tried to look up articles and links between passing out and the vaccine and all I can find is people fainting as they get the vaccine (which is common for any shot) but nothing for fainting that long after the vaccine was administered. I just wanted to report my incident.

Close
Patient experienced just lightheadedness after receiving the vaccine within 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine. No swelling; no rash; no bronchospasms; no trouble breathing. Patient laid down and drank some water. Patient felt better and left after 15 minutes of resting and gathering herself. When checking up on the patient, she stated that she generally gets lightheaded after any vaccination. Patient was offered water on site, monitored, and felt fine afterwards.

Close
About 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine, teammate went to stand up and got dizzy. Pt advised to sit back down and wait a bit. RN out to assess pt and again pt was ok sitting but upon standing noted wobbly and asked to sit back down. She did complain of dizziness at this time with some slight shortness of breath. BP noted in 120's with several checks, diastolic BP noted in 70's with heart rate noted 90-110 which per pt elevated HR normal for pt. At this time she did state that she was having some cardiac workup completed and just had on that was removed on 23rd March. At this time pt was brought back to treatment floor for further evaluation with ambulation assistance by RN. Pt was placed on oxygen 2 liters. BP's remained normal in 120's and HR as well between 90-100. Each time pt felt ok and went to stand she became dizzy and noted wobbly thus asked to sit but BP's remained normal. Pt states she ate some cucumbers and another fruit prior to coming. Pt at 1230 up to restroom with noted vomiting. After vomiting pt stated she was feeling much better. BP noted 124/84 temp 98.1 with c/o of n/v but no other symptoms while in restroom. Left arm noted some patchy redness after pt was itching the arm. At this time pt was given Benadryl 25 mg 2 tablets PO. Continued to monitor pt for about 30 minutes with redness subsiding on her arm, while all vitals remained stable. At this time pt was eager to leave and head home. at 1300 BP noted at 119/73 HR at 100. All symptoms subsided and while pt was standing no wobbling noted. Dr. was phoned and notified of the event as he is the medical director. Pt was given RN number to call when she arrived home.

I could barely sleep or get out of bed. I was very dizzy and very weak. I had chills and sweats. I was either really cold or really hot, no in between. I was fatigued for a week after the vaccine. 19 2021-04-09 dizziness Patient received 2nd Moderna vaccine. Patient felt lightheaded and fainted 5 minutes after getting t... Read more
Close
Patient received 2nd Moderna vaccine. Patient felt lightheaded and fainted 5 minutes after getting the vaccine. Firefighters and patient's mother brought her outside the observation room for more privacy and sat patient down on a chair with her head tilted down, and patient regained consciousness within 1 to 2 minutes. Patient's blood pressure and pulse were both low and patient stated she couldn't hear out of her left ear. Firefighters decided to call the ambulance and send the patient to the nearest emergency room. I followed up with the patient the next day on 4/10/2021. Patient stated she had a vasovagal response to the injection and received IV fluids at the emergency room. Patient stated it was very unexpected and she had ate before coming to the clinic. She has not felt lightheaded or faint since the incident and is experiencing flu-like symptoms from the vaccine and has been taking Tylenol for it.

Close
At 0835 client received the modern vaccine. 0842 client complained of feeling lightheaded. Client was pale. Client was placed in wheelchair and taken to post-vac area for vitals and observation. Father with client at time of incident. 0844 client was placed in position with feet up in the wheelchair. Client had verbalized during receiving any vaccine she usually has the same episodes and usually brings chocolate chips to eat to prevent this. 0853 BP: 90/60 P: 73 Sp02:99 RA. 0858 pt moved from floor to sitting position. pt denied any dizziness upon ambulation. BP:92/62 P: 65 Sp02 100% RA. pt denied any further issues A&O x4. Symptoms resolved approx 16 min after initial episode. Father will be driving patient home. No further treatment needed, pt left 09:15.
19 2021-04-12 fall, dizziness I administered Moderna COVID-19 vaccination to patient. I advised patient to wait 15 minutes post va... Read more
Close
I administered Moderna COVID-19 vaccination to patient. I advised patient to wait 15 minutes post vaccination. Patient was sitting in post vaccination waiting area chair. Approximately 10 minutes after vaccination, patient's mother alerted us for assistance. Patient was slumped over in chair and had fainted. Patient was pale and had complained of dizziness to her mother prior to passing out. Responded to patient and helped patient to the floor to avoid hitting her head. Called 911. Patient responded and woke up. Had patient continue laying on floor until EMS arrived. EMS took patient's blood pressure and blood sugar. No significant medical history or known allergies. No history of passing out after vaccinations. Patient said she had not eaten yet today. Patient's blood pressure was low and EMS indicated that patient was dehydrated.

Close
Patient was very nervous upon receiving vaccine and told immunizing tech that she had previously fainted upon donating blood. Immediately after receiving the shot, she said she felt like fainting. Her mother walked her to the observation chair for monitoring. She fainted and her mother along with two grocery associates went to hold her from falling off the chair. Two paramedics who happened to be a few feet away came to assist and took her vitals. Other medics arrived and took her to the hospital.

Close
I woke up the day after my second shot completely weak and felt very feverish. I got out of bed and tried to eat yogurt, but felt nauseous and got lightheaded so I had to sit down. I drank some tea and water and went back to bed for 4 hours. I woke up again and still felt terrible and could not even walk short distances without getting very pale, sweaty, and my vision having spots. I feel chills, a headache, and have been lying down all day. I am most concerned about passing out and becoming unconscious. I called the Wellness Center and they said to just lie down and stay hydrated

She laid down for 15 minutes and said she could leave but we asked her to stay seated and see how she feels and then after another 15 minutes she said she is fine and left and after an hour called to let us know she is feeling fine.

19 2021-04-17 dizziness A few minutes after getting the vaccine she started getting light-headed, nauseous, sweats, and blur... Read more
Close
A few minutes after getting the vaccine she started getting light-headed, nauseous, sweats, and blurred vision prior to getting up and informing the pharmacy staff. Pharmacist gave water. She had turned a yellow color. Mother gave liquid Benadryl - adult dose. Epi was offered - but not use. Decided to see if Benadryl got her back to normal. After the sweat she got chilled. Waited at the pharmacy for about an hour as her color came back to normal. Had pharmacists take her blood pressure prior to leaving. It was 106/70. Which would be close to her normal range. Pharmacist initially had trouble getting pulse and blood pressure but was also using the same arm the vaccination was put into. Pharmacist got that blood pressure off the alternate arm. She went to lunch with Mother afterwards. Mother stayed with her until around 4:00 p.m. Shot was around 12:30 p.m. She went to sleep when she got back to her dorm and missed evening class. She has not noted any other side effects other than the tiredness, but she is a college student that's known to have low iron, was on her period, that just went through a trauma event that probably would have jumped her adrenaline, and she was giving some liquid Benadryl. I'm sure any one of those could keep the fatigue. There was a call put into the doctor but she's procrastinating on getting back to them. No rash or difficulty breathing was noticed.

She does not know if she hit her head or not. She was on the ground and we got her leaning up against the wall sitting down. She said she was not feeling well before she fainted (did not report to staff) and then she did not remember passing out. She felt nauseous and hot/clammy afterwards.

19 2021-04-22 dizziness Within 5 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient indicated that it felt like her whole body was on ... Read more
Close
Within 5 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient indicated that it felt like her whole body was on fire and she felt faint. She was already seated for observation following the dose. An Epi-Pen and ammonia inhalants were removed from the emergency kit for possible use. Pt stated she was not having difficulty breathing and no closing of her throat. The ammonia inhalant helped the patient focus and she stated that it made her feel better. Pharmacy staff called 911 and the EMS crew arrived in approximately 5 minutes. They evaluated the patient and transported her to the local emergency room. A couple of hours later the patient called and said she had been discharged and was doing well. While in the emergency room she broke out in hives and was given epinephrine and benadryl per her conversation. Later her father came to the pharmacy and confirmed the same. She will see her primary care doctor on Monday.

19 2021-04-22 fall, dizziness Patient was given her first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. Patient had stated that she had fe... Read more
Close
Patient was given her first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. Patient had stated that she had felt lightheaded when she was given 4 vaccines at one time in the past. We advised patient to remain seated for 15 minutes for monitoring. Patient felt more comfortable standing next to her seated sister, who had also received the vaccine. The sister said the patient had told her she started feeling lightheaded and walked over to sit down on the other chair. Once seated, per the sister, the patient slumped to the floor and started shaking. At this point, we were alerted, but after a few seconds, the shaking had stopped and the patient was fully alert. The patient was unaware of what had happened. We called 911 and paramedics came to assess the patient. The patient remained seated on the ground until paramedics arrived. The paramedics assessed her vitals and everything was normal. The paramedics were comfortable with the patient going home with her sister, but upon standing up, the patient felt lightheaded again. At this point, the paramedics thought it would be best for the patient to be monitored at the hospital. The patient agreed to be taken to for further monitoring.

Patient reports today for second dose of Moderna vaccination. No known reaction to first dose of vaccine. During observation patient lost consciousness 5 minutes post injection, tipping over backwards and hitting head on the floor. Patient was unresponsive with strong pulse. Emergency response was activated and smelling salts were administered. Patient came to after smelling salts were given. While patient was coming to, mild seizing was noted. Patient noted headache after coming to. Emergency services arrived for extended assistance prior to releasing patient.

19 2021-04-29 mobility decreased 4/28 @ 4 pm day of vaccine, lower back achy & stabbing pain, like laying on nails. 1 hour later prog... Read more
Close
4/28 @ 4 pm day of vaccine, lower back achy & stabbing pain, like laying on nails. 1 hour later progressed to include middle back, by 6 pm entire back to base of neck in pain & stabbing pain would focus on 3-4 spots and move around. Fever 99.8 @7:23 pm, 100.5 @ 7:46. Bad chills all evening. Advil taken. 4/29 back pain improved when fever decreased but worsened as fever increased. Advil & later tylenol. Hot & then cold throughout day. By 1 pm, back pain just middle & lower back, by 5 pm just lower back, woke on 4/30 and back pain gone. Arm pain at injection site began 2 hours after vaccine, couldn't raise arm more than 2 ft from legs, pain better but still persists.
19 2021-04-29 vertigo About roughly two weeks after receiving this vaccine I had a migraine. I had never had a migraine be... Read more
Close
About roughly two weeks after receiving this vaccine I had a migraine. I had never had a migraine before so I went to urgent care, where they told me it would probably go away in a couple of days. It didn't, and I was having a whole horde of visual symptoms (floaters, flashing lights, photophobia, visual aura) so I went to Mass Eye and Ear ER about a week later. They did an examination of my eyes and told me it was all okay, and most likely due to a migraine. I assumed it would go away once more, but never did, with the symptoms continuing to become more frequent/severe. While the actual migraine part (head hurting to specify) would come and go, my visual symptoms never subsided. And despite MEE saying my vision was actually 20/15, so I could still objectively see fine, it was just not normal. I started to have vertigo, and more visual auras (a plain green line in my vision for a couple of minutes), and with these symptoms going on for about two weeks at this point, I went to an urgent care appointment at MGH, through my doctor. They administered some migraine medication (sumatriptan and zofran), but my visual symptoms did not improve. I was then sent to MGH er. They tested me for a whole myriad of things, as well as administering an MRI/MRA of the brain, and MRI of the spine, as well as performing a spinal tap, none of which yielded any significant findings. Many of my visual symptoms still persist, and the headache part, as well as vertigo, comes and goes. It has been almost a month since receiving the first dose and I am waiting to see if symptoms improve with the second. While it is obviously unclear as to whether this happened due to the vaccine or due to a third unknown factor, considering these symptoms developed roughly around the time you allegedly start to gain a significant immunity to COVID, and that no medical professionals have been able to find a clear reason for them, I feel as though it is possible and likely. (Also, I had previously had COVID, testing positive Jan 18th 2021, if that's of any relevance).
19 2021-05-01 dizziness Pt said that in the past she has fainted in the past with other vaccines. Pt was also currently fast... Read more
Close
Pt said that in the past she has fainted in the past with other vaccines. Pt was also currently fasting which probably contributed to the episode. Patient was given vaccine and felt fine immediately afterwards, she sat in our immunization room for a few minutes before standing. She then walked to our "waiting area" and sat down. About 5 minutes after, she said she felt dizzy and asked for water. We asked her to sit and would bring her water. Pharmacist (reporter for VAERS) brought water out to her and she fainted in her presence. Pharmacist kept patient upright to prevent her from sliding to the floor. Patient said she has lost vision (was just a bright light). By this point the paramedics have already been called. Patient was feeling much better by the time paramedics came, but they still wanted to check her out to make sure everything was ok. Patient had a long drive back home so not sure what the outcome was.

19 2021-05-04 dizziness Patient arrived to receive 2nd dose of Moderna on 5/5/2021 at 10:18. five minutes into the 15 minute... Read more
Close
Patient arrived to receive 2nd dose of Moderna on 5/5/2021 at 10:18. five minutes into the 15 minute post COVID vaccine administration monitoring, patient started experiencing side effects: 10:23:Patient reported dizziness, lightheadedness, became pale and clamy, with nausea. Patient request water and was given 16 oz water bottle. Patient reports that she did not eat breakfast, has no hx of allergies, and has hx of anemia. Patient currently taking Iron and B complex supplements. BP 52/33 P 53 o2 Sat 91% on RA. Patient took a bite of a brownie. 1025: medical response team arrived. Patient assisted to laying position with feet elevated. 10:28: Pulse 64, Pulse ox 91% on RA 10:30: Verbal order received to assess blood glucose. BS 79, BP 88/58 P 62. Denies nausea 10:33 Verbal order received to give Glucose 4g Tab by mouth on-time. Patient consented. 10/35: Patient denies nausea, denies dizziness, skin is dry and skin color is normal for ethnicity. BP 92/61 P 81 o2 Sat 98% on RA 1036: reassessed patient. Patient continues to improve. monitor patient for 10 more minutes in flat position then assist patient to sitting position for an additional 15 minutes and continue to monitor. 10:40: BS 118 1041: 96/64 P 70 O2 sat 98% on RA 1046: Patient assisted to sitting position and reported light dizziness. BP 87/57 P 65, o2 sat 94% on RA. Patient drank 8 oz. of water. 1051: BP 86/58, P 70 o2 sat 93% on RA. Denies Dizziness 1052: reassessing patient. Patient denies dizziness, denies lightheadedness, denies nauseouosness, skin dry and skin color normal. Patient to be monitored for an additional 12 minutes. If continued progress patient is ok to go home. Patient has driver present at this time. Patient encouraged to change positions slowly, continue to hydrate, eat meals. If issues arise and continue patient encouraged to contact her PCP or visit closes urgent care or ER. Patient verbalized understanding.

19 2021-05-06 joint stiffness 04/26/2021 got the shot. An hour later, I had shortness of breath. Kept persisting throughout the we... Read more
Close
04/26/2021 got the shot. An hour later, I had shortness of breath. Kept persisting throughout the week and worsened. On sunday, 05/02/2021 between the hours of 12AM to 2AM, my shortness of breath got worse to the point where I could not breathe. In general, I felt my back and chest tighten. I could only breathe (faintly) to survive. If I took any deeper breaths, my back and chest would hurt even more. As time progressed, My right neck got stiff. Then right my jaw got stiff. Then the right side of my head got stiff. Eventually, the whole right side of my body was numb -- I could move it still but it was still numb and stiff. This happened simultaneously with the breathing issues. This entire time, my whole was tensing, it felt like I could feel my veins while it rushed blood. It was terrible. I thought I was going to die. I did not know which breath would be my last, because every breath got worse and worse. I went to sleep around 2AM and I would periodically wake up. When I'd wake, the pain still persisted. It never went away. Eventually I got up to go to work around 8AM, the right side of my body wasn't as numb and the breathing wasn't as bad, but you could still tell there was an issue. This issue persisted throughout the day. As of now, these issues are not as persistent, but at least once a day, I still feel the effect. It sucks. A nurse called me (working at the urgent care I gave information about) , on 05/03/2021 saying if I was going to see a primary doctor. I told her that I have an appointment with one on 05/10/2021. She said that though they called me on 05/02/2021 towards the end of the day and told me everything was fine, that they looked a little deeper and realized that the shape of my cells were weird and that when I go to my primary doctor, they'd be able to access my information. This is of a complete shock because the shape of my cells were never weird before. This happened as a result of the covid-19 vaccine. This is reaction must be put into the VAERS system.
