19 2021-05-09 dizziness Pt was nervous before the vaccine (visibly shaking legs), counted down injection as requested by pat... Read more
Close
Pt was nervous before the vaccine (visibly shaking legs), counted down injection as requested by patient. Asked if it was done without realizing vaccine was complete. Pt was sturdy upon standing and said she felt well. She made it to the chair in the designated area in front of the pharmacy. Approximately 3-5 minutes later patient raised her arm to get the attention of the staff. Said she felt funny. Vaccinating pharmacist went out to determine what was wrong. Patient said she felt faint and dizzy as well as felt nauseous. Patient spit up clear saliva inbetween dry heaving. We were able to give her paper towels and some water after her episode of spitting up. Approximately 5 to 7 minutes later she said she felt better but still had some faintness and a tingling sensation in her arms and fingers. Had patient stay for 20 minutes after she said she was feeling better. No more shaking, nausea, or faintness. She felt her normal self after the 20 minutes and her mother was with her to drive her home. Explained to patient that VAERS report would be submitted.
19 2021-05-09 gait disturbance At 10:00 pm I started with a stomach ache (12 hrs after my vaccine). By 10:05 pm I was experiencing ... Read more
Close
At 10:00 pm I started with a stomach ache (12 hrs after my vaccine). By 10:05 pm I was experiencing nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Within 10 minutes, my face had swollen up, my eyes were swollen and red, and my hands, feet and chest had hives. Paramedics were called and arrived 5 minutes later. At this time I was barely able to walk, was still vomiting and having diarrhea, and was shaking. They put me in the ambulance and took me to a 24hr emergency clinic. In the ambulance, I was given saline, epinephrine, Benadryl and nausea meds. I stayed under observation until 3 am. I was released to go home at that time. Since then I have only experienced weakness and nausea.
19 2021-05-10 dizziness After receiving shot (2nd Moderna COVID-19), almost immediately patient complained of dizziness. Pat... Read more
Close
After receiving shot (2nd Moderna COVID-19), almost immediately patient complained of dizziness. Patient then lost all bodily control, almost felt off vaccination chair. Patient appears pale and lost consciousness. Patient was then slowly helped to the ground then all of a sudden patient started to have involuntary muscular twitching almost like she was having a seizure. Immediately I asked to call for paramedic. A waiting patient, who is a law enforcement officer assisted to help patient the floor. Then unpredictably patient sat quickly up and regained consciousness and appeared confused like she had no memory what had just happen. Paramedics did not come as patient had quickly felt better and was able to communicate proficiently. Her breathing was normal. No dizziness reported after. Patient was moved to waiting area and sat down in chair and I took her blood pressure. Blood pressure was normal 112/72. Requested patient to wait for a total of 30 minutes for monitoring. Blood pressure retaken after 10 minutes normal again . Patient was able to walk away by herself without assistance. I gave patient a call for a well being check at 3pm today and patient insisted she feels normal. Encourage patient to be evaluated by her primary care provider.

19 2021-05-13 fall Patient received the vaccine and asked to sit down to wait for 15 minute observation period. Pharma... Read more
Close
Patient received the vaccine and asked to sit down to wait for 15 minute observation period. Pharmacy staff heard the patient fall and hit the ground. Pharmacist, reached patient first followed by pharmacist. Patient was visualized on the ground with eyes open. Visualized the patient's neck bent backwards and muscles rigid including neck and arms. Went to get cold compress while stayed with the patient. At the same time, 911 was contacted by the pharmacy staff and a fire fighter in the pharmacy area was brought over to assist. Assisted the patient to a sitting position and noticed her pupils to be dilated. Returned with cold compress for neck and forehead. Went to get cold water while comforted the patient. Fire fighters present took the patient's vitals and blood sugar and all was within normal limits. Further questions with the patient found that she had not eaten breakfast or lunch that day. She also indicated that she had passed out before at a concert while dehydrated in the past. She had not passed out or reacted to any previous injections or vaccines.

Close
I got my depo shot a week and a day after I got my 2nd dose of the vaccine. Shortly after I was driving home and I felt like there was an elephant sitting on my chest. I couldn?t get my air in I was freaking out. I drove home and was so weak walking into my house I thought I was going to pass out. I told my mom I think I need to go to the hospital. I sat down. Ate some food and tried to relax. It eventually went away and I started getting ready to go to school. Just as I was getting ready to leave I got a huge migraine and started feeling really shakey. That?s when I decided to go to the doctors. They made me take some bloodwork, EKG, X-ray. They suspected from my white blood count that I might have a blood clot so they ordered an emergency cat scan. I got one done and they told me no blood clot. Then today I came in for more bloodwork and they told me that some of my waves from my EKG were slightly abnormal which meant I wasn?t getting enough oxygen into my heart. They want me to take an echo which in that they put me out and shove a scope down my throat and look at my heart. They think it was a reaction from taking my depo so soon after my covid vaccine.
19 2021-05-16 fall Upon reviewing the patient questionnaire with the patient she indicated that she has fainted with pa... Read more
Close
Upon reviewing the patient questionnaire with the patient she indicated that she has fainted with past immunizations about "2yrs ago". The patient indicated that she has had vaccinations since then and tattoo's without incident. After administering the Covid-19 vaccination, the patient stated she felt fine and didn't feel like there would be any problem. I escorted the patient to the post vaccination area for the 15 minute recovery time. After a few minutes I checked on the patient and she looked fine without signs or symptoms (pale face) of possibly going to faint. After a few more minutes I heard the patient fall out of her chair. Upon reaching patient she was laying on the ground and was still out. After about 5 seconds she awoke and was aware where she was and that she had just received a vaccination. She stated she felt fine and after about 5 minutes we had the patient sit up when she felt comfortable. In the mean while a 'Code White' was called and store management had arrived. After about another 5 minutes and when the patient was comfortable we had her sit upon a chair. Patient had a very minor bump on her fore-head but was not bleeding. Patient stated she felt fine but I had the patient remain in the post vaccination area for 45 minutes just to make sure. The whole time the patient waited she was accompanied with store management. After 45 minutes I assessed the patient. The bump on her head looked the same and the patient indicated she felt fine, so I released her to go.

Close
Systemic: Chills-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Mild
19 2021-05-17 dizziness Patient received dose 1 of Moderna vaccine. She used the restroom right after shot, and upon exiting... Read more
Close
Patient received dose 1 of Moderna vaccine. She used the restroom right after shot, and upon exiting the bathroom, passed out. She was feeling dizzy, so immediately sat on the ground before fainting. Another patient yelled for help, and I immediately ran out to her aid. I also had one of my staff members call 911. The patient regained consciousness as I arrived, and was able to talk to me. I determined that this was a syncope reaction, and not an allergic or anaphylactic reaction. I elevated her legs, and waited for the ambulance to arrive. The EMTs analyzed her, and released her to go home with her parent.

Close
States that she immediately felt dizzy and then passed out. The person sitting next to her said she suddenly fell to her left and hit her head on the concrete. Has a hematoma to the left side of forehead. Following fall threw up three times. Blood pressure initially low but has now returned to norma. Is now alert and oriented and refusing transport to the hospital. Per medical direction she can refuse and is having a friend pick her up and take her home.

I was driving and had pain starting in my legs and moving up through my back for a few minutes, and then I felt like I was on the verge of throwing up. That passed and I started getting really dizzy and was unable to hear or see anything. I pulled over and my throat started to close up and I was having a hard time breathing. It passed in about 2 minutes and an hour later I felt fine but my brain felt tingly like I was on the verge of passing out but no other side effects. My brain still feels tingly as well.

19 2021-05-22 gait disturbance Patient received 1st COVID vaccine. She was then instructed to go to the counter to schedule her 2n... Read more
Close
Patient received 1st COVID vaccine. She was then instructed to go to the counter to schedule her 2nd dose. While at the counter, (1-2 minutes post dose) she started stumbling. Our technician and pharmacist caught patient and lowered her to the ground as she was fainting (nothing hit the ground uncontrolled). Patient never lost full consciousness. Cold compress was applied to the back of her neck. Once she started feeling better (3 minutes), she sat up and drank some water. After 2 more minutes, she moved to a chair. She waited 15 additional minutes before leaving the pharmacy area. She reported she was feeling completely fine.

Her examination was not concerning for bowel obstruction or serious underlying bacterial infection. She is subjectively improved after 2 L of normal saline hydration and Zofran 4 mg.

19 2021-06-01 dizziness Seizure activity noted within 30 minutes of vaccination. Pt known to have functional neurologic diso... Read more
Close
Seizure activity noted within 30 minutes of vaccination. Pt known to have functional neurologic disorder and pseudoseizures daily (sometimes back-to-back). Pt alert and orientedx4. Pt dizzy and states she did not eat lunch today. Provided with water and granola bar. Second seizure noted 20 minutes later. Pt stayed for observation for additinal 40 minutes following second seizure. Client refused transportation to hospital and clients brother came to pick her up.
19 2021-06-06 dizziness, fall Patient received vaccine then left the immunization booth. Pharmacist was disinfecting the booth an... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine then left the immunization booth. Pharmacist was disinfecting the booth and heard the patient's mother saying Pharmacist stepped out of the booth and the patient was on the floor. Pharmacist went to the patient and instructed the staff to call 911. Patient's mother (who is a RN) stated that the patient fainted and had a seizure. Patient's mother stated the patient had a history of seizures (although on the consent form they marked no history). Patient was conscious and had a pulse, she could talk - but she was very slow and labored in speech. After a few minutes patient regained color in her face and was able to speak "normally". At that time the patient stated that she had a history of seizures and that her last seizure was 2 years ago. Patient also stated that her seizure triggers were fear and pain and that after the first shot she did experience dizziness (but had not told anyone about that). Pharmacist stayed with the patient until EMS arrived, EMS took over care and took the patient to a local hospital for evaluation.
19 2021-06-08 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild
19 2021-06-08 dizziness Pt complained of feeling dizzy and bilateral arm tingling/pain 15 minutes after receiving vaccine. ... Read more
Close
Pt complained of feeling dizzy and bilateral arm tingling/pain 15 minutes after receiving vaccine. Pt was observed and periodically checked on for approximately 1 hour, she then stated that her arms and legs were itching. I gave her 50mg of liquid diphenhydramine, over a period of 2 hours she was observed and checked on, around 5 pm she stated the itching was gone and she felt fine. I gave her a bottle of diphenhydramine liquid and directions for use. I followed up with the patient the following day and she said she continued to feel fine.
19 2021-06-09 movement disorder, dizziness Client sat in different chair as Mother was going to also receive vaccine. Within 10 minutes Mother ... Read more
Close
Client sat in different chair as Mother was going to also receive vaccine. Within 10 minutes Mother alerted staff client was not feeling well. RN PHN responded. Upon arrival client sitting upright in chair, pale, alert and oriented x4. Client stated feeling nausea. RN gave emesis bag and water. RN began taking vitals. PHN called 911 at 1459. At 1500 client stated feeling dizzy, nausea same. RN set anti gravity chair, per client unable to transfer by herself. Vitals at 1502: blood pressure 140/96, pulse 109. Alert and oriented x4, pale, diaphoretic. Client denied shortness of breath, chest pain. Per Mother client has allergies to olives, yellow things, and penicillin. Client does see allergist, per Mother when she gets reaction she takes client to hospital. No current medications or other medical history. At 1503 client reports new onset of blurry vision. Vitals at 1504: blood pressure 136/92, pulse 94, oxygen 99%. Client has x1 vomit episode, new onset of headache, pale, diaphoretic, alert and oriented x4. Client stated she could not feel legs. Per mother when client has reactions symptoms are headache and not being able to feel legs. Mother requesting to call 911. Mother informed PHN has been on phone with 911 dispatch. At 1507 paramedics arrived and assumed care. Client transported to medical center. Client left facility via gurney with paramedics at 1510.

Close
27Dec2020 - patient developed some swelling (went about 1 inch out from injection site) and discomfort at the injection site - had taken Advil and was using a cool compress. 29Dec2020 - patient had to leave work early since she was not feeling well - very fatigued and a little dizzy (able to eat/drink) - denied any COVID illness s/s (no cough, fever, loss of taste/smell, etc). She ended up going to the local ED - since she was still very fatigued and was feeling like she was going to pass out - blood work and U/S done - this is where she found out she had been pregnant but had lost the pregnancy (no heart beat). Per her report - all other blood work was unremarkable. No other medications given to her during this visit and was just told that she would be 'passing the products of conception within this next week'.

20 2021-01-10 mobility decreased, fall Patient received Moderna Covid19 vaccine at 1500. Was instructed to wait in vehicle; five minutes p... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderna Covid19 vaccine at 1500. Was instructed to wait in vehicle; five minutes passed and she proceeded to exit her vehicle to report symptoms. As she approached assistant, she feel forward landing directly on her chin. She loss consciousness for approx. 10 seconds. Was assisted to left side and was noted to have a 1 in laceration to the bottom of her chin. "911" called for assistance. She regain conscientiousness shortly after and became alert and emotional. She was assisted to her knees position as she became agitated and anxious. Vital taken: 105/74 P: 72 R: 32 at 1507 At this point 1508 due to agitation Benadryl 12.5mg administered to L deltoid. Patient began to complain about inability to mover her hands and feel her fingers. Reassurance given that she was able to move her extremities as she was able to squeeze the hands of the nurse as commanded. EMT arrived, report given to paramedic and care released to paramedic and transported to ED with family following. As a note: family reports that she has been newly diagnoses with anxiety.

By 19:30 she was improved and discharged home to mom. 1/8/21- work up a bit dizzy, nausea. 1/11/21-still with nausea, dizzy- Referred to manager to complete assessment for COVID symptoms. 1/14/21- Per PMD, getting COVID tested, quarantine for 10 days.

20 2021-01-22 gait disturbance My fever was through the roof. My body ached so bad I couldn?t walk. I was on fire all over. Then ca... Read more
Close
My fever was through the roof. My body ached so bad I couldn?t walk. I was on fire all over. Then came the adverse event- uncontrollable shaking. This was not a side effect written on the moderna sheet of risks. I was shaking so bad I thought I may have a seizure. I finally settled down and fell asleep. About an hour later, I woke up shaking out of control. I was going to call 911 but my partner was able to grab some NyQuil for me and knocked me out. It was the most terrifying experience of my life and I will not be getting the second shot because of it.

20 2021-01-25 dizziness ~15 minutes after injection (while waiting in observation area) patient witness another patient hav... Read more
Close
~15 minutes after injection (while waiting in observation area) patient witness another patient have slight nausea and mild light headedness (which quickly resolved). About 5 minutes after, the patient began feeling nauseated and light headed. I was called to check on here. She was pale and and leaning forward over trashcan. After about 2 minutes of questioning her and getting baseline vital signs, she started to slightly improve. We assisted moving her to an exam room. We had her lay near supine (as moving brought on new wave of nausea and lighteheadedness). She was closely montiroed. About 10 minutes later we began sitting her up, but after only a few symptoms began to return. Laid her back into supine. finally after anothr 30 minutes we were able to fully have her sit up and stand with no residual symptoms other than fatigue. Through out event normal VS HR, BP, O2 (other than slight tachypnea initially). Normal physical exam (other early noted pallor and reticular rash on extremities, which all resolved). Advised patient that on next dose to ask to be given in a location where she can be laid supine and observed for at least 30 minutes after injection.

Received 2nd dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine on Monday 1/25/21. Patient experience fever, achiness, dizziness, fatigue, headache, low grade fever over the course of the next day. Patient presented in the ED today 1/27/21 after a feeling of a rash, welts, and a feeling like burning.
20 2021-01-27 dizziness Patient came to receive dose 2 of Covid19 Moderna vaccine. States 1 hour after the first dose (admin... Read more
Close
Patient came to receive dose 2 of Covid19 Moderna vaccine. States 1 hour after the first dose (administered on 12/28/20) she was at work and her blood pressure dropped, she became dizzy and her face went white. She said her mother insisted she go to the ER to be examined. She states upon examination she was given fluids and tests were ran and the ER staff said she was fine. Explained this to physician at vaccine site and she said it was not a contraindication to receive 2nd dose and it sounds like possible vasovagal reaction or hypoglycemia. Patient states she still wanted to receive vaccine. Was instructed to monitor patient for 30 minutes after vaccination, assist patient in ambulation to waiting area to lower fall risk and provided patient with apple juice and trail mix in case of possible hypoglycemia. About 5-10 minutes after vaccine, patient stated she became dizzy and was dry heaving. She was assisted to supine position; vitals were taken and blood pressure was slightly elevated. 911 was called. Before arrival of EMS, patient stated she was feeling better and vital signs stable. Patient was helped to ambulate around waiting area and upon arrival of EMS, patient states she did not need to be transported. Patient was observed for about 20-25 more minutes and she was fully recovered. Spoke with Dr who was on scene after the incident and she believes it was anxiety.

I had cold sweats, a low-grade fever, a headache, body pains, and extreme exhaustion. The symptoms started a few hours after I received the vaccine and got significantly worse the next morning. I had to call out of work because I physically felt that my knees would give out when I was standing. I also could not rest my wrists on anything because it caused too much pain. The next day, I felt much better and was able to go to work.

Close
On 2/12/2021, had post-injection symptoms of joint pain, cold sweats and dizziness On 2/19/2021, she noticed injection site was red and raised then became "big, red and swollen" with 3 "bumps" noted. Was seen at Health Center on 2/20/21 and was diagnosed with cellulitis, prescribed Keflex and Claritin. Was seen by this provider on 2/24/21 for follow up and she states that initial red area surrounding the injection site is improved, however, a large red ring is present. Also C/O an additional irregularly shaped red area distal to initial red area surrounding injection site. No infection noted. Instructed to continue Claritin and add Pepcid 20mg daily to help alleviate the histamine reaction occuring. Denies shortness of breath, sore throat, facial/lip/tongue swelling.

Close
Approximately 10 minutes after receiving the vaccine, I became extremely dizzy, nauseous, my lips went numb, shortness of breath, weakness, slow reaction times, the inability to operate at my normal speed in thought and action, and I became very lethargic. I received the vaccine during a shift at work, and I was unable to complete the shift at my normal efficiency or concentration. To my coworkers, I described the feeling as being intoxicated, but not slurring my words. This feeling decreased enough by 9pm where I felt safe to drive home, but it was not completely gone until approximately 11pm.

20 2021-03-08 dizziness The patient had 2nd COVID vaccine and within 15 minutes reported nausea, vision "blacking in and out... Read more
Close
The patient had 2nd COVID vaccine and within 15 minutes reported nausea, vision "blacking in and out", heart racing, heavy breathing. Observed in vaccine clinic observation area for about 15 more minutes - placed patient on a cot, offered cold water and a snack (she had not eaten that morning) and she stated she could not eat. Symptoms did not improve, so she was moved to the ED. In the ED she reported a headache to front and back of head, weakness, lightheaded and dizziness, and palpitations. VS in the ED on arrival: T 99.0, P 87, RR: 87, BP: 120/72, Sp02: 100% on RA. Treatment in the ED included a 1 liter IV bolus of normal saline @ 1038, 1 IV dose of Zofran 4 mg @ 1038, and 1 PO dose of Tylenol 975mg @ 1218. Was discharged in 12:48 PM with the following VS: T: 99.0, P: 82, RR: 18, BP: 119/77, and Sp02: 100% on RA with continued headache rated a 10 on 0-10 scale, but ambulatory in stable condition.

Close
Pt 20 y/o female found ambulatory at vaccination site. c/c weak/dizzy, borderline hypotensive. Pt received her first doser of Moderna COVID-019 vaccine at approximately 1040hrs. Pt was monitored for 15 minutes in a designated area. Upon standing up pt became lightheaded and dizzy. Pt sat down and notified staff of feeling weak and dizzy. Responder was notified and responded to pt. Pt denied any chest pain or shortness of breath. Minor nausea but no vomiting. Pt had equal grips and pushes, no headache, blurred vision or tinnitus. Abdomen was soft and non tender on palpation. No hives, rash or redness noted. Pt was given 500cc of NS via IV, 20g in L AC. Pt was positive orthostatic and was laid down supine on a blanket. Last LPM 30 days ago. Gravida 0, Para 0. Pt states she has had syncopal episodes during menstrual period. Pt denied any food intake this morning. Pt was transported byto Hospital. Vital signs improved with administration of NS. Vital Signs: BP 106/52, HR96, SPO2 99%. (1052hrs) BP 118/76, HR 68, SPO2 99% Hx: Syncope during menstruation, Anxiety, borderline hypotensive. Allergies: NKDA Medicine: None

a 20 year old female presents requesting vaccination for COVID-19. Patient's identity was verified utilizing two patient identifiers. Allergies reviewed and Pt has no history of severe allergic reactions. Pt was sitting up but laid back down at 10:05am saying that she was having vision issues and feeling dizzy. BP was 112/70 and HR 75 at 10:10am. EMS arrived at 10:12am and took over. BP was still low at that time. Pt denied going to the hospital and EMS left at 10:20am. Pt stayed with friends until 10:40am. Pt left the store with 3 friends who had also received vaccine.

20 2021-04-04 dizziness Following the vaccine, I was perfectly fine and was able to go about my day as normal. However, whil... Read more
Close
Following the vaccine, I was perfectly fine and was able to go about my day as normal. However, while doing dishes at 11:30 at night (about 10 hours after I received my second dose of the Moderna vaccine) exhaustion and dizziness suddenly hit me, and my vaccine went black and my ears started ringing. I managed to lie down but I fainted and blacked out for a minute. After I regained consciousness, I had these muscle contractions/shivers (although I took my temperature and had no fever). I felt really exhausted, and went to sleep after that. However, other than that I had no other vaccine side effects. I was told by my doctor to report this though since they had not heard of anyone else fainting, and I have no history of fainting (other than once following blood donation). I also was not thinking about anything remotely related to the vaccine at the time of fainting, and I had no qualms with being vaccinated so I highly doubt it was psychological, especially considering I have no history of fainting, and I had an injectable medication so I have no issues with injections.

20 2021-04-11 dizziness, fall Fever started at 11:30pm 4/6/2021. Fever ~100 degrees F. Had chills and couldn't get warm, then was ... Read more
Close
Fever started at 11:30pm 4/6/2021. Fever ~100 degrees F. Had chills and couldn't get warm, then was hot and drenched in sweat. Repeated all throughout the night (Hot/cold). Took 500mg Tylenol at 12am that night. Woke up at 2am with a ~102.4 F fever. Took another Tylenol. Got out of bed around 8am 4/7 drenched in sweat. Felt nauseous and vomited almost right away and couldn't stop for a few minutes. Still had around 102 F so took 2 more Tylenols. Throughout that night and until Friday, I was achy all over my body. Also, lymph node under left arm pit was swollen and was sore along with my left arm. Throughout the day on 4/7, laid in bed trying to get rest and too nauseous to eat anything other than some cereal in the morning and plain noodles later in the day. Took another Tylenol in the afternoon because I was still staying at 102 F fever. Was slightly dizzy when standing up or moving too fast. I slept the next night and felt fine 4/8 morning (no fever), but felt worse as the day went on, aching everywhere and feeling more and more dizzy. Friday 4/9, I woke up in the morning and when I first started walking, I fell on the floor because of extreme dizziness. The whole day I was extremely dizzy and I've never had vertigo before, but it seemed like that based on explanations of it. Also had painful headache every time I stood up, but was fine when I wasn't moving. The next day it was mild dizziness and completely gone the day after that. Also, Thursday 4/8 around 7:30pm, I noticed I had hives on the back of my right hand. Not 100% sure if it's due to the vaccine, but I'm not sure what else would have caused it and it's worth noting. It was gone the next day.

Nurse initiated to call 911

The next day, it was still sore but I was able to move it much more. I had muscle aches through my entire body. It is now 2 days after the day I got the vaccine and my arm is still sore and hurt when I extend my arm.

Close
THE PATIENT WALKED UP TO THE CHECKOUT COUNTER AFTER RECEIVING HER SECOND DOSE OF MODERNA COVID-19 VACCINE AND THEN ASKED IF SHE COULD SIT DOWN BECUASE SHE FELT LIGHT HEADED. ALMOST IMMEDIATELY, SHE SLUMPED OVER AND STARTED TO FAINT. A PHARMACY INTERN CAUGHT HER BY THE SHOULDERS TO HELP ENSURE SHE DID NOT HIT HER HEAD. A TECHNICIAN IMMEDIATELY DIALED 911, AND THE PHARMACIST INJECTED HER IN THE THIGH WITH AN EPI PEN. HER BLOOD OXYGEN LEVEL WAS TAKEN WITH PULSE OXIMETER, AND BLOOD PRESSURE WAS MONITORED WITH BLOOD PRESSURE CUFF. AS THE PATIENT REGAINED CONSCIOUSNESS, SHE SAID SHE WAS HOT, SO WE GAVE HER A COLD TOWEL. THE PATIENT ALSO TOOK 50MG OF DIPHENHYDRAMINE LIQUID ORALLY. PARAMEDICS TOOK OVER TREATMENT AND WE RELAYED ALL INFORMATION TO THEM.
20 2021-04-27 dizziness Received vaccine at noon on 4/27/2021, no symptoms until upon awakening on 4/28/2021 at 0800. Pt st... Read more
Close
Received vaccine at noon on 4/27/2021, no symptoms until upon awakening on 4/28/2021 at 0800. Pt stated she felt dizzy and her "mind went blank and I fainted". Her mother drove her to Hospital ED upon arousal (patient was able to walk to the car and into hospital, presented at Triage area). Pt was mildly febrile on arrival, given PO Tylenol. C/o mild nausea on arrival, given Zofran 4mg PO. Orthostatic hypotension noted and given 2.5 liters of 0.9% Normal Saline IV. Magnesium level 1.7, given 2gms Magnesium Sulfate IVPB. Urine Hcg Negative. Pt stated all symptoms improved, Vital Signs stable, patient discharged accompanied by mother at 3:15pm.

20 2021-04-28 gait disturbance, fall, mobility decreased After first vaccine: History: Moderna COVID vaccine on 3/11/2021. Arm soreness over the first day or... Read more
Close
After first vaccine: History: Moderna COVID vaccine on 3/11/2021. Arm soreness over the first day or two but nothing else that really struck her. A few days after she started to notice axillary pain that progressed up her right neck and down to her right hand. She saw a physician who thought she was having nerve pain brought on by the vaccine. Around the 18th she started to feel a snapping pain in her wrist. Went to ED on the 20th because she started to have arm shaking, she was given ativan, her arm shaking stopped and they discharged her home. That evening her fingers felt clenched. On the 21st she woke up in the morning, went to urinate and dropped to the floor because her legs felt like jello and felt like they kept giving out. They initially thought the ativan was just making her feel out of it. They waited until the evening but then needed to go to the ED. The concern was GBS and transverse myelitis. They ate dinner and decided to drive to ED, on the drive she was kind of falling asleep periodically. Then she suddenly couldn't lift her water bottle. She started to be completely out of it, Mom says she wasn't responding. Pt says that she felt like she knew what was going on, felt a little out of body and wasn't quite responding. Mom couldn't get her out of the car, she was carried into the ED and at that point she started to recover a little bit more. About 10 minutes later she started to feel better. She was admitted because she was still having trouble walking. In the hospital she had a normal CT head and video EEG but she didn't have any events while on the monitor. Discharged home the following day with the diagnosis of functional neurologic disorder and instructions to establish care with an adult PCP. They advised considering CBT as well. Since discharge her legs feels tired, going up the stairs feels much harder than it should. She has not had any falls and no longer feels like she is going to fall. She follows with a therapist, has had dissociative episodes and panic attacks in the past. Assessment: 20 YOF with PMH of panic attack, POTS, IDA and benign heart murmur who developed weakness of b/l LE and altered consciousness approximately 10 days after her first dose of Moderna COVID vaccine. Also had an episode of unilateral arm shaking the day prior that resolved with ativan in the ED. At this point unclear if directly related to vaccination. Differential includes mild Guillain-Barre 2/2 previous infection or vaccination, stress reaction/anxiety, POTS complication, myasthenia gravis, tick bite, infection, heavy metal poisoning, B12 deficiency, seizure disorder, atypical migraine. Functional Neurologic Disorder diagnosed by neurology after overnight admission for video EEG which captured no events. CT head also WNL per neurology discharge summary. Neurologic exam today WNL. After Second Vaccine: History: She had her 2nd vaccine on 4/15 (6 days ago). Had vaccine in right arm again, she did have some arm pain again. She had coffee without breakfast in the morning. Had finished her first virtual class, went to the restroom during her second class, felt strangely in the restroom, went back to her room. She then passed out. Her fall was unwitnessed. She called to her roommate when she came to but her roommate hadn't heard the fall. She thinks she was only out for a few seconds but cannot be sure. Called her Mom who advised her to eat something so she ate an orange sitting on the floor. She got up to make herself breakfast and she passed out again. Again unwitnessed but patient thinks it was very fast. She crawled over to the couch, sat on the couch for for 15 minutes then felt fine for the rest of the day. She did not feel nauseous at all. She denies palpitations, difficulty breathing and chest pain. Today in office after orthostatics and blood draw she fainted again, only out for seconds. BP elevated immediately after the event but WNL minutes later. These syncopal episodes reminded her of her syncopal episodes with IDA and POTS. They do not feel like the episode after the first vaccine when she lost feeling in her legs and was very out of it. She feels like her arm pain from the first vaccine never fully resolved. After the arm pain worsened from the 2nd shot she tried a 3 day course of aleve to see if that helped things. At this point it is mostly just her right wrist that is painful. Overall feels more localized to wrist than prior. She has since stopped the aleve, last was last night. She has not noticed redness or swelling in wrist or arm. LMP was 4/2-4/6. She went almost a year without menses so stopped her OCP, but her menses have returned recently and she has restarted OCP. Assessment: Right arm pain persisted from the first vaccination but otherwise sx had resolved. She got 2nd vaccination on 4/15, only arm pain but yesterday had 2 brief syncopal events and one today in the office. Orthostatic BPs not completely convincing for orthostatic hypotension today.

Close
Beginning approximately 12 hours after the shot the following symptoms occurred and became progressively extreme throughout the night, causing an inability to sleep until the next day; Sweating; Fever; Headache; Chills; Nausea; Fatigue; Inability to sleep due to extreme side effects; Pain at injection site; Pain in arm muscles; Decreased arm mobility; The day following the shot the symptoms continued at an extreme intensity, until becoming less extreme but still disruptive in the evening. That night I was able to sleep and the next day the fever, sweat, and chills were gone. That day the rest of the symptoms continued in a milder way and by the day after I was feeling nearly normal again.

20 2021-05-02 dizziness Approximately ten hours after injection, woke up with constant chills, fever of 100.1, body aches, s... Read more
Close
Approximately ten hours after injection, woke up with constant chills, fever of 100.1, body aches, stuffed nose (had to breathe out of mouth), and headache. Acetaminophen helped slightly. For the next 12 hours fever stayed between 101 and 102 despite continuing to take acetaminophen, and headache also didn't improve. At 6:15 pm that day (~29 hours post-shot) fever was 103.2, headache was very strong (with light sensitivity). Since acetaminophen hadn't been helping, switched to ibuprofen. About an hour later, the fever finally began to go down and was gone by 10 pm that night. The next day, no fever and minimal headache, but was very weak and lightheaded. At about 51 hours after the shot, symptoms were all gone.

Patient received vaccine and said it was painless. She was accompanied by her mother, shortly in to her 15 minute waiting period her mother approached and said the patient felt light headed. I asked patient to remove her mask and assessed for any swelling of the lips or the face. Patient stated she did not have any issues breathing but felt very faint. Her eyes were very dilated, and she wanted to lay down. So we assisted patient to the floor, called Code White and 911. I stayed with patient as she lay down, she began to recover, but still looked very pale. I continually assessed patient for anaphylaxis, but patient reported no pain in injection site or issues breathing. Paramedics arrived and assessed patient, BP was normal, blood sugar was in the low normal range, paramedics determined that issue was not related to vaccine, but that she was dehydrated and had not eaten, which exacerbated the light headedness.

20 2021-05-26 vertigo, dizziness Client received the COVID vaccine (Moderna dose 1, lot # 024C21A, expiration date 6/26) at 2010. Cli... Read more
Close
Client received the COVID vaccine (Moderna dose 1, lot # 024C21A, expiration date 6/26) at 2010. Client reported feeling "lightheaded" at 2016. EMTs and RN responded at that time. The client appeared pale and diaphoretic, and complained of the "room spinning". The client denied any shortness of breath, chest pain, difficulty breathing, changes in vision, or nausea. The client was alert and oriented x4 at this time. The client's vital signs were as follows: heart rate 56, O2 99%. The client was tranferred to the zero gravity chair by staff with no difficulty. At 2020, the client's vital signs were as follows: BP 150/88, pulse 66, respiratory rate 12, O2 99%. The client had been given snacks, water, and juice by POD staff previous to her vaccination, but had last eaten a meal at 1445. The client stated she does have a fear of needles. The client stated she doesn't have any medical conditions and doesn't take any medications. The client has allergies to bees, cats, and penicillin. At 2030, the client stated her lightheadedness and "room spinning" had resolved. The client no longer appeared diaphoretic and her skin color had returned to normal. The client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 138/96, respiratory rate 12, O@ 99, heart rate 74. At 2040, the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 138/86, heart rate 56, O2 99%. Education provided regarding AMR activation and emergency management, primary care follow up, symptom management, and v-safe. At 2048, the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 130/84, heart rate 62, O2 99%, respiratory rate 14. The client left at that time, ambulating with a steady gait, with her partner who stated he would be driving her home.

EKG, and chest X-rays done at the hospital, they said I was fine but I have never passed out before, especially from my period.

Close
Patient received 2nd dose of Moderna. About 5 mins post vaccination patient felt hot, dizzy and faint. She motioned for help to her mother and mom notified the pharmacist on duty. Patient appeared to loose consciousness for a few seconds and then came back to. Pharmacy assisted in lowering patient to floor so she did not fall. We applied cool compress as she was very hot and we called 911. Ambulance arrived and took patient to hospital.

20 2021-06-07 gait disturbance blood clots in her legs and lungs; blood clots in her legs and lungs; back and legs were hurting; co... Read more
Close
blood clots in her legs and lungs; blood clots in her legs and lungs; back and legs were hurting; couldn't walk.; back and legs were hurting; alertness declining; activity declining; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of THROMBOSIS (blood clots in her legs and lungs), PULMONARY EMBOLISM (blood clots in her legs and lungs), BACK PAIN (back and legs were hurting), GAIT DISTURBANCE (couldn't walk.), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (back and legs were hurting), DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (alertness declining) and DECREASED ACTIVITY (activity declining) in a 20-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. Unknown) for COVID-19 vaccination. No medical history was reported. On 22-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 18-Mar-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to .5 milliliter. On 27-May-2021, the patient experienced DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (alertness declining) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and medically significant) and DECREASED ACTIVITY (activity declining) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability). On an unknown date, the patient experienced THROMBOSIS (blood clots in her legs and lungs) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and medically significant), PULMONARY EMBOLISM (blood clots in her legs and lungs) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and medically significant), BACK PAIN (back and legs were hurting) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability), GAIT DISTURBANCE (couldn't walk.) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability) and PAIN IN EXTREMITY (back and legs were hurting) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability). The patient was hospitalized on 16-May-2021 due to BACK PAIN, GAIT DISTURBANCE, PAIN IN EXTREMITY, PULMONARY EMBOLISM and THROMBOSIS. The patient was treated with HEPARIN for Coagulopathy, at a dose of 1 dosage form; Surgery (thrombectomy and Intubated) for Thrombosis and Surgery (thrombectomy and Intubated) for Pulmonary embolism. At the time of the report, THROMBOSIS (blood clots in her legs and lungs), PULMONARY EMBOLISM (blood clots in her legs and lungs), BACK PAIN (back and legs were hurting), GAIT DISTURBANCE (couldn't walk.), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (back and legs were hurting), DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (alertness declining) and DECREASED ACTIVITY (activity declining) had not resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): In May 2021, Blood creatinine: 5.37 (High) high. In May 2021, Blood potassium: high (High) high. In May 2021, Glomerular filtration rate: 9.5 (Low) low. In May 2021, Imaging procedure: abnormal (abnormal) had new imaging and she was still developing clots. In May 2021, Ultrasound abdomen: inconclusive (Inconclusive) inconclusive. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. She was in the cardiac intensive care unit (ICU). She had a thrombectomy and was on heparin. They intubated her and put her on the ECMO machine on 19 May 2021. The patient got off ECMO on 24 May 2021 and the intubation tube was removed 25 May 2021. They were having trouble obtaining a non-hemolyzed sample from her since 27 May 2021. The patients concomitant medication information included birth control pills. Very limited information regarding these events have been provided at this time. However subject's use of birth control pills can be a confounding factor to the events thrombosis and Pulmonary embolism. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events have been provided at this time. However subject's use of birth control pills can be a confounding factor to the events thrombosis and Pulmonary embolism. No further information is expected.

20 2021-06-17 dizziness Approx 10 minutes after dose patient said she was feeling dizzy, lightheaded and flushed. She asked ... Read more
Close
Approx 10 minutes after dose patient said she was feeling dizzy, lightheaded and flushed. She asked for a glass of water which we provided. We placed an instant cold compress on her neck and she held one to her forehead, and rested her head between her knees. We also placed a fan in the area to circulate the air. She said she was nervous because she had an appt at another pharmacy during her lunch hour and they couldnt give her the scheduled dose so she was driving all over town to find a dose in 100 degree heat before her lunch hour was over. She also stated she had a 'rough time' after her first dose and was concerned about the second. We had her call someone to pick her up and drive her home- she was feeling better by the time they arrived (approximately one hour). She believed her reaction was primarily due to anxiety

21 2021-01-05 dizziness *I am a nursing student who received the vaccine because I am in a nursing program. Employee at Publ... Read more
Close
*I am a nursing student who received the vaccine because I am in a nursing program. Employee at Public Health Dept agreed I should file this report and file it myself because I have the most accurate description of the symptoms that occurred What happened after vaccine administration within about ~10 minutes (01/04/2021) -what felt like a bit of throat tightening/swelling that would come in spurts and go away -difficulty taking a deep breath, could still breathe adequately normally -took more effort to breathe deeply/have a normal baseline breathing pattern -faster heart rate than normal, could feel it ?racing? a bit- was about 82 (radial, took it myself) *thought these were attributed to my anxiety of sitting in a crowded room not close to the exit (I have bad anxiety with being in new locations and not being in control of where I can place myself around others (I do not have an anxiety disorder but experience anxiety of this kind semiregularly) *sat a few extra minutes (about 20 minutes) and then left the observation area confident I was overthinking and I was just me being anxious/not the vaccine After walking out/leaving -spurt of dizziness/nausea -chills -hot forehead -spurts of widespread headache -effort to take in deep breaths -not as noticeable racing heart rate -spurts of throat tightening/swelling (not severe) Back home Same things as leaving -spurt of dizziness/nausea -chills -hot forehead -spurts of widespread headache -effort to take in deep breaths -not as noticeable heart rate -spurts of throat tightening/swelling (not severe) -spurts of throat tightening went away in about an hour After 1-3 hours -heart rate and breathing still making me uncomfortable but did not feel like an emergency -could feel heart rate when laying down/felt racing to me again when lying down, not very much when sitting up Breathing remained uncomfortable for the rest of the day/effortful into the evening -heart rate felt normal in the afternoon/evening -talking on the phone took more effort than usual but was not too difficult Later that night I was able to lay down without a racing feeling heart rate, breathing was better, and slept fine. The next morning I woke up (01/05/2021) without any effortful breathing or racing heart rate and without any other abnormal symptoms; symptoms I did experience were arm soreness and some fatigue Today 01/06/2021 my arm soreness is very mild and I am not experiencing any other symptoms -did not download the v safe app until 01/05/2021

Patient reported having a ?pepper? taste in the mouth about 3 minutes after vaccine administration. Patient thereafter reported having a tingling sensation in the mouth and lightheadedness about 6 minutes after vaccine administration. Patient laid down and vital signs were taken; BP-126/68, HR-100. Patient drank 1/2 of 16oz. bottle of water and a 12oz of a sports drink. Vitals were rechecked 13mins after the first set; BP- 120/62 HR- 64. Patient reported feeling better afterwards I.e lightheadedness had subsided and no tingling sensation.

Close
I got up to use the bathroom at 4:30 this morning. I was extremely shaky but made it. I was using the bathroom and had the feeling that I was going to vomit. Next thing I know I was seeing stars and I fainted and fell off the toilet face forward and hit my head on my tile floor. I don't remember getting to the couch, but my dad was awake to let out the dogs and I couldn't really speak but he heard me and came downstairs and got me water and a cool rag. I was sweating but shivering. I am nauseous and have slept a total of 13 hours since 4:30am. I am pretty sure I have a concussion. I have a headache, on and off chills, muscle spasms beginning at 9:00PM on 1/14/21. I also have ringing in my ears. My resting heart rate is typically between 75-85 and I checked it at 7pm and it was 100. I have not sought out medical attention and have been debating it all day.

Close
Received Moderna COVID vaccine #1 at 1207. Experienced tingling, chills BUE 7 minutes after vax admin. Then seeing black dots, head felt heavy, nausea, tingling now BLE as well as BUE, and rash beginning to anterior chest. Did not give diphenhydramine in vaccine clinic because patient nauseated. ED Charge nurse called and patient transported to ED for treatment. She received IV diphenhydramine and experienced vertigo, then given 1 dose of meclizine and IV fluids. Symptoms resolved, including rash. Discharged from ED at 1718.

21 2021-01-29 dizziness Pt was administered the first dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine at 1930 hours and then monitored for ... Read more
Close
Pt was administered the first dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine at 1930 hours and then monitored for 15 minutes post admin. During that time, pt developed some face and neck skin flushing, dizziness and "heart racing." Pt notes she has allergies to shellfish and tree nuts. Pt does not appear to have any respiratory compromise, denies any pain or trouble breathing, denies CP, HA, N/V/D, SOB, LOC. Pt airway is patent and pt does not appear to be in anaphylaxis. Pt denies any PMH; pt hx IUD placement and pt states she takes vitamins. Four-lead and 12-lead ECG monitoring showing sinus tachycardia, with a max sustained rate in the 170s at one point. Pt is otherwise asymptomatic. Transported to ED as a precaution. Pt HR gradually decreased en route to the 130s. Vagal maneuvers attempted twice, briefly dropping pt HR into the 70s and sinus rhythm, but effect was unsustained. Transport otherwise unremarkable

Went to urgent care because hives were all over. Rec'd Medrol from urgent care along with hydroxyzine. Got relief on 1/9/21.
21 2021-01-31 dizziness, vertigo, movement disorder Immediate burning in arm right after receiving shot. 15 minutes after receiving shot began to feel t... Read more
Close
Immediate burning in arm right after receiving shot. 15 minutes after receiving shot began to feel tired and got a headache. Later on in the evening I had discomfort in my chest and had to use my inhaler. Pain in arm worsened over night; couldn't move arm at all. Pains spread into armpit and back. Got up at 3am to my body shivering, thinking I was running a fever I checked my temperature and it was normal but upon standing I had extreme dizziness to the point of almost passing's out, I had to sit down right away. Had nausea and whole body felt very sore an achey. The morning after my shot I woke with a headache, extreme pain in my arm and armpit, soreness all over my body, stomach pains, and my heart rate was high. Throughout the day my symptoms got worse I ran a fever of 102.7 which broke but then came back later on in the evening. The following day my symptoms started to diminish, no fever and body was feeling better, arm pain and headache continued. Now I am on day 4 still experiencing pain in my arm and armpit, slight headache, but chest pains have started. It feels as if there is a brick on my chest, almost like a burning sensation with occasional pains in left breast as well as tightness in the left side of my neck.
21 2021-01-31 dizziness Dizzy spells and weakness
21 2021-02-02 fall After receiving the vaccine, she started to faint, slumping over her chair and fell to the floor. He... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine, she started to faint, slumping over her chair and fell to the floor. Her eyes were blinking quickly. She was breathing rapidly. She whispered that she was scared. I told her to take deep breaths to try and calm her. I asked if she felt hurt or if she has any trouble breathing. After about 3-5 minutes of lying on their ground, she became more alert and asked me if she fell from her chair. She didn't recall falling or that she said she was scared. I had her sit up and asked how she felt and if she had any symptoms of an allergic reaction--she said no. after another minute or 2, she was able to stand up on her own with no lightheadedness nor dizziness. I walked alongside her to another seat and she sat for another 25 to 30 minutes--she said she was completely fine before leaving with her sister

21 2021-02-04 dizziness After receiving vaccine, Employee complained of tachycardia (P=100), some dizziness. Employee dran... Read more
Close
After receiving vaccine, Employee complained of tachycardia (P=100), some dizziness. Employee drank water and juice. Employee appeared like she might vomit and started shaking, employee was lifted from her chair to the floor. Employee was turned to her right side and was having a seizure. CODE Team was called and Employee was taken to Emergency room via stretcher.
21 2021-02-04 joint range of motion decreased About 3-4 hours after the injection was given, my left arm began to hurt at the sight of the injecti... Read more
Close
About 3-4 hours after the injection was given, my left arm began to hurt at the sight of the injection. It was sore red and beginning to swell. After a couple more hours it was difficult to even move my arm; it felt as if my tricep was almost entirely immobilized. These symptoms persisted for about three days, with increasingly less intensity, and after the fourth day, I had no adverse symptoms. Exactly six days after receiving the vaccine, the area where the injection was given (tricep) began to feel itchy. When I tried to scratch it, the itch was not relieved but only worsened and began to swell and turn red. By the following day (7 days after injection), the site of injection and area surrounding the site of injection (about 6 inches along my upper and 3-4 inches in width) had swelled up more and was significantly more inflamed than my opposite arm which hadn't changed at all. It had a similar swelling, itch, and pain to the sensation one experiences after getting bitten by a mosquito, but in this case a very very large mosquito bite. By the evening of the seventh day, I began feeling very fatigued both mentally and physically and felt very subtle body aches that usually signal the early signs of a fever (at least for me). Upon feeling feverish symptoms I made a drink of turmeric and ginger root powder with honey and laid down for about an hour in an attempt to rest. After an hour, the body aches and fatigue lessened in intensity but my arm was still swelling and now feeling hot in temperature. The itching was unbearable. I went to go take a warm shower later that night and started to feel a mixture of pressure and pain traveling up my arm and into my chest. I began feeling my lymph nodes on the left side of my breast to find that a lymph node in my armpit and another one on the side of my breast had enlarged to about two inches in diameter. They were painful to the touch and noticeably sore when left untouched. These symptoms persisted with no change for about 2 days. After two days, the swelling and itching in my arm went away but my lymph nodes were still inflamed. They did not reduce in size or in pain until about 7 days after the first signs of these symptoms. After a week all symptoms went away.
21 2021-02-06 dizziness Member developed blotchiness to upper ext. and reported dizziness
21 2021-02-08 dizziness The symptoms began immediately after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: tingling of ... Read more
Close
The symptoms began immediately after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: tingling of her back / spine and then two hours later had itching swelling of the throat like she couldn't swallow felt lightheaded and dizzy and took benadryl with improvement. On day 2 felt feverish with sore arm and then on the 3rd day developed the same symptoms as the first day and went to the ED after taking benadryl x2 with no improvement in her symptoms. Objectively there is no wheezing, swelling, or rash but the provider does note that there were 3 small excoriated spots on her wrist one of which looked like a hive. The treatment of the reaction was: o Antihistamines: benadryl 50mg at home and ibuprofen o Steroids: IV solumedrol o Epinephrine: x1 o ED admission

Close
Immediately after receiving covid vaccine, client felt light headed and nauseous. BP 86/42 P 72 R 16 and regular. Pulse was "thready." Client complained of chills and feeling clammy. She appeared very pale. She spit up a small amount of mucous. Nurse applied cold compress to neck and assisted her to lying down. BP taken at 11:05 was 100/ 60. BP taken at 11:20 was 120/80. She drank two packets of juice. At 11:15 she walked over to the observation area and waited an additional 30 minutes. Color was pink an she said she was feeling better. Her final BP was 120/70 and she left the observation room at 11:45.

21 2021-02-14 dizziness Patient stated she was feeling dizzy. As I started asking more questions, her head slowly tilted ba... Read more
Close
Patient stated she was feeling dizzy. As I started asking more questions, her head slowly tilted back and eyes became wide and had a distant look, like a mild seizure . She was talking slowly but clearly, During the event. She was sweating, even though it seemed chilly. Her BP was low and my monitor wouldn?t register result. EMTs quickly arrived and their monitor took a while to register a result . She came out of it after a few moments feeling weak. We have her some OJ and she seemed to steadily improve. The whole event from start to when she was ok to walk out on her own was about a half hour. She had a relative Come pick her up and take her home.

Close
received vaccine on 2/24/21 at 530pm. this was her second dose and had no issues with first dose. on 2/25/21 around 12pm she became woozy and then around 5:15pm began seeing black spots. She didn't eat dinner and went to get in shower. At injection site she was red and warm to touch. She took Benadryl 50mg and then later began having difficulty swallowing. She went to local ED at 9pm. At the ED they gave her a normal saline bolus zofran, solumedrol, and rocephin. She fell asleep at the ED and after 1 hour her swallowing improved. On 2/26 her arm was still sore with redness and swelling at injection site. no hives or weakness noted. She went home on prednisone and antibiotic.

21 2021-03-11 dizziness Patient received Moderan dose 1 vaccine and felt lightheaded, presyncopal and then reported numbness... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderan dose 1 vaccine and felt lightheaded, presyncopal and then reported numbness and tingling to the shoulder and trapezius muscle on the left, ipsilateral to the injection site. She felt better after 30 minutes and proceeded to go eat in her bedroom. She was nervous and anxious prior to the vaccine and states that she thought that had something to do with it. She then experienced a 10 second bout of muscle tension in her face and jaw which caused her to be unable to talk or speak for a few seconds. She was brought back down to the hall for evaluation. She felt as if she was having a stroke and that got her more worked up. She denies lower body weakness. She states that her head feels heavy and she complains of general fatigue. No n/v. No headache or blurry vision.

21 2021-03-15 dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 2/10/21 and had a large, red, inflamed ar... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 2/10/21 and had a large, red, inflamed area on her arm at the injection site for a few days, but otherwise tolerated vaccine well. She received the second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 3/10/21 and the next day (3/11/21) developed fatigue and lightheadedness while exercising, which continued for the next few days. She developed acute onset, sharp chest pain on 3/13/21 AM which did not resolve so she presented to an ED. Vitals were normal but labs notable for troponin I which peaked at 4.36, CK 758, d-dimer 640. CBC/CMP and EKG were unremarkable and initial TTE with EF ~45%. Repeat TTE obtained a few days later with normal LV and RV size/function without any wall motion abnormalities. Cardiac MRI obtained with normal LV function (EF 64%) but late gadolinium enhancement in a subepicardial distribution within the inferolateral wall of the left ventricle at the base most compatible with myocarditis. ESR and CRP were normal. Further workup to determine etiology of myocarditis was negative (ANA, ANCA, RF, hepatitis panel, HIV, full respiratory viral panel, COVID-19 PCR). She was placed on metoprolol succinate 12.5mg XL daily and will follow up with a cardiologist as an outpatient. Family concerned that COVID-19 vaccine was the trigger/underlying etiology of her myocarditis.

Close
gave patient immunization,told her to wait for 15 minutes. After 5 minutes patient experienced dizziness and feeling light headed. i was talking to patient constantly to keep her alert as much as possible. Her eyes started to roll back slightly and I laid her flat on ground with support behind her head, The patient remained conscious. Took her pulse which was steady and regular, breathing on own without difficulty. 911 was called immediately. After about 2-3 minutes patient was becoming more responsive .Aftera few more minutes we placed patient on the chair, at which time the paramedics arrived. Patient has had past experiences of fainting due to body piercings or had problems as a child when she was immunized that was later revealed to me by her father. Patient had a flight or fright experience and after another 20 minutes left with her father and boyfriend

21 2021-03-23 fall It was weird again; Turning into a bruise; Felt crappy; A couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episod... Read more
Close
It was weird again; Turning into a bruise; Felt crappy; A couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes; Menstrual cycle was interrupted; Felt off; In her right leg raised hive; Headache; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 21-year-old female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced a couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes, Menstrual cycle was interrupted, Felt crappy, Felt off, In her right leg raised hive, Headache, Turning into a bruise and It was weird again. The patient's medical history was reported as migraines. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 27 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013A21A) intramuscularly in the right thigh for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 27 FEB 2021, the patient experienced Raised hive (Urticaria) about the size of a half dollar, after that she "felt off" (fall) had a headache (Headache) and Felt crappy (Malaise), and she had a couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes (Hemorrhage) which was assessed as medically significant, and the patient also experienced interrupted Menstrual cycle (Menstrual disorder). On 07 MAR 2021, the patient experienced Turning into a bruise (Contusion) and on 08 MAR 2021 it was weird again (Feeling abnormal). Laboratory details were not provided. Treatment medication was provided as Tylenol. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. At the time of this report, the outcome of the events Hemorrhage, Menstrual disorder, Contusion, Malaise, Feeling abnormal, Fall, Urticaria and Headache was considered as unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

21 2021-03-24 dizziness Approximately 12 hours after the event, I had throat swelling, chills, sweats, temperature of 102.5,... Read more
Close
Approximately 12 hours after the event, I had throat swelling, chills, sweats, temperature of 102.5, headache, muscle soreness, dizziness, lightheadedness. Onset was over the course of about 1 hour. I had previously taken part in the double-blinded Astrazeneca in COVID-19 trials (meaning I did not know I was vaccinated) in November 2019, so the nurse told me that the response could really be from anything: partly due to some interaction between the vaccines, allergy, and/or already producing antibodies. I was unblinded and told I was given the Astrazeneca vaccine. Interestingly, I had none of these responses to just the Astrazeneca vaccines, just a bit of soreness after the first one. I have never had such a strong response, and I believe this is the highest my temperature has ever been, and my lymph nodes are still swollen. I am much better now; however, even last night and this morning, I was feeling unwell.

I was admitted to the ER and monitored for another hour but was stable.

It got worse later in the day and even worse the next day. The next day I had body aches, chills, headache, brain fog, dizziness, fever, itchy mouth, itchy throat , hives, tight / thick throat, very tight chest, and difficulty breathing.

21 2021-04-04 dizziness Patient stated she felt like fainting post immunization. Pharmacists quickly grabbed adverse event p... Read more
Close
Patient stated she felt like fainting post immunization. Pharmacists quickly grabbed adverse event protocol and followed directions as stated. Called code white on intercom to alert store management. Asked patient about symptoms and she reported symptoms of sweating, coldness, dizziness and nausea. Assessed patient blood pressure and asked patient if she wanted us to call 911. Patient did not want us to call 911. Patient never lost consciousness but had low blood pressure on initial reading. Instructed patient to lay down with feet elevated. We gave patient a pillow to assist in elevation of feet and gave her cold compresses to apply to neck and face. After a few minutes, patient blood pressure was normal and patient stated that she was feeling better. We requested that she sit for an addition 15 minutes before she can leave. After 15 minutes patient, patient was feeling ok and left with her boyfriend. She was exhausted from work and this was likely the main factor for the feeling of syncope.

21 2021-04-06 fall At 10:15 A.M, pt received Moderna Covid Vaccine, 1st dose. At 10:17, RN and APN were called over by ... Read more
Close
At 10:15 A.M, pt received Moderna Covid Vaccine, 1st dose. At 10:17, RN and APN were called over by worker and observer, in which worker was holding pt on the ground. When RN and APN arrived, pt was unresponsive for about a 1 second, then awakened. Pt got up on her own and was sat on a wheelchair. Pt was taken back to triage area. Pt told us her full name and DOB. At 10:20, vitals were taken, BP was 87/65, pulse was 57, O2 was 98. Pt was alert and oriented x4. Pt was accompanied by sister. Per pt, she has a history of this happening mostly every time she gets a shot. Pt reports being scared of needles, and this happening often. Per pt, she has no history of cormobidity, no history of allergies. RN offered pt to call an ambulance, in which pt declined. Per pt, this happens often when receiving a vaccine, as well as when she got one of her tattoos. Pt was given glucose water as well as a water bottle. BP was taken again at 10:25, pt BP 106/68, P: 70, O2 @ 98. Pt color beginning to return to normal, pt reports feeling better. Pt states she did not eat any breakfast this morning. RN spoke to observer. Per observer, he saw pt start to get pale, in which he grabbed pt, and assisted her to the ground. Pt did not hit head. Vitals were taken again at 10:35, BP @ 98/70, P: 85, O2 @ 99. SIster stated she is driving, and will not let pt drive, agreed with sister. Appointment scheduled for tomorrow for f/u with a provider. BP taken @ 10:55, BP was 100/ 64, P: 80, O2 was 99. Pt is alert and oriented x4. Pt was again offered an ambulance or to be driven to the ER, pt declined. Pt given strict instructions on when to go to ED, pt and sister agreed. Per pt, she has work today @ 2pm, RN advised pt to stay home and rest, pt agreed. RN will send letter to pt to excuse her from work. Due to pt BP being WNL, pt being alert and oriented, pt was wheeled out in the wheelchair by RN with sister. No further questions or concerns.
21 2021-04-06 fall Pt completed her 15 minute wait time without complaints (at 1601). She exited the building with her ... Read more
Close
Pt completed her 15 minute wait time without complaints (at 1601). She exited the building with her brother into the parking lot. It was reported that she "slumped to the ground" and appeared to have had a seizure. I arrived at her side (at 1603) with EMS checking vital signs. Pt was able to whisper and acknowledge me. She was oriented to person and place. Her pupils were constricted, but was lying in the sunshine. EMS had already called for ambulance. I talked with Pt to obtain any medications, history and allergies - to which she denied all. She then began to tremor with her eyes rolling into her head, unresponsive during this episode. After about 20 seconds, she focused on me and was able to respond to some direction. By that time ambulance was present. She was lifted by 6 people and placed onto stretcher. Stretcher placed into ambulance and went to hospital

Vaccination nurse manual BP ? 82/60. VS: P- 51, RR ? 16, SpO2 ? 99% @ 2 L/m via NC No visible signs of pallor to Pt?s face, lips, and hands. Pt communicating all needs, no s/s or c/o physical distress. Pt reports feeling better, no c/o blurry vision or light-headedness. Vaccination nurse reports Pt denied any issues with vaccination when initially asked. Pt agrees with vaccination nurse in failure to report history when asked by Vaccination nurse. Pt states she will remember to report Hx next time she is asked. 10:45 am EMS arrived on seen, report given by Vaccination nurse, Eval/assessment concluding with EMS Writer/nurse return to Nurse station, crash cart returned to station

21 2021-04-14 injected limb mobility decreased I got my injection about 6 hours later my arm started to feel completely broken from shoulder to fin... Read more
Close
I got my injection about 6 hours later my arm started to feel completely broken from shoulder to fingers. I could not move it without intense pain for a few days. Then pain followed off and on that felt like I hit my funny-bone perpetually. 5 weeks later, the pain became so bad that I went to the ER for treatment. I also had an x-ray done earlier in the week for it at an orthopedic clinic who told me the injection was injected too high and into my bursa. They scribed PT. But when in ER, My arm started to go completely numb. I then received steroids to take 5 days orally. The pain has gotten a little better but I have limited movement without feeling nerve pain all down my arm into my fingertips.

Close
Around 10 min after injection patient flagged down a technician and said she thought she was going to faint. Fainting has happened to her in the past and she could feel it coming on. The pharmacist moved her closer to the area and gave her water. While pharmacist was standing with her she lost consciousness and control of her bladder. Pharmacist held patient upright as she was still in the chair as to not obstruct breathing. Patient was out for around a min and regained consciousness. Pharmacist in that time had called EMS who arrived later and checked all vitals. Patient drove alone nearly an hour so Pharmacist want to make sure she was ok before driving the long distance home.

21 2021-04-19 fall Patient came in forher first dose of the Moderan vaccine. Patient is an overnight associate. We pr... Read more
Close
Patient came in forher first dose of the Moderan vaccine. Patient is an overnight associate. We processed her paperwork, I asked her if she felt ok (answered the questions she had fiklled out) and then I proceeded to have her sit in the booth. When I went into the booth, I explained to her when her second dose was and to bring back her vaccine card. She stated she did not really want to get the shot, but was being pressured by her mom. I asked her if she was sure she wanted the shot, and she said yes because her dad has a heart condition. I then proceeded to administer the shot at 8:12 am. She did very well with the shot- no bleeding in the bandaid. I asked her to sit for about 10 minutes. I proceeded to walk back into the pharmacy, and I dispoded of the gloves. I then walked over to my computer, then I heard the loud thump at 8:14 am. I immedietly ran out to the booth and she had fallen over. We called a code white and called 911. Pt was awake, hit her head and mouth. I asked her if she had eaten and she said she could not remember, She said the shot was fine and she was on her phone and that is all she remembers. I rubber her back and chatted with her until the fire department arrived. She was able to call her cousin from her phone, but I did not move her until the fire department came. EMS came and she went with them. EMS stated that she had not slept in 24 hours and that could be the cause. The time from the shot to the thump was no more than 1 minute.

Close
Pt received Dose 2 Moderna COVID vaccine. Initially feeling well, then in evening started feeling fatigued, nauseated, mild headache. Was standing up and felt lightheaded, more nauseated, and flushed. Sat down on ground to try to steady herself and slumped over. Was briefly unconscious then came to, while mom was holding had another brief syncopal episode with no seizure-like activity. No tongue biting or incontinence. No head trauma. Mom called paramedics. Pt quickly returned to baseline, was feeling better, had stable vitals, and refused transport and was driven to ER. Afterwards still some nausea and headache. No chest pain, visual changes, weakness, numbness, tingling, shortness of breath.

Immediately following the vaccination the patient was bleeding and told the immunizer she felt dizzy. She then instantly slumped over in her seat and blacked out. 21 2021-04-27 dizziness At 10:40, the patient went in for her first Moderna vax. She was slightly nervous since she's not a... Read more
Close
At 10:40, the patient went in for her first Moderna vax. She was slightly nervous since she's not a fan of needles. When she got it a vessel must have been nicked, because she experienced a bit of blood streaming down her arm which surprised us. The nurse wasn't concerned and stopped it quickly and cleaned up her arm. Got her a new bandaid and she was sent to the chairs in the waiting area to wait her 15 minutes following the vax. I had to pick up my regular prescription so I got in line while she was sitting there surfing on her phone. As I got to the front of the line, the patient called me and said she was feeling lightheaded. I immediately left the line, and was there (I was maybe 15 feet away) and was asking how she felt. She said she felt sweaty and like she might pass out. Right then, her eyes rolled a bit and closed and she went limp. I was able to hold on to her and a customer that was behind me in line and I were able to alert the nurse that gave the vax and the pharmacist. Both immediately came to our aid. We got the patient on the floor and on her side. The nurse wanted us to have an epi pen in case, but we all didn't think it was an allergic reaction. We checked her blood pressure and it was low. Another employee was already calling an ambulance and another was getting her some juice. She was beginning to regain consciousness. She was only out for about 2 to 3 minutes at the most. Her blood pressure was low, but started to come back to normal pretty quickly. We had her lay there a few minutes and then sit up. Eventually we moved her to the chair a few minutes later. Within another few minutes the emts arrived. She had already had answered questions for us like her name, birthday, where she was, etc. The emts repeated those same questions, asked us what happened and rechecked her vitals. All were back to normal. They gave her the option of be transported to the ER, but given that she was feeling back to normal she declined and everybody felt good about that decision.
21 2021-04-27 fall Patient was given immunization at approx. 10:19am, Pt. gave back 15 minute timer at 10:41am, at 10:... Read more
Close
Patient was given immunization at approx. 10:19am, Pt. gave back 15 minute timer at 10:41am, at 10:49am per AP (watched video) patient collapsed. Management arrived at 10:51am to assist. The report submitted by AP stated that patient had grabbed another customer and a clothes rack then fell to the ground. Customer stated patient had a seizure. When AP, arrived patient was unconscious and not shaking. A different customer was there to comfort the patient through the seizure. Per AP, patient was unconscious for 19 minutes and when she awoke she could not state her name or basic information. She was helped into a chair. After 11 minutes she could lucidly state her name and give basic information. EMTs arrived, assessed her, and transported her to further medical attention. We administered IMZ and are reporting adverse reaction but were not there to witness actual event (only the reports thereafter).

21 2021-04-28 dizziness Patient was in the post-vaccination area seated after her shot. About 10 minutes after receiving th... Read more
Close
Patient was in the post-vaccination area seated after her shot. About 10 minutes after receiving the vaccine, she stated that she started feeling lightheaded. She fainted and fell out of her chair. I immediately went to her and found her conscious, but very disoriented. She stated that she felt nauseated. 911 had been called; I stayed with her until they arrived. They fitted her with a cervical counter and raised her to a seated position and took her vitals. She was able to stand and get on the stretcher with their assistance. The EMTs stayed with her and monitored her vitals until her mother arrived to take her home. I spoke with her by phone at 6PM. She stated that she felt fine now (except for a bump on her head). She stated that she was afraid of needles and that anxiety probably caused the incident.
