Close
Within 15 minutes of administration, patient began to experience dizziness, shooting left arm pain, and felt like she was about to faint. Patient was instructed to lay down on floor. After assisting patient to the floor with legs elevated, she was observed to have blanching of lips. Check injection site to see if there was any swelling. None noted. Continued to observe patient for 5 minutes while asking questions to ensure that there was no airway constriction. After patient was able to sit up, she was offered water to drink. Patient admitted to having not eaten anything today. When patient felt well enough to walk she was escorted out by her mother. Every single muscle and joint in my body hurt, it felt like I had been hit by a train. I could feel soreness down to the muscles in my hands. I could barely move, I couldn?t get comfortable. 21 2021-05-22 joint stiffness, gait disturbance Two days after receiving vaccine, began with bilateral knee pain and stiffness, shortly followed by ... Read more
Close
Two days after receiving vaccine, began with bilateral knee pain and stiffness, shortly followed by rash over both legs. Over the next few hours, the rash became more prominent, and pain in knees, ankle and shins made walking difficult. Went to ER and was diagnosed with Henoch-Schonlein purpura and told to take Ibuprofen for pain and to follow up with PCP. Rash continued to spread over the next two days to include both upper arms and elbows, with broken blood vessels. Also developed swelling in knees and more severely in ankles. CBC with differential in ER was reported as normal. Visited PCP 5/23/21, who referred to dermatologist and completed urinalysis which was essentially normal with possible elevated white cells to be cultured.

Developed symptoms shortly after injection; Vasovagal response, dizziness, abdominal cramps, nausea; 21 y.o. female with no pertinent medical history other than ADHD is presenting with dizziness and "blacking out" after receiving her second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 12:20 pm today. Patient had no symptoms when she received her first dose of the vaccine. Patient reports that she became dizzy, diaphoretic, and lost vision after receiving the vaccine. Per triage note staff at Walgreens reported no loss of consciousness, however. Patient otherwise currently reports she is feeling fine.

21 2021-05-26 fall Patient apparently passed out while waiting after receiving vaccine. She was sitting in a chair and ... Read more
Close
Patient apparently passed out while waiting after receiving vaccine. She was sitting in a chair and fell over to her right side. She appears to have had a petit mal seizure. Her pupils were very dilated and it took her several minutes to become fully responsive, although she was unresponsive for just a short period of time. She is a student and the EMS staff who responded to the 911 call reports that she is well known to them, as she has a history of "pseudo-seizures". Patient's BP was 138/84 and SPO2 was 98%. Pt was transported to ED around noon, and was back to the clinic by 1:15 to collect her eyeglasses that had been left where she was sitting.
21 2021-05-28 fall Syncope; Excessive eye blinking; Fall; This case was received via on 18-May-2021 and was forwarded t... Read more
Close
Syncope; Excessive eye blinking; Fall; This case was received via on 18-May-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 18-May-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (Syncope) in a 21-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 004M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 03-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 03-Feb-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (Syncope) (seriousness criterion medically significant), EXCESSIVE EYE BLINKING (Excessive eye blinking) and FALL (Fall). At the time of the report, SYNCOPE (Syncope), EXCESSIVE EYE BLINKING (Excessive eye blinking) and FALL (Fall) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 03-Feb-2021, Respiratory rate: increased (High) increased. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant and treatment medications were reported. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
21 2021-05-29 dizziness 10 mins after the shot she was sitting in the chair saying that she was dizzy, nauseaous, had ringin... Read more
Close
10 mins after the shot she was sitting in the chair saying that she was dizzy, nauseaous, had ringing in her right ear, had blurry vision. She was barely responsive and talking very faintly- NO difficulty breathing or any symptoms of allergic reaction. Had a staff member call 911. After a few minutes she threw up and then she was able to communicate a little more than earlier. She mentioned that she had a similar reaction to another vaccination in the past and her mother said that she (the pt) was a little scared and worried before coming in to get the shot. The paramedics arrived soon after, briefed them the sequence of events. She was doing well by then. F/u with a call to patient at around 4pm-all ok she said.

Then again on June 13, 2021 while i was watching t.v. around 9pm. I had difficulty breathing and had to focus on my heart beat to slow down. However, i am constantly out of breathe and easily fatigued.
21 2021-06-15 inability to stand, dizziness 1 week after receiving the vaccine, I began having vocal and physical tics. I have never been diagno... Read more
Close
1 week after receiving the vaccine, I began having vocal and physical tics. I have never been diagnosed with a tic disorder in the past but had had physical tics every few months prior to vaccine. After the vaccine they became very frequent and, 2 weeks post vaccine, were occuring about once every minute. They went away after 4 weeks post vaccine. After second vaccine dose (04/02/2021) I began having intense fatigue, lightheadedness, and inability to stand for long periods. These have not improved as of today. In both cases, it was a significant increase of prior symptoms I have not received proper diagnosis for.

Close
Choked; Patient fainted; Began seizing for about 5 seconds; She began foaming saliva; hypotonia; Became limp; This case was received via FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1198924) on 08-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 08-Jun-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by a health care professional and describes the occurrence of CHOKING (Choked), SYNCOPE (Patient fainted) and SEIZURE (Began seizing for about 5 seconds) in a 21-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 007b21a) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient experienced CHOKING (Choked) (seriousness criterion medically significant), SYNCOPE (Patient fainted) (seriousness criterion medically significant), SEIZURE (Began seizing for about 5 seconds) (seriousness criterion medically significant), FOAMING AT MOUTH (She began foaming saliva), HYPOTONIA (hypotonia) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (Became limp). At the time of the report, CHOKING (Choked), SYNCOPE (Patient fainted), SEIZURE (Began seizing for about 5 seconds), FOAMING AT MOUTH (She began foaming saliva), HYPOTONIA (hypotonia) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (Became limp) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Concomitant and treatment information was not reported. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
21 2021-06-22 dizziness Rec'd Moderna Dose #2 and developed HA, chills and tingling sensation in her fingers. Rash reportedl... Read more
Close
Rec'd Moderna Dose #2 and developed HA, chills and tingling sensation in her fingers. Rash reportedly appeared on her arm. Rec'd Benadryl and rash disappeared. After a nap that day, pt awoke with SOB, palpitations, dizziness, and rash returned on right arm and right neck. Came to ED for evaluation (6/22/21 @ 0514). Tachycardic. In ED, pt's mother noted pt would say something & then repeat what she said seconds later. Dx with seizure in ED and given Ativan 2mg IV. CXR, CT of head, and CTA of chest were all unremarkable. Afebrile, WBC normal, no COVID-19 detected. Pt admitted to ICU for further evaluation and treatment. Also had seizure-like activity during ID MD's exam 6/23/21.
21 2021-06-23 dizziness Right after administration, patients arm started bleeding a lot so we cleaned up the blood and were ... Read more
Close
Right after administration, patients arm started bleeding a lot so we cleaned up the blood and were going to switch out the bandaid and noticed her arm was already really swollen and hard (like a big marble under the skin). She then said that she was feeling really dizzy and thought she was going to pass out. She turned white and said she felt very sick. She leaned back in her chair and a cold ice pack was applied to her forehead and the injection site. This continued for about 30 minutes and then colored returned to her face and lips and she said she was feeling much better.

Reported she did not eat breakfast this morning. Patient was in recovery for 30 minutes. Patient reported feeling well. Advised patient to complete VAERS side effect report. Picked up by boyfriend at 10:40. Advised patient to eat before next vaccine visit. Advised patient to lay down at next vaccine appointment. Patient stable at discharge.

Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA At about 10:00pm Wednesday, I started to have a headache and feel tired. My temperature was mostly normal (99.4F) when I went to bed around 2:00am. When I woke up at 12:00pm Thursday, my temperature was 103.9F. By 12:30pm, it was 102.9F. I had a very bad headache, sore throat, nausea, and some light-headedness. My fever went down throughout the day with 2 doses of Tylenol at 1:00pm and 6:30pm. The sore throat, nausea, and light-headedness resolved during the evening, but my headache was constant until I went to bed. Today (Friday), I woke up with a slight headache but no fever or other symptoms.

After vaccination, she reported to the ER. She stayed in observation for about 4 hours. States about 20 minutes afterward developed some sensation of tightness in her throat, upper chest pain, and some dizziness. Patient has a history of allergic reactions and in the past has had anaphylaxis she does carry a EpiPen. Patient took Benadryl prior to vaccine this morning and then again afterwards a total of 50 mg, did not notice any swelling of her face tongue or lip, there is no wheezing or difficulty breathing not noticed any rash or hives. Received Famotidine, methylprednisolone and IV fluids when in the ER. The next morning she was found be Covid Positive and they did not know it previous.

I had severe joint and muscle pain. I had the chills and could not stop shaking. I was very weak and could not even move out of bed, Leading to me calling 911 for an ambulance at 10:21pm. They kept me in the Emergency department until 5:30am because they could not get my heart rate to stay down. 22 2021-01-14 dizziness Fainting; Dizziness; Body ache; Joint pain; A spontaneous report was received from a 22-year-old fem... Read more
Close
Fainting; Dizziness; Body ache; Joint pain; A spontaneous report was received from a 22-year-old female consumer, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine and experienced dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 31 Dec 2020 at 13:30, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 31 Dec 2020, after vaccine administration, the patient experienced dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported. The outcome for the events, dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches, was not reported.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 22 year-old, female patient, who experienced events of dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. The events occurred on the same day after the first dose of mRNA-1273 vaccine administration. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded and the events are assessed as possibly related.

Close
1/14/21- 10:30am Noticed some fullness/swelling in throat. Was still able to breath fine, but definitely noticed a difference. This lasted a few hours. 1/15/21- 3:45am I got up to use bathroom and noticed I was very lightheaded. I thought maybe I just stood up too fast. I got back in bed and my arm was 8/10 pain so I also thought faintness could possibly due to pain. 7:15am I got up to go to work and quickly felt very warm and my vision started to go black. I laid back down for a few minutes until this resolved. I took my temperature and it was 99.0. I got up again and started to get ready but began feeling light headed again. I ended up getting ready while sitting down because I kept feeling too much like I was going to pass out. I ate breakfast and felt fine. 8:00am I left for work and after driving for about 5 minutes I felt myself getting very warm again and light-headed. I ended up pulling over and calling for someone to come pick me up. 9:00am My temperature was 99.5. My blood pressure laying down was 110/74 and HR was 74. After standing for 5 minutes my BP was 90/70 and my HR was 92. During this 5 minutes of standing I felt myself getting warm again but my vision did not start to go black and I was able to stand for the full 5 minutes. At various times throughout the day I would feel faint if I was standing or sitting upright for too long. The last time I felt this was was probably 11:30pm on 1/15/21. 1/16/21 - No light-headedness or warmth. Did feel some slight chest pressure, but nothing crazy and it only lasted maybe half of the day.

Pt received dose #1 Moderna COVID vaccine 1/22/21 @ Vaccine clinic. 1/24/21 scheduled virtual urgent care visit reporting generalized fatigue and malaise/myalgias as well as some nausea and headache. Intermittent for months, was feeling better, then recurred after COVID vaccine. Provider indicates this may be related to the vaccine. Plan to treat with OTC Tylenol or Motrin and increase her fluid intake over the next day or 2. Presented to ED later the same day for workup. "Pt reports weak, low energy, nausea, headache, dizzy at time, chills, malaise, weakness, feelings of hypoglycemic." Workup negative, discharged home without treatment or escalation of care. Entered by PSS for tracking.
22 2021-01-24 mobility decreased Right after the injection, I had minor arm soreness which increased as the day went on. Approximatel... Read more
Close
Right after the injection, I had minor arm soreness which increased as the day went on. Approximately 12 hours after the injection I started feeling very tired and achy. My arm hurt very badly and I started getting chills. About an hour later I had a 101.1 degree fever. I also experienced very slight shortness of breath which went away when I used my albuterol inhaler. My shoulder where I got the injection hurt so badly that I could like raise it, lie on it or touch it really. The fever continued into the night but was gone by around 9am. I continued to feel tired and achy all day the next day, with occasional shooting headache pains. I did feel better and better as the day went on though. Question: I take a daily supplement of 6g of marine collagen. I happened to take the marine collagen 1 hour before the onset of chills and fever - could there be a correlation between the collagen and the worsening symptoms? I have never had any type of reaction to the collagen before and have been taking it for about 3 weeks.

Close
Right after getting the shot, I felt dizzy, had a sore arm, and my heart was beating too fast, for about an hour. At 9:30 the next morning, I developed a fever of 100.5 and body aches. Around 2 pm, I got a headache which felt like it was because blood was hitting the veins in my head really hard- I think that's high blood pressure? My blood pressure was 126/85. I read not to take medicine because it would make the vaccine less effective, but I had to take an aspirin at 8 pm because I couldn't handle the headache any more, and ever since, I've just had a sore arm and a headache when I walk too fast (it's been two days after the shot now).

22 2021-01-28 dizziness Immediate dizziness @ 10:00 AM, thought it was related to anxiety. Left after sitting for 20 minutes... Read more
Close
Immediate dizziness @ 10:00 AM, thought it was related to anxiety. Left after sitting for 20 minutes because I thought the "anxiety" would resolve best at home. Arrived home at 10:25 AM. My lips started itching, and then swelled along with my tongue. My throat felt tight and I tried to take an oral Benadryl. It got stuck in my throat and I was unable to swallow the pill. It was also difficult to swallow water. I arrived at the ED by 10:40 AM, where I was treated with IV Benadryl and Solu-Medrol. I remained swollen all over, especially in my fingers, for the next 4 days. I gained 12 pounds, either from the reaction or the steroids. My airway did not fully close.

22 2021-01-29 dizziness Received vaccine at 6:30pm on 1/26. Woke up at 7:30am on 1/27 feeling nauseous and had a headache. R... Read more
Close
Received vaccine at 6:30pm on 1/26. Woke up at 7:30am on 1/27 feeling nauseous and had a headache. Rested for a few hours and went to work. At work (noon), suddenly became very lightheaded, cold, sweaty, experienced blackout vision around periphery and felt faint and nauseous. Threw up. Went home and had extreme chills and could not get warm. Nausea subsided around 6:00pm 1/27. Headache and neck soreness continues still today (1/30). Headache feels like pressure inside my head, pushing and causing dull pain at the base of my skull and top of neck.
22 2021-01-31 dizziness Patient reported: fast heartbeat, bad rash all over body, dizziness / weakness, shaking, full body ... Read more
Close
Patient reported: fast heartbeat, bad rash all over body, dizziness / weakness, shaking, full body tremor, severe itching - within 4 hours of receiving vaccination - went to Emergency Department. This is a pleasant 22-year-old female with past medical history of anxiety and depression who presents for possible allergic reaction. Patient states that at 12:08 p.m. just prior to arrival she received the 2nd COVID-19 vaccine. She states that immediately following the administration of this she became hot, flushed and sweaty. She then began having itching and hives. She denies any difficulty breathing. She denies any swelling of the lips or tongue. No difficulty swallowing. No shortness of breath or chest pain. No recent illness. No nausea or vomiting. Patient is a nonsmoker and denies alcohol or drug use. She denies pregnancy with a history of IUD.Clinical presentation concerning for allergic reaction. This is a 22-year-old female who developed itching, rash and throat tightness following her 2nd COVID-19 vaccine. Patient is hemodynamically stable. She is anxious in appearance. No obvious edema of the lips or tongue. No respiratory distress. No stridor. She is 98% on room air. In IVs immediately established. She is given 125 mg of Solu-Medrol, 20 Pepcid and 50 of Benadryl. Following all of her medications, she no longer has any of her symptoms. Her rash and hives has completely resolved. I discussed this with Dr. who was in agreement that she is stable for discharge. She will be sent home on additional 3 day course of prednisone to be started tomorrow, clear 10 for 10 days and Pepcid for 10 days. Questions addressed and answered prior to discharge. Patient discharged home in stable condition.

Close
"On January 28, 2021, I received the 2nd COVID vaccine. Later in the day, I started feeling general malaise, chills, then during the night I felt like I couldn't get warm and ran a fever up to 101.2. Later that night when I was going back to my room, I felt very weak and dizzy and I ended up passing out. I don't remember anything until I woke up around 9:00 a.m. the following day. I felt back to myself by around 4:00 p.m. January 29th, 2021."

Close
Patient collapsed to the ground when walking to leave the post vaccine clinic observation area. She collapsed and had a 60second seizure followed by 4 minutes of post ictal activity. She did not vocalize answers during the time but nodded yes when asked if she had a seizure disorder. Patient had another 60 second seizure and then EMS arrived. Her seizure was generalized twitching and patient was unconscious. Vitals remained stable.

Close
Injection site pain making my right arm unusable, splitting headache, sharp, short pains on different places in my body including my back and knees, fatigue. Some mild nausea/loss of appetite. From the beginning of my symptoms to the end of them, my best estimate is about 36 hours. Taking an aspirin alleviated most of the symptoms to where I was more functional. I did call into work and skip a meeting the day after.

22 2021-02-07 dizziness Adverse events: 0600-1030 - Pain in arm got increasingly worse. 1015 - Felt super cold and nauseous... Read more
Close
Adverse events: 0600-1030 - Pain in arm got increasingly worse. 1015 - Felt super cold and nauseous. 1020 - Got a hot flash, felt dizzy and lightheaded, and heard ringing in my left ear. 1025 - I had trouble breathing and my throat felt tight. I developed hives on my forehead, cheeks, neck, chest, and arms. The fingers on both my hands and my lips were tingling. Treatment: I was rushed to the ER and given an IV steroid, IV fluids (2 bags), and IV benadryl. Outcome: All the reactions went away within 4 hours and I was discharged from the ER. I was advised to take benadryl for 48 hours afterwards as needed and given a 5 day course of prednisone; 2 tablets taken daily.

Accoriding to post vaccination staff witness, patient appeard to walk into traffic cone and then stumbled and fell to knees on asphalt. Staff assisted patient to lying position. Patient did not hit head. Patient alert and oriented x3, and remained so for the duration. BP taken at scene at 1326 (124/80 HR 90 R 18); 1329 (120/78 HR 78 R 18); 1335-standing (120/82 HR 80 R 18); 1346 sitting(122/72 HR 80 R 18). Allowed patient to lie down until she reported feeling better. Vital signs also taken in sitting and standing position--all stable, reports no dizziness.

When the person had given me the shot, it was so painful and he had kept in my arm for a while. It was nothing like the first one. He had given it to me in my SUV. My arm was so sore for 2 days to where I could barley even lift it. I struggled so hard to do basic things and had to rest my arm and switch between hot and cold treatments for those 2 days. Still nothing really helped. I couldnt even lift my arm above my head without using my other arm to help support it. Even when i did that, it still was so painful. The night of getting the second shot, I had body aches and a fever that reached 100.2. Close
First night (Saturday, 2/6) - around 7-8pm, became fatigued, lethargic, headache, muscle pain, cough, fever (as expected for second dose); Sunday (2/7) - same symptoms, less severe; Monday (2/8) - no symptoms; Tuesday (2/9) - hard to get up in morning (extreme fatigue), chills, muscle aches, productive cough, headache, dry mouth, ocular sinus pressure, cyanosis (not severe - blue fingernails, blue toenails, feet slightly blue), dizziness, trouble breathing when walking up stairs. Symptoms would come and go throughout day, but were worse in the mornings. Wednesday (2/10) - Present (2/13) - same symptoms as Tuesday (2/9). Symptoms worse in the mornings and after physical exertion (going to school, walking stairs), and at night as well. Symptoms are not severe, but I am concerned that they have lasted a full week. I have been taking Day-Quil severe every 4 hours. I was also on my period, which just ended yesterday (2/12). I believe my period started the day of the vaccine. I plan on going to a doctor's office, but have been too tired to move from my apartment.

22 2021-03-04 dizziness The vaccine was administered to the patient in the consultation room. Once we left the consultation ... Read more
Close
The vaccine was administered to the patient in the consultation room. Once we left the consultation room, after about 2 minutes, the patient got my attention and complained of feeling dizzy. I went to her side, and she told me that she felt like she was going to pass out. The patient then proceeded to lose consciousness while sitting in a chair in the waiting area. She then exhibited seizure-like movements (muscles contracted, groaning sounds) for about 10 seconds, and she then regained consciousness. I administered no treatment, since this did not exhibit the signs of an anaphylactic reaction. 911 was called, and emergency medical services arrived. The patient was then taken to the hospital. The patient stated that she has had a similar reaction in the past to getting a vaccine, she thinks it is from the stress of getting injected with a needle.

Patient began feeling dizzy, nauseous, flushed, shaky, and vomited several times after receiving her second dose of the covid vaccine. Her blood pressure was 127/107 and pule was 120 50 minutes after the vaccination was administered. The patient was given a cold wash cloth on the back of her neck and on her wrists and water to sip on. EMS was called and they administered Zofran and took the patient to the hospital to be evaluated. The patient was very anxious before receiving her vaccine and said she has anxiety and did not take her anxiety medication today.

22 2021-03-16 dizziness received her COVID Moderna 1st dose vaccine on 3/15/21 in the late afternoon. After she had her vacc... Read more
Close
received her COVID Moderna 1st dose vaccine on 3/15/21 in the late afternoon. After she had her vaccine she sat down in a chair and waited out her 15 minutes. During this time she said her ears were ringing and she felt faint. We switched her chair to one with larger arms to sit. She asked for water, we provided her a bottle of water and she started to breathe heavily. Her mom was with her and also was vaccinated waiting for 15 minutes. During this time her breathing became labored and she was feeling very faint. I called 911 and EMS arrived about 10 minutes later to see how she was doing. At no point did Taylor pass out or lose consciousness. She was cleared by EMS who checked her blood pressure which was normal and she did not have labored breathing after their visit. During the EMS check they asked the last time she ate and that was at 11 am. She declined medical transport to the hospital and was able to walk out of the facility.
22 2021-03-17 dizziness Patient had what appeared to be a vasovagal reaction. She complained of feeling light-headed and na... Read more
Close
Patient had what appeared to be a vasovagal reaction. She complained of feeling light-headed and nauseous about 5-10 minutes after receiving the vaccine. This continued for a short time and she also began to complain of feeling chilled and was noticeably diaphoretic. I monitored her blood pressure, which was low on the initial reading and then eventually came up to a reading of 89/60 with a pulse of 73 at the point that her symptoms began to subside. By approximately 45 minutes after the episode began, she reported feeling better and was able to stand and walk without symptoms. She went home at that time with a friend.

BP on exam was 75/32; 5 min later 64/34; EMS contacted due to downward trend; BP returned to normal range within 15-20 min at 94/48; 101/66; 104/71 at subsequent checks. BG checked by EMS WNL. Pt began feeling better and plan of action decided by the pt and EMS was to self monitor at home if symptoms returned to go ER.

22 2021-04-07 dizziness At about 06:15 PM after receiving the Moderna vaccine, patient left hand (the same arm the shot was ... Read more
Close
At about 06:15 PM after receiving the Moderna vaccine, patient left hand (the same arm the shot was given) began to turn blue-grey. The nurses there kept her in a room for about an hour, and monitored her vital signs. Everything seemed to be normal except for the discoloration in the skin. She had trouble breathing and some lightheadedness, but it was ruled to be an anxiety response as everything looked normal. Over the time spent in the clinic, the color began to become less intensely blue and fade back to a normal skin color -- but not completely. At about 7:30 PM, she got up to walk and started feeling pins and needles in her arm and upper chest, but this may be due to anxiety. The feeling disappeared not long after, and we were able to make it home and eat. Everything else that night went OK, except for the fact that her hand is, at the time of this report, still blue-ish in color.

Client was monitored for 30 full minutes (rather than 15) and was given two juice boxes. Client reports not having eaten breakfast and felt that her blood sugar was low. Client declined EMS/other assessment. Client recovered and was able to discharge from the clinic of own volition.

Woke up at 4AM on the day after receiving the second dose of the Moderna vaccine with chills, intense muscle aches, intense headache, constipation, dizziness, brief nausea. Was unable to get myself out of bed until around 11AM after taking a nap. Used naproxen to bring the symptoms down to a manageable level, but despite taking 440 mg total (220 around 11am, 220 around 8pm), I was mostly bedridden throughout the day. I had very little energy, and moving too much caused dizziness. All symptoms lasted from 4AM on the day after the second dose until waking up the day after that.

I also experience blurry vision and vertigo that hasn't gone away. -I have also developed headaches and recently I have an itchy rash on my neck. -Since then it has been hard for me to focus and sometimes I feel like the world is in slow motion.

22 2021-04-12 dizziness 22 yo female without pmh, presented to USC vaccine site for 2nd dose of Moderna covid vaccine today.... Read more
Close
22 yo female without pmh, presented to USC vaccine site for 2nd dose of Moderna covid vaccine today. She arrived with boyfriend feeling well. Shortly after administration of vaccine, pt felt lightheaded and nauseated and passed out. Syncope was witnessed by medical staff. Pt was sitting in chair at the time and lowered carefully to the ground in supine position with legs elevated. She responded to name and sternal rub within seconds. Now feels sleepy. Denies SOB, CP, HA, numbness/tingling, pruritus or rash, abd pain. Nausea improving. No hx of syncopal reaction to vaccines or other. Denies being pregnant, not on menses. No meds pta. Vitals BP 110/70, HR 59bpm, RR 14, SpO2 100% ra, no thermometer available Heart and lung sounds normal, oropharynx benign, abd non-tender, no obvious rash or swelling or angioedema. No signs of anaphylaxis. Appears vasovagal. Within minutes, pt improving, skin color returning to normal. Able to respond verbally with understanding. A&Ox4. Sxs improved. Monitored full 30 minutes. Able to go home with boyfriend, educated on precautions, recommended rest and hydration.

Close
9:19 Am: After receiing dose 1 Moderna Covid 19 vaccine, upon entering Observation Room #1, pt. Felt lightheaded and fell into the door jam in the way down. She was lying prone. Alert and oriented to name. Able to roll onto her back. Feet/legs elevated on a chair. Pt stated, " I felt lightheaded and nausea". Face -flushed. Noted scant Amount of blood on left nose/cheek area. FOC was with her. FOC had opened his personal Epi pen and was ready to give to patient when this PHN stated, "Stop! She does not need an Epi pen You cannot do that! FOC was insistent. A t that time, a doctor arrived. She also repeated to the FOC that pt. Had a vaso-vagal response and does not need an Epi-pen.she advised FOC to let us medical professionals do our job. Left side of nose cleansed with sterile NACL w/cotton swab, dried with cotton swab and Bacitrain ointment applied. Color -improved. Skin warm and dry. Pt now denying nausea and lightheadedness. 9:40 assisted to seated position ; seated against a wall. Drank ~8 ounces of water. Tolerated that well. 9:45 DNP in to check on patient. Now pt. C/o lightheadedness and nausea. Pt returned to supine position with feet up on a chair. VSS: 100/70, P: 60 RRR, resp: 18. 9:55 Returned to seated position . Denied nausea/lightheadedness. PHN informed pt. That if she is not feeling better and is feeling worse, then we will call emergency responders for further care. Pt. Stating she is feeling better. Pt. Advised to f/u with PCP . ER precautions given. Pt verbalized understanding of info. Pt. advised to have further vaccinations administered in supine position. Pt. assisted to w/c and Wheeled to personal auto with FOC without incident.

22 2021-04-15 dizziness Patient appeared anxious prior to vaccine administration. When asked if she felt like she was going... Read more
Close
Patient appeared anxious prior to vaccine administration. When asked if she felt like she was going to pass out, patient advised she did not pass out from needles/shots before, but has fainted because of extreme anxiety; but did not feel like she would pass out at this time. After shot was administered, pt. was more relaxed, and advised she was feeling ok. Patient was ambulatory, with no complaints of light-headedness or adverse feelings, and walked to the observation area. Approximately five minutes following vaccination, patient told companion that she did not feel good, and laid down on the floor. She then experienced a syncopal episode. Patient did not hit head, or have any injury as a result of the syncopal episode. Patient was breathing normally, but was unresponsive for approximately 15-20 seconds. Following episode, patient regained consciousness (COAx3), and was upset from incident, but confirmed no injury or other illness, following episode. Patient was evaluated by EMTs on site, and was able to sit up and transfer from the ground, to a chair, and the chair to a wheel chair without issue. Further evaluation was conducted by EMT on site. Blood pressure was 110/80, SPO2 was 98% room air, and pulse was 66 at approximately 13:22 hours. Patient laid on gurney/cot on-site for approximately 20 minutes, to rest, and to be monitored for additional side-effects. During monitoring, patient advised the only thing she had eaten today was "one peanut butter cup." Patient was provided water and a juice box during monitoring time. Patient was released from monitoring area at 13:45 hours, after she advised she was feeling ok. She was wheeled into the parking area as a precaution, and left with her companion. Patient was the passenger of the vehicle.

Close
Around 6:30, I started feeling dizziness and got a severe headache. After waking up from a nap that night around 9, I woke up to a 101.4 fever, itchy throat, dizziness, naseau, and a swollen, red circle around my injection site that was hot to the touch. I couldn't sleep due to pain and discomfort from my arm and fever. I woke up around 4:30, vomiting. I took Advil and Hydroxizine around 8 am to sleep, but it still didn't help as I woke up every 30 minutes. I had a fever of 101.3 and these same symptoms the whole day of 4/14. Before going to bed this night, my temperature was down to 100.3. I woke up the next morning (4/15) and my temperature was down to 99.4, so I went to work. I still had the symptoms of itchy throat, dizziness, and weakness. My arm was still swollen and sore too. Another symptom I thought was interesting that I had was waking up drenched in sweat this morning (4/16) and yesterday morning (4/15). I even woke up through the night to put a fan on me at high speed and took my blankets off, yet still woke up sweating. Tonight, my temperature is back to normal, but I still have an itchy throat, some dizziness, and an itchy injection site.

She said she couldn't even remember her name or walk straight. I told her she needed to go to the hospital ASAP and not to work the rest of her shift.

22 2021-04-23 dizziness Administered the first Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. No apparent concerns were found when reviewing the ... Read more
Close
Administered the first Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. No apparent concerns were found when reviewing the PQCF and talking with the patient prior to administering the vaccine. Patient verbally stated she'd never experienced a reaction immediately after receiving a vaccine and specifially referred to receiving flu shots annually. Vaccine was administered at 15:02, and the patient was seated in the designated "Post-vaccine waiting area" located directly in front of the pharmacy windows. At 15:04 patient began to feel nauseated with flacial flushing. CPhT was monitoring the patient. At 15:06, the patient began to exhibit s/s of syncope, including: facial flushing, profuse sweating, nausea, weakness, coldness of extremities, and visual disturbances. At 15:06, the patient's face/lips began to lose color while stating she was dizzy. Under her own power with aid, the patient was gently transferred from the chair to the floor and placed in the supine position with both feet propped up on the chair. She was given an ice pack and paper towels and remained on the floor for approximately 14 minutes. At 15:21, the patient stated she felt much better and wanted to try to sit up. After monitoring the patient for 34 minutes, she left the pharmacy area under her own power stating she felt much better and still plans on getting the second vaccine. Patient was counseled and questions were answered regarding this reaction.

Close
Approximately 1.5 weeks from second shot, began experience dizziness and numbness in arms and legs. These spells lasted for a couple of hours but after a few days became more chronic and was matched with fatigue, tightness of chest, headaches, and brain fog. Impaired ability to complete every day tasks. Began presenting with capilliarities in mid April, along with easy bruising/bleeding and elevated liver enzymes (the enzymes began to stabilize over the following week). All of these symptoms have persisted (currently May 4th).

Woke up between 5:30 and 6 am feeling more nauseous than the night before, chills and aches. Stood up to take my temperature and almost fainted (had to sit back down on bed, my ears were ringing and vision was grayed out, I may have been unconscious for a second or two). I was sweating and shaking from that, and went to the toilet and threw up a little bit. Dizziness/faintness persisted when standing until around 9 am.

Close
After about 10 hours after the vaccine was administered, I got a fever of 102, which then made its way up to 104.7. I knew the fever was a possible side effect, but it got very bad very quickly. I had to call off of work because I could not stay awake and was in so much pain. My fever has lowered 2 days after vaccination, but has not fully gone down. Also, my neck on the side that my vaccine was administered (the left arm) is very swollen and very painful. I cannot lift my arm and there is a noticeable difference between my left and my right neck in regards to swelling.
22 2021-05-06 dizziness, vertigo After 15 minute observation period, pt. began feeling dizzy and lightheaded while she was enroute to... Read more
Close
After 15 minute observation period, pt. began feeling dizzy and lightheaded while she was enroute to parking area via golf cart accompanied by her mother and a staff member. Staff member returned pt. to clinic for evaluation, she arrived to clinic at 11:15. Note: Patient speaks fluent English, however a staff member interpreted encounter in Spanish at pt?s request for benefit of her mother. 11:15: VS (lying): BP 100/70, P 92, SpO2 99% - c/o dizziness and thirst. Reports she actually felt transient lightheadedness when she walked out of clinic to golf cart originally. Has eaten only a small bowl of cereal today. Skin pale, dry, no rashes, hives, lesions. No swelling of face, mouth, oropharynx, or neck. No respiratory distress, lungs clear. 11:20: Feels better after lying down, drinking water and eating a cracker. Dizziness resolved, still slightly lightheaded with sitting up. Color normal per mother. No swelling of face, mouth, or neck. No respiratory distress. 11:24: VS (sitting): BP 110/62, P 88. Feels ?okay? and wants to go home. 11:30: VS (standing): BP 96/68, P 96. Became dizzy, lightheaded and pale with standing. Remains oriented x 4, but verbal responses slowed. No speech deficits, moving all extremities, PERL. No syncope, LOC, seizure activity. 11:32: P 98, R 14, SpO2 93%. Remains pale with slowed verbal responses. No swelling of face, mouth, or neck. No respiratory distress. Encouraged to take deeo breaths. EMS called. 11:34: Pallor and rapidity of verbal responses slowly improving upon lying down. 11:37: VS BP 110/80, P 110, R 15, SpO2 98%. 11:40: EMS arrived, assessed patient, including repeat orthostatic VS (normal), EKG, and RBG. Pt. reports she feels better and wants to go home. 11:55: EMS assessment complete ? pt reports dizziness resolved, states ?just feel tired now?. Wants to go home, declines transport to ED. Given DC instructions to rest, monitor for side effects, when to call 9-1-1. 12:00: To car with mother via golf cart with staff member.
22 2021-05-08 inability to stand Was fine until I stood up at approximately 9:30pm. Immediately got very fatigued, head started hurti... Read more
Close
Was fine until I stood up at approximately 9:30pm. Immediately got very fatigued, head started hurting. Bent over to pick something up and my back hurt around where my lungs are; it hurt to breathe. Within 15 minutes I could barely stand up. After about an hour of the symptoms intensifying, I started to get a low grade fever. I took something for the symptoms (alka seltzer daytime pill), but went to bed shortly. I started waking up off and on around 6 (I normally sleep in until noon). At 7am, I woke up feeling like I was on fire. I grabbed my thermometer from my nightstand- it read 104 degrees Fahrenheit. I tried to open my medicine but I was so weak I couldn?t do it myself. I walked downstairs and woke my mom up. She took my temperature and it read 103 since I was no longer in my bed warmed by my body heat. She opened my nighttime alka seltzer and gave it to me along with 800 mg ibuprofen. I went to bed with nothing but a sheet and a cooling pillow. At some point my mom came in and handed me my water but I don?t remember it, however it helped cool me down when I fell asleep with it in my bed. When I woke up at 11, my fever was only 100 and it was the only symptom I had. When I got out of bed at 1, I was fever free. I?ve been fatigued the rest of the day but the fever hasn?t returned and I?ve been taking 325 acetaminophen every 4 hrs.

Close
Client received the 2nd COVID vaccine (Moderna Lot #021C21A and expiration 05/26/2021) at 1544. At 1552 client started to touch her head and lean forward. EMT and PHN responded. Client stated that she was feeling "lightheaded and queasy." Client transferred to zero gravity chair by EMT and PHN. Client was pale and had goosebumps. PHN asked if she was feeling any other symptoms. The client stated that she was "freezing." Vital signs were taken at 1558 (blood pressure 112/60, Oxygen 96%, Heart rate 80). Client started to shake and cry and breath rapidly. PHN called EMS at 1558. Client stated that she had a similar reaction to the flu vaccine last year and it the symptoms lasted for "12ish hours." She stated that she laid in bed the whole time until they subsided. Client stated that she has a history of anxiety, no medical conditions, no allergies, and is not taking any medications. Client advised to follow up with primary care provider and allergist before receiving her second vaccine. EMS arrived at 1602. EMS took patient outside to the ambulance to assess her at 1604.

23 2021-01-06 injected limb mobility decreased On day 1 (day I was vaccinated) I experienced severe pain in my arm where I was injected with the va... Read more
Close
On day 1 (day I was vaccinated) I experienced severe pain in my arm where I was injected with the vaccine 3 hours after receiving it. I couldn't use my arm for the rest of the day and had to take Tylenol to help with swelling and pain. Pain was dull and throbbing. The next morning I woke up to body chills, a low grade fever, muscle aches, vomiting, exhaustion/fatigue, coughing, and diarrhea. The injection site was still very tender, sore, and swollen with limited mobility. All symptoms subsided within two days other than fatigue and a sore arm. On day 3 I developed a cough that lasted 4-5 days. Other than a cough, I had no other symptoms after that. My arm was better with no pain and easy to use. Then on day 8 my arm started to swell again and I developed a distinct rash at the injection site. The skin around the area was hot to touch and very hard and tender. I took ibuprofen and rubbed out the arm to help. I contacted my provider and she examined the arm, concerned I was having a reaction and possibly developing cellulitis. On day 9 the rash spread to the whole upper arm and shoulder were hot to touch/feverish, painful, hard, and still swollen. The swelling has continued to move up my arm. I am seeking medical attention today on 1/7/21 for treatment of possible cellulitis.

Headache (began day 1 - consistent through day 4 today), lightheadedness (day 1 - first reaction symptom), nausea (day 1 briefly), total body aches (evening of day 1 severe - through day 4 today but only mild), chills (evening of day 1), subjective fever (evening of day 1), swelling of injection site (noticed the next morning and worsened until day 4 today, started to decrease but still present), rash of injection site (noticed morning after and continued to increase until day 4 today it is less bright red but still present and baseball sized), swollen right axillary lymph nodes (day 3-4), today day 4 injection site began itching. I am continuing to monitor signs and symptoms.
23 2021-01-11 mobility decreased 1/10/21 - Feeling of "pulling a muscle" in armpit in left upper extremity that limited movement. (ar... Read more
Close
1/10/21 - Feeling of "pulling a muscle" in armpit in left upper extremity that limited movement. (around 8:00 am). New onset of hives, erythema, warmth, edema, pain, and itching experienced at injection site in left upper extremity (6:34 pm). Call was placed to NP, the provider on call at 6:46 pm. Under advisement of provider, application of hydrocortisone cream at injection site and X2 PO 25 mg benadryl self-administered (around 7:00 pm). Sensation of throat closing and hoarseness/change in voice surfaced (around 7:45 pm). Presented to ED, with complaints as listed (around 8:15 pm). Condition/symptoms treated at ED with 60 mg prednisone and pepcid (8:31 pm) followed by direct observation until 10:08 pm. Prescription for prednisone 20 mg X3/day for 5 days written by MD. 1/11/21 - Arm continued to appear slightly swollen with erythema and warmth at the site. Treatment included observation throughout the day. 1/12/21 - Follow-up appointment attended with provider at 2:10 pm. Told by provider that prednisone would only be necessary in the case of resurfacing symptoms of a hypersensitivity reaction. At this time the cause of said symptoms is undetermined. Tingling sensation experienced in face and direct observation of left-sided facial swelling noticed (5:59 pm). Call placed to provider on call (6:08 pm) . Provider advised to take X2 25 mg benadryl and to take X3 20 mg prednisone stat. Benadryl taken at 6:15 pm and prednisone taken at 6:30 pm. Tingling sensation minimized by 7:30 pm, but left sided facial swelling remains as of 7:40 pm. Plans to follow-up with PCP later in the week and potential for re-visiting ED if symptoms worsen or continue throughout the night.

23 2021-01-13 dizziness Before injection patient was very nervous and did not eat breakfast. 3 minutes after injection patie... Read more
Close
Before injection patient was very nervous and did not eat breakfast. 3 minutes after injection patient complained of blurred vision and dizziness. BP 88/50, HR 54, O2 92%, pale in color, patient started to shake and have seizure activity only lasting a few seconds. 3 person assist to lie flat on the floor, rolled to left side. Patient was non-verbal at this time. 911 was called. At 9:11 AM EMS arrived and patient was responding at that time, patient transferred to the hospital. After hospital visit staff reported back the doctor felt it was an anxiety response rather than a vaccine reaction.

23 2021-01-14 mobility decreased Gradual onset of soreness beginning about an hour post-vaccine and worsening throughout day. By the ... Read more
Close
Gradual onset of soreness beginning about an hour post-vaccine and worsening throughout day. By the evening, left arm pain was too uncomfortable to wash dishes and lift household objects. Pain woke me up at 3am that night and I could not push the covers off of me, dress or undress, and I experienced severe pain with slight movement (7/10). Nausea and cold sweats began around 5am and lasted for 45min. I contacted the nurse via messaging system and was told to take OTC nausea medicine and Tylenol. I took the maximum dosage for Tylenol that day but could not do my normal school functions. The next day I was still limited by pain but did not require medication to cope. By day three, I had full range of motion back and minimal pain. Day four I am back to exercising normally.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Night of shot arm began to hurt. It became very painful by the time I went to bed. 10x worse than a flu shot Next morning at 8am, got up and almost passed out. Went back to bed. Got up at 10. Arm was painful to move. Began fever at 12 noon. Highest was 102. Terrible chills and aches and pains throughout entire body... lasted through bedtime. Tylenol did not manage the symptoms. Day 3 I was much better. I did experience fatigue, but arm pain was wearing off quickly.

I took ibuprofen for the fever, which continued to come back until about 07:30pm/08:00pm Saturday evening. My headache persisted until later Saturday evening after taking over the counter Headache Relief. I gained my appetite early Sunday morning.

Close
30-40 minutes after receiving the vaccine, it became more difficult to swallow. Shortly after, my tongue and lips were tingling. I was dizzy. I went to the Emergency Department and got Prednisone, Pepcid, and Benadryl. The next day, I started to experience tremors, mostly in my right hand. Two days later, I was so dizzy that the room was spinning and I could hardly stand up. Did not receive treatment for it.

Now on 01/16/2021, I started getting a cough, a sore throat, a fever, and extremely tired. Then the next day the symptoms got worse and now I had a stuffy nose, inner ear pain, nausea, muscle aches all over my body, dizzyness, and chills. This continued into Sunday and now Monday.

23 2021-01-17 mobility decreased A few hours after receiving the vaccine I had muscle soreness onset in L deltoid near site of inject... Read more
Close
A few hours after receiving the vaccine I had muscle soreness onset in L deltoid near site of injection. A few hours after that I had moderate soreness in L deltoid, down L arm (bicep/tricep), and up into L pec and trap. I had difficulty abducting L arm to 90 deg but was not hindered in normal movements. Approaching midnight that day the soreness was improving and by mid next day it was limited to L deltoid upon palpation. After 2-3 days soreness resolved. No other adverse effects noted. I have had very minor muscle soreness to a few vaccinations before, but not this bad. In those cases it has been limited to site of injection (deltoid) and less severe. Usually I don't notice anything after injections and I've never had any other adverse effects.

ON 1/18/21 I NOTCIED RADIATING PAIN IN MY RIGHT ARM WHERE I WAS VACCINATED. I LOOKED AND I HAD A HUGE RED CIRCLE WITH EXTREME FEVER AND SWELLING AEOUND THE VACCINE SITE. PAIN STILL RADIATING IN ARM REDNESS AND SWELLING HAS NOT WENT DOWN. ALSO IT HAS STARTED TO ITCH. ALSO, IM NOT SURE IF ITS RELATED, BUT I HAD A COUPLE OF DIZZY SPELLS 1/14-1/17 THAT CONSISTED OF TINGLING LIPS AND RIGHT SIDE OF YMFACE FELT FUZZY. IT HAS WENT AWAY. CURRENTLY JUST DEALING WITH PAIN AND SWELLING AT THE INJECTION SITE.

On 12/30/2020, I experienced extreme abdominal pain and cramping, diarrhea that resulted in syncope, severe fatigue, injection site pain and swelling, nausea, dizziness, lethargy, apathy. These symptoms lasted for over a week. The only syncope episode was the morning after the vaccine.
23 2021-01-22 dizziness Patient only had muffin and coffee that day early in am. Had some arm pain after shot no other react... Read more
Close
Patient only had muffin and coffee that day early in am. Had some arm pain after shot no other reaction. Did go home felt some nausea . Did not throw up. Did not eat anything rest of day until around 11:30 pm . Felt much more nauseated and stomach cramping. Said she felt light headed and then had what appears to be vasovagal with brief passing out and then revived and with sweats. Was not confused . Did not loose continence. Was completely coherent after event. Went to ER to be checked out. In ER was found to have UTI and given some Rochephin . Had severe face and body swelling reaction requiring benadryl. Was observed and sent home after several hours. It was assumed that ER had reported this although it was felt by ER and us that this was vasovagal from not eating and nausea and UTI on top of that. Did not feel was secondary to vaccine . ER did not feel it was either. However while probably unrelated we felt should document it.

23 2021-01-23 gait disturbance Following the second phase around 5pm the intense feeling being extremely cold and despite being und... Read more
Close
Following the second phase around 5pm the intense feeling being extremely cold and despite being under 4 covers and a heated blanket I did not find relief. At this time the injection site was inflamed and painful to the slightest touch and beginning to experience a severe headache I took Nyquil Cold and Flu 30mL and ibuprofen 800. 5am I am waking up with a fever of 101.7, stiff hands, and a continuation of the headache and body aches from the night. I again took ibuprofen 800, and 2 Tylenols extra strength (as needed) every 4 hours, and Nyquil Cold and Flu 30mL in the morning and evening. My body temperature seemed to have fluctuated every hour being unbearably cold to blood boiling hot with every move I make painful to the point of being bed ridden and needing assistance to get up to go to the restroom. My injection site has grown from the size of a quarter on Friday Morning 1/22 to about the size of grapefruit by Sunday 1/24 . I have pictures documenting its growth.
23 2021-01-25 fall I stay at my parents the night before work because their home is located much closer to work--my fia... Read more
Close
I stay at my parents the night before work because their home is located much closer to work--my fiance and I live much farther away. I received the vaccination around 10AM Sunday morning. Sunday night I went to bed around 8:30PM and experienced severe chills throughout the night. I awoke around 12AM and got up to get a drink. I got a drink of water and checked my temperature, temp was 100.7. I felt yucky but not horrible. I walked back to my parents' room to tell them I would be staying home from work. As I got to their room and began to speak, I began to feel nauseous and weak and suddenly collapsed. My dad leaped up and helped me stand up so I could get to the restroom. I walked a few steps and then collapsed again and lost complete consciousness--I do not recall collapsing again or what happened shortly after. Per my dad, I was unresponsive, and he drug my limp body from his bedroom to the bathroom. My mom called 911. After several minutes, I regained consciousness and was leaning against my dad in the bathroom. I felt my fever break and was sweating profusely. EMS arrived at my home and checked vitals--everything was stable. I was A&O x3 and was able to drink water. I declined being transported to the hospital. I felt the loss of consciousness was likely due to dehydration or fever (although my fever really wasn't that high).

23 2021-01-26 dizziness Pt reported Headache, feeling of lightheadedness and dizziness 20 minutes after receiving immunizat... Read more
Close
Pt reported Headache, feeling of lightheadedness and dizziness 20 minutes after receiving immunization. She was monitored for 30 minutes and symptoms improved every 5 minutes and Vital signs were normal. She did not develop any rash, swelling, itching, throat discomfort or difficulty swallowing. No cough or dyspnea. No Nausea or vomiting. -She was placed in exam room, supine on exam table with legs bent at knee. VS were monitored continuous pulse and pulse ox and blood pressure every 4-5 minutes. VS remained normal. She drank 12 oz. water after 5-10 minutes She also had came to the clinic right after working a night shift and did not drink much fluid that morning. Her symptoms appear to be a vasovagal response. She left the clinic after 30 minutes in stable condition with resolution of dizziness, light headedness and headache was mild.

Vaccine around 3:30pm. Went to bed that same night with slight arm pain. Throughout the night arm pain got progressively worse and could not sleep due to extreme pain and inability to move through range of motion, in addition to night sweats. (did not have a fever). Woke up the next morning with a severe headache and nausea. Fainted around 10am (18 hours post vaccination). Headache and minor dizziness continued throughout the rest of the day. By 24 hours post vaccine, no symptoms besides very minimal arm soreness.

Close
1/25- received vaccine at 11:45 am. Started round-the-clock extra strength Tylenol at 12:00pm. At 10:30pm began to feel chills and body aches. 11:00pm got very hot and sweaty, hands began to tingle, vision became fuzzy around the edges, felt like I was going to pass out. Experienced tachycardia, tachypnea, and headache. 12:20am- vomited. Restless sleep through the night, chills, fever (100.6-99.6 on Tylenol), body aches, joint pain, stomach ache, woke at 5:00am. 1/26- spent all day vomiting. At least once every hour. Continued tachycardia, tachypnea, stomach ache, fever, headache, body aches, and joint pain. At 7:00pm took Zofran and I stopped vomiting. Still nauseous. Could not eat all day. 1/27- woke up with headache and slight body aches but otherwise felt okay during the day. Was hungry and able to eat. Starting at 10:00pm my stomach began to hurt again. Experienced bloating, sharp stabbing pain and nausea. Felt like I needed to vomit or pass a bowel movement but could not do either. Took Zofran at 11:00pm, did not help in relieving my GI symptoms. Still on round-the-clock extra strength Tylenol. Could not eat all night. 1/28- woke up still with headache, and mild-moderate stomach pain. Able to eat a couple bites of food.

Patient received her second dose of Moderna Vaccine at 17:00 and at 17:09 reported developing lightheadedness, itchy throat and subsequently became SOB and diaphoretic. Tachycardia noted at 120 bpm, and BP 148/80, RR 26. Medical First Response called and Dr. present administering Epi 0.3 ml sq to left lateral thigh at 17:12. Benadryl 50 mg given in R. Deltoid at 15:14. Pt. vital improved- 17:28: BP 130/82 and HR 90 RR 18. Transferred to ED. Noted to be diaphoretic, SOB, ashen skin and wheezing in the ED. Given Epi, Pepcid, Deacadron, Benadryl in ED and pt. responded well and discharged when hemodynamically stable. Discharge with Predisone and Benadryl. PCP f/u 2/4/2021

Received shot at 2:45pm. Sore/stiff arm started around 6pm. Went to sleep and woke up at 1:00am shaking with a fever and chills. Severe headache, throat sore with swollen glands, could barely walk/move or get out of bed. Also experienced nausea. Took tylenol around 1:00am and again at 5:00am. Could not move from bed on Wednesday and had to call out of work Thursday with a bad headache, weakness, and overall body pain/discomfort. It is now Friday and I am still having very bad joint and muscle pain when I walk and move and still have a headache and fatigue/weakness.
23 2021-01-29 dizziness I received my second dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine at approx. 10:40 AM on Friday, January 29 at ... Read more
Close
I received my second dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine at approx. 10:40 AM on Friday, January 29 at clinic. By 12:00 PM, I noticed that I developed facial swelling, which was most significant around my eyes, and I felt lethargic. Between 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM, I developed hives on my neck, chest, stomach, and arms, which prompted me to take 1/2 of a dose of 25mg Benadryl. Nonetheless, the symptoms persisted and I began to experience dizziness and tightness in my throat around 4-5 PM, which was when I was advised by a nurse to go to the emergency room for treatment. I arrived at Hospital's Emergency Department around 6:00 PM and I was treated for "Possible Allergic Reaction Major." I received diphenhydrAMINE (BENADRYL) injection 50 mg, famotidine (PF) (PEPCID) injection 20 mg, methylPREDNISolone sodium succinate (PF) (SOLU-MEDROL) injection 125 mg, sodium chloride 0.9 % iv bolus, and acetaminophen (TYLENOL) tablet 650 mg. I was discharged after 10:00 PM and sent home with a prescription for predniSONE 20 mg and famotidine 20 mg. My facial swelling and hives have gone down but neither have completely resolved since being discharged. I am also experiencing full body aches and fatigue at this time (3 PM on Saturday, January 30).

23 2021-01-31 impaired driving ability I got the shot at about 7:25pm on Saturday and then was scheduled to work the next morning, Sunday, ... Read more
Close
I got the shot at about 7:25pm on Saturday and then was scheduled to work the next morning, Sunday, at 4:30 am. I had not felt great from the moment I got up on Sunday, and felt progressively worse throughout the day. I had really bad body aches and chills, to the point where I was shivering, even with three layers and a puffy coat on. I normally never get cold. I also had a really bad headache. By the time my shift was over at 1pm, I wasn?t even sure I could trust myself to drive home. Eventually I decided it was fine, but by the time I got home I felt so terrible that it took me at least 15 minutes to get out of the car. I took a hot shower and went to bed. I was shivering violently, even with lots of blankets, and couldn?t even sit up to drink some water. I laid in bed for hours, doing absolutely nothing and feeling miserable. I got up after 7:00 pm to eat some dinner and felt so nauseous that I was dry-heaving into the toilet.

23 2021-02-09 dizziness I am almost a licensed pharmacist so I am aware of what was going on with my body* I started with a ... Read more
Close
I am almost a licensed pharmacist so I am aware of what was going on with my body* I started with a sore arm and fatigue on the day of vaccination. The following morning I woke up and got dressed and used the restroom. I proceeded downstairs to make my coffee. As I was doing so I became dizzy and nauseous. I sat down on the floor and then I lost my vision and hearing. I broke out in a profuse sweat and had no concept of time. My boyfriend was with me and said it took 5-10 minutes before I began to normalize. I apparently had shallow breathing and turned pale white including my lips, I slowly regained awareness although I never fully lost consciousness. 911 was called and paramedics arrived. by this time I had begun to normalize with most of my vision returning. I ended up declining to see medical attention because I normalized and told the paramedics I would seek attention if it came back. * please note the physician listed is my PCP but I was not seen for this reaction.

Approximately 13 hours after vaccination, I began to feel nauseous, dizzy, and shaky along with my earlier symptoms. I felt like I was going to faint with blurred vision and ringing in my ears even while lying down. I started sweating along with the chills. The dizziness and nausea subsided after approximately two hours. The headache lasted approximately 48 hours after the vaccination.

From patient note: 2/19/21 Day of Vaccination - Morning of the vaccination had burning in arm at and around the injection site with severe soreness of arm developing over the day. After 5 hours faintness, sore neck/shoulders, trembling hands, "super shaky", also headache with stabbing pain in head and neck which continued for several days. Tight chest developing within 3 hours gradually turning into extreme difficulty breathing by 9pm. Around 9pm both arms from shoulders to fingertips went numb and tingly "like nerves were TV static". Throughout night drank about 1 bottle of water per hour, each time getting up and taking a few steps vision would start blacking out, would feel clammy, and would barely make it back to bed before fainting. Extreme muscle and joint pain made walking difficult for 3 days.. Fever of 99-101 for 3 days. Day 2 - extreme back pain accompanied by heartburn On 2/22/21 reports doing better but continuing to have soreness, night sweats, chills
23 2021-02-23 mobility decreased Joint pain and cracking at shoulder lasting a whole week now. After receiving my injection, I notice... Read more
Close
Joint pain and cracking at shoulder lasting a whole week now. After receiving my injection, I noticed that it was given very high up on my arm, just barely 1 finger width's away from my shoulder joint. As a healthcare provider myself, I know to be aware not to administer too high as this can result in shoulder injury. I unfortunately seem to have encountered this firsthand myself. I wanted to wait a week hoping the pain would go away, but it is still there even after a week. It was severe pain starting about 36 hours after receiving the shot, then for two more days, the pain was about 8/10. The pain has become less severe over time, but I am unable to use my left arm to the same capacity anymore due to this constant shoulder joint pain. Prior to this, I have never had any shoulder pain.

Close
Patient called Health Dept 3/2/2021 at 9:30 am reporting reactions after receiving first Moderna vaccine on 2/26/21. Patient received vaccine at approximately 10:20 am on 2/26/21. She reports that a few minutes after receiving vaccine that her throat felt really dry. It felt 'like when you wake up from anesthesia'. She had no breathing problems so she didn't think much of it. About an hour after receiving vaccine, she went through a drive thru to order food and 'wasn't thinking right, like I had brain fog'. That lasted a short time. About an hour after receiving vaccine, patient noticed lips and mouth were tingling 'like I had ate something really spicy'. This lasted off an on for about an hour. Later that evening, patient felt dizzy and nauseated. She laid down and took a nap and woke up feeling better. Skin started to feel itchy that night. On 2/27/21, patient woke up with an itchy rash all over back. Rash is still there. No other symptoms at this time.

23 2021-03-14 dizziness Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA I received the vaccine on 3/13 at 3:45pm and began experiencing symptom... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA I received the vaccine on 3/13 at 3:45pm and began experiencing symptoms on the day at 5:30pm including dizziness, nausea, fatigue and wiped-out exhaustion, drunk-like dazed and confused, body heaviness, and developed soreness in the muscle of the right arm where the injection had been administered. The symptoms progressed at 6:30pm to include general muscle soreness, muscle twitching on the right side of the body especially on the right upper thigh, increased appetite, malaise, headache, and chills in addition to the aforementioned symptoms. At 7:30pm the nausea and increased appetite improved with food and fluid intake but sleepiness, yawning, confusion, chills, and fatigue worsened at 8:30pm. Temperature at 9:30pm was 95.7 degrees Fahrenheit and a pale, green-like, clammy appearance was visible on the general skin. At 10:30pm the sleepiness reversed to restlessness and insomnia to the point of hyperactivity, and the appetite increased four-fold along with rash up and down the injected arm, numbness and tingling in the injected arm, chest discomfort with palpitations, anxiety, headache, stomach pain, malaise, and general limb edema which all persisted until I was able to fall asleep at 6:30am on 3/14. Many of the aforementioned symptoms improved upon wakeup time at 4pm on 3/14, but extreme sleepiness with nausea, dizziness, fatigue, head pain and right eye pain, and palpitations with chest discomfort persisted until 10am on 3/15, during which time only the nausea, dizziness, and fatigue persisted.

Close
3:30am woke up feeling nauseous, within seconds of standing up lost vision and balance, ran to the bathroom and fell. Woke up in a different spot with a bit of black eye from falling. Woke up and felt very out of it and not sure of things. Drank a lot of water but a few hours later, got up and felt nauseous again like I was going to pass out again. Fever of 101.8 F. Lots of body aches and chills. Sweating like no other.

23 2021-03-21 dizziness Within about 5 minutes of patient receiving the vaccine, she began to feel dizzy and nausea. She pr... Read more
Close
Within about 5 minutes of patient receiving the vaccine, she began to feel dizzy and nausea. She proceeded to have several episodes of vomiting afterward. She was treated with oral Benadryl 25mg PO x1, but vomited afterward. She was later administered Benadryl 25mg IM x1 and Zofran 4mg ODT x1 with improvement in her symptoms. Vital signs remained stable throughout 2 hours of observation and she was discharged home. Subsequent telephone follow-up indicated patient's initial symptoms continued to improve by the evening and the following day. Patient never developed syncope, rash/hives/SOB/lip, tongue or throat swelling.

That evening I had slight chills, low fever and body aches, which went away by the next day. The next morning, I had a severe tightening of the left side of my neck and shoulder, along with arm soreness. I saw my Physical Therapist and was told that it was a result of the vaccine. I was fine until I got the vertigo Friday evening. It came on really quickly and I've never experienced it before. I was okay the next morning with the exception of a headache, which lasted for about a month after that. My doctor offered shots for them, but I couldn't take them due to my current meds. I was told to come back if they continue.

23 2021-03-31 dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID19 vaccine at 1030 via IM injection in left deltoid. Pri... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID19 vaccine at 1030 via IM injection in left deltoid. Prior to injection, patient reported being nervous about fainting. She reported no prior history of fainting due to vaccination or blood draws; she "passed out" two years prior to dehydration at a music festival. Approximately four minutes after injection, patient stated that she was going to "pass out" and had an episode of syncope. She exhibited pallor, dry heaving, and arm contractures. The nurse helped her to a supine position on the floor and called for assistance. The nurse team encouraged deep breathing and provided apple juice, pretzels, ammonia inhalent, and cool washcloths. EMS was called and arrived at 1045 for further assessment. Patient reported that she had not consumed any food or drink prior to vaccination and stated that her hands were "tingly". EMS took blood pressure and heart rate; both were within normal range. The patient was taken to the hospital by EMS at 1055, where providers determined that syncope was likely caused by anxiety. Patient returned home and reported feeling tired but stable when health department called to check in at 1400.
23 2021-03-31 dizziness 23 y.o. female has a past medical history of Anxiety and Depression. Who was a proceed out after r... Read more
Close
23 y.o. female has a past medical history of Anxiety and Depression. Who was a proceed out after receiving her first vaccine for Covid. Patient reports a long history of of fainting with vaccines in the past. She received the first vaccine and about a minute later started to feel diaphoretic and lightheaded. She had to sit herself down and staff at the vaccine clinic lifted up her legs. Ended up doing repeat vitals with initial blood pressure of 60 over palp. She was cool and clammy at that time. She denies any nausea or flushing. At the time of my evaluation in the bouncing clinic, blood pressure had improved to 85 over palp with 2+ radial pulses bilaterally. Patient was then transferred to emergency department for observation. At the time of transfer she started to feel back to baseline. She denies any cardiac history, drug use, decreased p.o. intake, family history of cardiac disease, sudden history of cardiac death, bleeding, black or bloody stools. She is unsure of her last menstrual period.

Close
Patient received vaccine at 6:03 pm, patient was in recovery area and experienced syncope at 6:07 pm, patient fell to the group face down, nurses responded turned patient on left side, patient had 5-10 second seizure with full body seizing and eyes rolled backed. EMS called. Right frontal area hematoma due to hitting head on floor. Patient confused at first, BP 98/64, HR 80 at 6:10, patient diaphoretic, reassessed BP 105/60 HR 82, EMS assessed, patient LOC returning A&Ox4, able to remember she does have seizures and takes seizure medications but cannot remember medication name. Nurses advised patient to be transported by EMS, patient refused, patient boyfriend and mom also refused and stated they would take her themselves. Boyfriend to drive patient to ER for follow up per patient and family.
23 2021-04-01 mobility decreased I have been experiencing intense upper arm pain from my shoulder to my elbow. I am not able to lift... Read more
Close
I have been experiencing intense upper arm pain from my shoulder to my elbow. I am not able to lift my arm. My blood work shows inflammation markers and low levels of ANA and IFA markers. I did not have any of these symptoms or markers before taking the vaccine. I am not able to go to work. I have seen a primary care physician and a neurologist. When taking the steroid Prednisone, the pain does subside, but I am not allowed to take a steroid for more than one week. I stopped taking my second dose of Prednisone 4 days ago, and now all the pain has returned and I cannot lift my arm. This situation is frustrating and scary. The doctors do not have a diagnosis or treatment plan. Pain relievers do not help at all.

23 2021-04-22 fall Called to evaluate patient in COVID-19 vaccination clinic area after witnessed "fainting" at ~12:30 ... Read more
Close
Called to evaluate patient in COVID-19 vaccination clinic area after witnessed "fainting" at ~12:30 PM. Briefly this is a 23 yo female with unremarkable PMHx; Meds- OCPs; Allergies- PCN and Gluten. Pt received the first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 12:25 PM with RN. Per RN report the patient informed her that she had a remote history of "passing out" after a vaccine as a child, but it had not happened recently. The RN observed the patient at her vaccine station for 3 min then accompanied her to the observation area. Per report of COVID-19 Patient Observer, pt was seen falling out of her chair in a seated position and it was unclear if she hit her head. Per a witness, pt hit her head on the computer cart that was nearby. The COVID-19 Patient Observer called for assistance and 911 was called. She was immediately evaluated by COVID-19 Patient observer and RN and noted to be unresponsive initially. The RN reported that she opened her eyes and became verbally responsive to verbal stimuli and touch. Upon my arrival, pt was noted to be responsive and lying on floor on her abdomen. She initially denied pain, but later complained of pain at crown of her head to touch. Pt denied CP, HA, SOB, difficulty breathing, pruritis, rash, nausea, or visual disturbances. Orthostatics were obtained (lying- 124/90-102; sitting- 137/81-115; Standing 123/87 - 96). Patient maintained her O2 sat at 98% throughout the evaluation. She was assisted to wheelchair and reported feeling better. PE: A&O x 3 HEENT: Normocephalic, tenderness to palpation at crown of head, no lacerations or bruising noted, pupils equal CV: Tachycardic, regular rhythm, no M/R/G Resp: CTA B no W/R Ext: No UE or LE pain to palpation or edema noted A/P: 23 yo s/p COVID-19 vaccine with likely vasovagal reaction and head trauma. 1. Vasovagal Reaction/Head Trauma - Pt transported by EMS to local hospital for evaluation - Telemedicine visit with COVID-19 vaccine clinic on Monday 4/26/2021 2. COVID-19 Vaccine - VAERS report to be filled by Dr. - FU for COVID-19 vaccine in 4 weeks - Pt to receive vaccine in supine position and be observed for min 30 min - Recommend pt to be accompanied by friend/family member at next visit
