23 2021-04-24 dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine on 4/25/2021 at 2:50pm. Patient was in obser... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine on 4/25/2021 at 2:50pm. Patient was in observation area chair 1 and technician noticed she was pale in color and patient waved technician over to her. Technician went to her and then alerted Pharmacist that patient was feeling light headed and was pale. I went to patient and asked her how she was feeling and if she was having any trouble breathing. Patient was starting to slouch in her chair and I asked her if I could lower her to the ground. At that time, she passed out and was unresponsive. I lowered her to the floor and supported her head with my hand. She was unresponsive for about 5-10 seconds but then her eyes popped open wide and she made a large gasping breath. She was very disoriented and asked what happened. As I talked to her and asked her questions, she became oriented with her surroundings and was able to verbally communicate with me how she was feeling. Patient was reporting tingling in hands, heart racing, and was visually shaky. I asked her if she wanted me to call EMS and she responded yes. At this time, patient was beyond the 15 minutes post observation waiting period. Technician called emergency number, I stayed on the ground with the patient and continued to assess her symptoms and her breathing. The color in her face resumed to normal and she was able to use her cell phone to contact her father. While sitting on the ground with her, she reported she was beginning to feel better, but was still feeling weird in her head. At that time, EMS arrived and took over.

Close
Within 30 minutes of receiving vaccine dose, extreme pain in right arm from injection site to forearm. Could not move arm at all and injection site was swollen, red, hot, light touch to arm was very painful. 7 hours from time of injection symptoms started which included nausea, fever of 100.2, chills, sweating, tightness in chest when inhaling, extreme muscle pain in legs, involuntary crying and burning sensation in both eyes, loss of appetite, and fatigue. Symptoms worsened on Day 2 and Day 3 after receiving vaccine. Fully recovered from all symptoms, including arm/injection site pain, within 10 days from when the vaccine was received.

A few minutes after arriving in recovery area, patient began to feel faint. This has happened to her in past with vaccination, she recognized it and laid herself on floor, staff in attendance recommended elevating feet as well, which she did. 23 2021-04-28 dizziness Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: patient presents to allergy clinic for follow-up. Patient reports with... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: patient presents to allergy clinic for follow-up. Patient reports within three minutes of vaccination feeling of throat closing and could not swallow. Reports nausea but denies urticaria and wheezing. Two minutes later reports feeling cold and shaky as if going in and out of consciousness. Diphenhydramine administered and per patient a medic was called who reported 5-6 minutes of seizure-like activity and patient being non-responsive with blood pressure 80/palp en route to the emergency department (ED). In the ED patient received epinephrine, steroids, and diphenhydramine, monitored for several housrs, and discharged. Two days later patient reports waking up and feeling as if throat was closing up again, self-administered Epi-Pen and diphenhydramine, and returned to the ED. Steroids and diphenhydramine were adminsitered, patient was monitored, symptoms resolved, and patient was discharged. Since vaccination patient reports fatigue, dizziness, lightheadedness, persistent diarrhea, and numbness. Patient advised to continue home management and follow-up allergy testing recommended.

Close
At 1:32pm Clinical Pharmacist alerted Nurse that patient verbalized that she was feeling dizzy, nauseous, "tingling on my face" and pain in the arm. RN responded and took the vitals signs recorded above. Patient reported last food eaten was at 10am. She came to the vaccine appointment from work. She reported she had not had much fluid to drink today. RN provided a cup of water (about 240mL). Patient has a history of anxiety and depression. Patient reports that she takes Hydroxyzine for anxiety in emergencies. She also takes Zoloft for depression. Patient denies any history of diabetes and heart conditions. Patient reports that she has an inhaler that she has not used recently. She reports she uses it for "when she overheats". Patient denies chest or throat tightness. Presented patient to NP. Agreed with plan for patient to wait in observation station until patient felt comfortable returning home. Coached patient in deep breathing exercises and advised patient on signs of more severe reactions and when to be seen at an Emergency room. Patient agreed to plan and verbalized a second time that she had no chest or throat tightness. Patient left at 2:02pm.

At 10:20am the patient received their dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. At 10:25am they began to feel hot, lightheaded, dizzy, and nauseous. A nurse was alerted and the patient was brought back to the clinic from the waiting room where they were placed in to a supine position with head elevated on an exam table. They were given a glass of water and their blood pressure was assessed. At 10:27am their blood pressure was 90/60. Their blood pressure was reassessed at 10:33am and it was 100/70. Close
Approximately 10 minutes post-vaccination, while seated in our post-vaccination area, patient began to experience shortness of breath, light headedness, dizziness, and nausea. Due to her breathing, 911 was called and arrived within 10 minutes. By the time they arrived, the patient was breathing normally and the nausea and dizziness were subsiding. They monitored her vital signs which were within normal limits. She was feeling much better and left with her brother who was driving. I spoke by phone with patient about 3 hours later. She stated that she was feeling back to normal and that she thought it was an anxiety attack (which she stated that she has a history of).

Close
About 10 minutes post-vaccination, while patient was seated in our post-vaccination area, she experienced shortness of breath, light headedness, and dizziness. She did not lose consciousness. Then she complained of nausea and thought she might vomit. We called 911 due to the difficulty breathing. By the time EMS arrived (within 10 minutes), patient was breathing normally and stated that she was feeling more normal. EMS monitored her vital signs, which were all within normal limits. Once the dizziness passed, she was able to leave with her brother. I did speak with her by phone about 3 hours later. Close
Patient returned to clinic following discharge complaining of dizziness (5/10) and throat swelling (4/10). Vitals: BP 110/72, HR=53, RR=12, Sp02=100% on room air. At approximately 1hr post-vaccination (and 30min post benadryl), patient reported throat swelling remained 4/10, facial pain now 2/10, dizziness 5/10, and headache 6/10. Clinic staff recommended patient go to hospital for evaluation; discharged from clinic to boyfriend for transport to HCF.

Patient is a 24 year old, female who received her first dose of Moderna lot 037C21A exp 06/17/21 around 10:22 am. While being monitored patient nausea and begin vomiting around 10:35 am. Patient transported to ER Initial vital signs @1035 - 98.2, SpO2 92%, 106/68, 18, HR 88. Vitals @ 1047 120/95, HR 93, SpO2 95%, RR 18 Pt was AAOx4, weak, dizzy, vomiting, cool & sweaty palms. 23 2021-05-26 mobility decreased Erythema Multiforme formed 10 days after first vaccine. 5/921: Formed a rash on hands and arms that... Read more
Close
Erythema Multiforme formed 10 days after first vaccine. 5/921: Formed a rash on hands and arms that resembled poison ivy, itched terribly. Went to urgent care and was given a steroid shot and an antihistamine. No change to current reaction, gotten worse as day progressed. 5/10/21: Rash had spread to feet, knees and elbows. Itched 10 times worse. Went back to urgent care, different doctor. Was diagnosed with hand foot mouth disease. Was given a nausea medication, a topical to dry up rash, and a stomach ulcer medication. No relief, no change. 5/11/21: rash now hurts and looked like cigarette burns. Can not close hands and walking is painful. Went to dermatologist. Was diagnosed with erythema multiforme and was given oral steroid for 16 days started at 40 mg and tapered down to 10 mg. Saw and felt immediate relief. 5/25/21: had follow up appointment with dermatologist. Was recommended not to get second vaccine as reaction could be worse and more threatening.

23 2021-05-28 movement disorder, mobility decreased feeling like passing out; paleness; injection site pain; she felt tired, exhausted; headache; feelin... Read more
Close
feeling like passing out; paleness; injection site pain; she felt tired, exhausted; headache; feeling like a golf ball is under the skin; inability to move her arm above her heart because the pain was so severe. Patient reports inability to use her arm and intense pain when changing clothes; feeling horrible; she couldn't function; she couldn't or eat; wanting to sleep; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of NEAR DEATH EXPERIENCE (feeling like passing out) in a 23-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 003B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COVID-19 in April 2021, Narcolepsy, Depression, Anxiety, Loss of smell on 02-Apr-2021 and Loss of taste on 02-Apr-2021. Concurrent medical conditions included Drug allergy (Biaxin) and Drug allergy (Adderall generics-anaphylaxis related to an unidentified inactive ingredient in certain). Concomitant products included PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL), VITAMIN C [ASCORBIC ACID], COLECALCIFEROL (VITAMIN D3), FISH OIL and ZINC for an unknown indication. On 25-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 25-Apr-2021, the patient experienced SWELLING (feeling like a golf ball is under the skin), MOBILITY DECREASED (inability to move her arm above her heart because the pain was so severe. Patient reports inability to use her arm and intense pain when changing clothes), FEELING ABNORMAL (feeling horrible), MOVEMENT DISORDER (she couldn't function), EATING DISORDER (she couldn't or eat), SOMNOLENCE (wanting to sleep), VACCINATION SITE PAIN (injection site pain), FATIGUE (she felt tired, exhausted) and HEADACHE (headache). On 26-Apr-2021, the patient experienced NEAR DEATH EXPERIENCE (feeling like passing out) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and PALLOR (paleness). The patient was treated with CHLORPHENAMINE MALEATE, PARACETAMOL, PSEUDOEPHEDRINE HYDROCHLORIDE (TYLENOL COLD MEDICATION) from 25-Apr-2021 to 30-Apr-2021 at a dose of 1 dosage form. On 26-Apr-2021, NEAR DEATH EXPERIENCE (feeling like passing out) and PALLOR (paleness) had resolved. On 02-May-2021, SWELLING (feeling like a golf ball is under the skin), MOBILITY DECREASED (inability to move her arm above her heart because the pain was so severe. Patient reports inability to use her arm and intense pain when changing clothes) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (injection site pain) had resolved. On 06-May-2021, FEELING ABNORMAL (feeling horrible), MOVEMENT DISORDER (she couldn't function), EATING DISORDER (she couldn't or eat), SOMNOLENCE (wanting to sleep), FATIGUE (she felt tired, exhausted) and HEADACHE (headache) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 02-Apr-2021, SARS-CoV-2 test: positive. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Patient administered two Tylenol tablets per day from 25Apr2021 to 30Apr2021 to treat her symptoms. Patient reports these symptoms [unrelated to injected site] lasted 10-11 days. Patient reports no previous reactions to any past vaccinations. Patient reports loss of sense of smell and taste on 2Apr2021, which prompted her to get a rapid COVID-19 test, that initially resulted in a negative result. Patient reports receiving a phone call on 5Apr2021 notifying her that upon further laboratory testing of her sample, she was COVID-19 positive. Patient reports quarantining until 11Apr2021. Patient reports she was symptom free by 11Apr2021 when she discontinued isolation. Company comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

23 2021-06-09 dizziness Within minutes of receiving the covid vaccine, the patient stated that she felt hot and dizzy. She k... Read more
Close
Within minutes of receiving the covid vaccine, the patient stated that she felt hot and dizzy. She kept seated on her chair for 10 more mins, after which she felt like she was about to faint. She walked up to me (pharmacist) for assistance, at which point she lost consciousness for a brief second. My colleague and I held her and we laid her down on the floor. As soon as she was laid down she vomited. Her vomit was bright red color with granular particles. To avoid her from chocking, I immediately rolled her over to the left side at which point she said she is okay and needed to get up. She said that she just had some flaming hot chips before coming to get the vaccine. She was given water to drink and a granola bar to eat and she was monitored for another 30 minutes without any further issues.
23 2021-06-10 dizziness Within a minute of administering the vaccine, the patient felt her arm where the injection was admin... Read more
Close
Within a minute of administering the vaccine, the patient felt her arm where the injection was administered go numb. She also felt sporadic muscle spasms going down her feet. She said she started to feel dizzy, so we laid her down on the floor with her 2 feet up on a chair. She laid there for few minutes after which she said she felt better. She sat up on the floor and her B.P reading was taken. Her B.P reading read 88/68 mmHg. On further investigation she stated that she has a history of anemia, but hasn't been to a doctor in a few years. On the floor (concrete), her body started to shiver, so we moved her to a chair and she was given water to drink and a granola bar to eat. She was also given a blanket and some hot chocolate to drink. 15 minutes later, her B.P reading was checked again and it was 111/78mmHg. We monitored her for 30-40 minutes and after she felt back to normal she was asked to take some rest at home and follow up with a physician to make sure her Hemoglobin levels.
23 2021-06-11 dizziness Obese female patient with history of diabetes and seizure came to our pharmacy for second Moderna c... Read more
Close
Obese female patient with history of diabetes and seizure came to our pharmacy for second Moderna covid dose. A few minutes after receiving the vaccine, she was feeling lightheaded and nausea. I asked the patient to come back in to the consultation room where she could sit or lay down on the floor. The patient was able to walk back into the room with a little assistance from her mother. She sat on the floor for a bit, still breathing fine, and said she wanted to throw up. I grabbed a trash can, napkins, and a pedialyte bottle for her. She did not throw up but started breathing a little heavier and said she was about to faint. I got the epi pen ready and told her please lay down if she has to. At this point she fell to her right side and slightly hit her head against the wall. It appeared that she stopped breathing for few seconds, but I still felt a pulse on her wrist. It also appeared that she went into a seizure, her upper body stiffened up and her arms were slightly flailing. I immediately called 911 and about 1 minute later, both the mother and I could clearly see the patient breathing as indicative by the rising/lowering chest. I also felt a stronger pulse on her wrist. I did not inject the epi pen. Paramedics arrived shortly and after about 5-10 minutes of talking to her, the patient began to gain conscious but looked exhausted. They transported her to the hospital. Per the mother, patient was completely fine after the first dose of Moderna; also just had a seizure a few days before the second Moderna dose. The whole incident was about 20 minutes from administering the vaccine to paramedics transporting her away.

The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. In May 2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. In May 2021, the patient experienced INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (had flu-like symptoms), VACCINATION SITE PAIN (pain as the second dose really hurt while being administered) and FATIGUE (tired). On 31-May-2021 at 8:30 AM, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Fell, or possibly fainted or passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and TREMOR (shaking). 31-May-2021 at 8:30 AM, the patient experienced FEELING ABNORMAL (patient felt a little off or funny for a while - dazed) and HYPOACUSIS (at first could not hear when spoken to). On 06-Jun-2021 at 8:30 PM, the patient experienced HYPOAESTHESIA (numb legs) and DIZZINESS (felt lightheaded -dizziness). On an unknown date, the patient experienced AMNESIA (the patient does not remember what happened). On 31-May-2021, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Fell, or possibly fainted or passed out), TREMOR (shaking) and FEELING ABNORMAL (patient felt a little off or funny for a while - dazed) had resolved. On 31-May-2021 at 8:35 AM, HYPOACUSIS (at first could not hear when spoken to) had resolved. On 06-Jun-2021, HYPOAESTHESIA (numb legs) and DIZZINESS (felt lightheaded -dizziness) had resolved. At the time of the report, INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (had flu-like symptoms), AMNESIA (the patient does not remember what happened), VACCINATION SITE PAIN (pain as the second dose really hurt while being administered) and FATIGUE (tired) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 06-Jun-2021, Blood test: normal (normal) normal. On 06-Jun-2021, Electrocardiogram: normal (normal) Found nothing wrong. On 06-Jun-2021, Thyroid function test: normal (normal) Found nothing wrong. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. The patient experienced some pretty weird stuff after completing the Moderna Covid-19 series. The patient received both doses on separate occasions at drive-up vaccination events. The patient had maybe passed out and that at first could not hear when spoken to and was sitting there all dazed with her eyes kind of weird and was shaking. Within 5 minutes most of the symptoms had resolved. The patient felt a little off or funny for a while, and the symptoms resolved in an hour. On 06-Jun-2021 at probably 8:30 pm the patient had lightheadedness and dizziness and something like numb legs, described as the same type of spell she had before on 31May2021 because the patient said she was feeling the same things again. Because of the symptoms, the patient's husband took her to the Emergency Room (ER) last night 06-Jun-2021. She was not admitted to the hospital but was released last night 6Jun2021. No treatment information was provided. awoke at 2 am with nausea, chills, generalized pain. Immediately felt myself start to pass out or have a seizure- I am not sure which. Family member reports my eyes were open with absent stare however I lost consciousness, <60s. My right calf was in a severe muscle spasm as soon as I became conscious which leads me to believe I had some convulsions. Nausea chills and generalized pain persisted throughout the rest of the morning. Stopped around 10 am and turned into pounding headache and fatigue. Additionally my left arm is in moderate to severe pain (not like the typical soreness I get with the flu shot). I am in significant pain moving my arm, but also changing body positions while keeping my shoulder still and close to my body (bending over, scooting over in bed).

Close
Employee felt dizzy and lightheaded. Stated she "felt like she was going to pass out." Gave her orange juice placed her in Exam room lying down took B/P, O2 and Kept Eye on her. Dr. examined her and had her stay lying down for at least 30 mins. Employee was feeling much better and left at 4:00pm with someone to drive her home.
24 2021-01-10 dizziness Immediately after receiving the vaccine I felt fine. Around 7 pm that night I began having body ache... Read more
Close
Immediately after receiving the vaccine I felt fine. Around 7 pm that night I began having body aches that continually worsened throughout the night. At 2 am on Saturday I took my temperature and it was 101.6 F, at 3 am it was 102 F. The body aches, joint pain, fever, and headache continued through the next day until about 6 pm on Saturday. Also on Saturday around 12 pm I began experiencing severe nausea, abdominal pain, and dizziness. At one point it felt as if I was going to pass out. All the major symptoms finally subsided Saturday night around 6 pm. Saturday till Sunday I have felt fatigued and sore but otherwise fine.
24 2021-01-10 dizziness 1 hour after vaccination client complained of dizziness, swelling of right hand. No general s/s of a... Read more
Close
1 hour after vaccination client complained of dizziness, swelling of right hand. No general s/s of anaphylaxis noted. Pt was given juice, crackers and asked to rest in recumbent position. Symptoms did not improve and 12.5 mg of benadryl IM given in opposite arm of injection. After 15 minutes same general symptoms present; another 12.5mg of benadryl IM given again in opposite arm of injection. Pt remained lying down and 20 min after 2nd dose of benadryl patient reported feeling improved and able to ambulate independently. And monitored in her workplace without further intervention.

24 2021-01-12 dizziness body aches, chills, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness, headache, fatigue, and fever
24 2021-01-12 dizziness After receiving the vaccine i just felt pain on my right arm. Took 600mg of ibuprofen around 8:30pm ... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine i just felt pain on my right arm. Took 600mg of ibuprofen around 8:30pm and went to bed. Upon waking up the next morning (today) at 7am, I felt very weak. I ate breakfast by 8am and head to work. The weakness persisted, by 10am when I went to the restroom I felt as if i was going to collapse from how weak I felt while standing. Felt some chills as if my chest was breathing in cold air. By 10:40am I was home in bed resting. Had a moderate headache and chills, weakness persisted. At 12:50pm I had a fever of 100.9 F. I drank water, took 600mg ibuprofen and ate an orange. Around 2pm I felt strong enough to get up and take a short walk. At 3:00pm my temperature was 99.8 F, chills were gone. Weakness had improved. No more headache. At 4:45pm temperature at 99.2 F. And feeling better. I took lunch around 3pm
24 2021-01-12 dizziness Patient received Moderna COVID19 vaccination. She was sitting in our waiting room for her 15 min obs... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderna COVID19 vaccination. She was sitting in our waiting room for her 15 min observation and 5-8 minutes after being vaccinated patient began to feel lightheaded and faint. She said her vision was blurred and felt very faint. 911 was called and paramedics assessed her. She quickly began to feel better and mentioned she got this way when she got her ears pierced. Patient stayed for another 15 minutes, drank water and was 100% better.
24 2021-01-13 dizziness called to Car after vaccine due to patient not feeling well. Quick history obtained: No pmh. Not pre... Read more
Close
called to Car after vaccine due to patient not feeling well. Quick history obtained: No pmh. Not pregnant per patient. nly allergy to milk. No history of anaphylaxis. She received vaccine at 5:42. Felt lightheaded and dizzy about 5 to 10 minutes after the vaccine. She noted chest tightness and tachycardia symptoms. We transported her via gurney to our observation area. She looked sleepy and had trouble arousing her. Blood pressure is 140/80, heart rate was in the 90s to 100s. Breath sound decreased bilaterally. No lip swelling. No rash. She noted throat felt uncomfortable. Suspect anaphalxis reaction given rapid decline in status while talking with her. epic pen at bedside immediately and then due to increasing heart rate and complaints of chest discomfort gave her epipen times one. Paramedics were called prior to decision for Epipen. She noted after a minute or two her chest felt better. Monitored her and blood pressure remains stable 140/80's, heart rate initially increase to 110 and then back down to 100 about 5 minutes after the first dose. Second dose of EPI readied as Paramedics not on site yet. At about 8 minutes from EPipen dose her heart rate increase to 160 and she noted additional symptoms of chest tightness again and re-gave a second Epinephrine pen. She was more somnolent but protecting airway. Oxygen was added 2 liters after second epi pen. Her sats dropped right around second epi pen to 94% but about 2-3 minutes later back to 98%. Paramedics arrived 5 minutes after 2nd epi dose and care was transferred to them. She was transported in stable condition. Once paramedics arrived it was determined that they got a level 3 request which was not as urgent and this should have been a level 1. We reviewed how this happened and they note that our site was listed as a level 3 site due to having staff on hand. We were advised to ask for LEVEL 1 paramedics in futures. This was communicated to all Medical staff as well as the Physician of the day orientation.

January 6-7, 2021: fatigue and soreness at vaccine injection site January 8, 2021 at approximately 4:00pm: sudden dizziness, feeling feverish, hot/sweating, Extreme vomiting and diarrhea resulting in an emergency room visit. Muscle pain, abdominal pain, tingling fingers, headache . January 9-16 2021: extreme fatigue and tiredness, back pain, nausea, loss of appetite, tingling fingers. Headaches , white mucus bowel movements January 16 2021: same signs and symptoms as above. Now tingling in hands AND feet and sudden blurred And fuzzy vision. Second trip to the emergency room.
24 2021-01-15 inability to stand ?Within the first 15 minutes - injection site felt hot (right arm). ?Within the first hour - right... Read more
Close
?Within the first 15 minutes - injection site felt hot (right arm). ?Within the first hour - right arm felt heavy with some numbness/tingling that lasted less than 10 minutes. ?3 hours post vaccine - mild arm soreness with ROM, but not to the touch. ?7 hours post vaccine - I felt very fatigued. I could have gone to bed at 1600. I could barely keep my eyes open. ?8 hours post vaccine - fatigue was still very much present, moderate arm soreness with ROM and now to the touch. I felt very feverish, but was afebrile. ?10 hours post vaccine - fatigue was a little better because I had taken an hour nap. Body aches and headache had set in, and I still felt feverish without a fever. I couldn?t stop shivering. I needed to be under multiple blankets with long sleeves, pants and thick socks on to feel even a little bit warm. ?13.5 hours post vaccine - fatigue and body aches had worsened. It?s a struggle to go from laying to sitting and sitting to standing. I even fell back down to the couch a few times because I didn?t have the strength to stand up all the way. Right arm soreness has progressed enough that lifting up a water bottle was a struggle, and I could not lay on my right side. My temp is now 101.4°. ?I tossed and turned between 0200-0630 shivering and aching all over. I slept with my entire body (even my head) under the blankets to try to stay warm. My head was throbbing. I got up at 0630 to take some Tylenol and woke up sometime between 0630 and 1030 drenched in sweat, so I?m assuming I had another fever. ?30.5 hours post vaccine - it?s now January 1st. Body aches/stiffness, headache, fatigue, right arm soreness still very present. Switching any type of body position was a struggle. Temp is 101.2° now. I got out of bed at 1045 and got back in bed at 1200. I stayed in bed until 1845. ?48 hours post vaccine - slight headache and right arm soreness. Right arm ROM is very doable again. My neck, shoulders and hips are sore, but much better. Fatigue is gone. I?m able to move around fine without any struggle. I still have SOB from March, but I feel like over the last 24 hours it?s worsened a bit.

24 2021-01-24 dizziness A few hours after the first dose (1/15), a welt grew around the injection site about the size of a s... Read more
Close
A few hours after the first dose (1/15), a welt grew around the injection site about the size of a silver dollar. This went away after three days. Arm was sore for the first two days. One week later (1/22), injection site became itchy, red and was very warm to the touch. A welt formed as well. It started out the size of a silver dollar, and over the course of 48 hours the welt, itchiness, and redness grew to the size of a large russet potato (Friday 1/22- Saturday1/23). It was the most red around the injection site, with the most red being about the size of a silver dollar. After 48 hours, it remained itchy, red, and had a welt for the next 24 hours (Sunday 1/24). The next morning (Monday 1/25) redness and swelling were gone but site was still a little itchy. Site was only slightly tender throughout these three days but not painful. No other side effects were noticed i.e. fever, chills, chest pain. Slight dizziness was felt if I hadn't eaten anything.
24 2021-01-25 dizziness Patient reported: A fast heartbeat; Dizziness and weakness; Fever CHIEF COMPLAINT: FEVER (pt... Read more
Close
Patient reported: A fast heartbeat; Dizziness and weakness; Fever CHIEF COMPLAINT: FEVER (pt received second dose of covid vaccine on 1/20 at 1800, fever and chest tightness, history cardiomyopathy); presented to ED following day at 04:30 AM. Briefly this is a 24-year-old with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy myopathy without obstruction presenting with fevers, chest tightness, and rigors after her 2nd COVID vaccine yesterday. She took Tylenol at home yesterday and on presentation this morning she already felt better. Her chest tightness was no longer present on admission and did not recur. EKG relatively unchanged from prior studies. She was febrile with an initial temperature of 39.3° C and tachycardic to 110. She was given 1 g of Tylenol and 15 mg Toradol as well as 2 L normal saline. Her temperature came down to 37.1 and her heart rate came down to 90. Subjectively she felt a lot better and was comfortably sitting upright in her bed. Her blood pressure on admission was 105/58 and had dropped to 91/45, she was given an additional 1 L of normal saline (for a total of 3L) and her blood pressure improved to 103/46. She was able to ambulate without dizziness. She was discharged home with instructions to return if she significantly worsened, developed shortness of breath or experience recurrence of her chest tightness.

24 2021-01-27 dizziness After about two hours my arm pain was so intense it felt like it was nearly broken and continued to ... Read more
Close
After about two hours my arm pain was so intense it felt like it was nearly broken and continued to feel worse. I had EXTREME headache and nausea which nearly led to vomiting but kept having to hold it down while alternating between Advil and Tylenol and Tums just to feel a little relief. Pain medications did not help substantially for the first 36 hours. I felt bed bound , had no energy to even move to pick up the TV control a few feet away from me. I had SEVERE chills, and still have them nearly 56 hours out with the headache and nausea still prevalent . I had such bad body aches and dizziness. Have had a hard time getting sleep because of the intensity of my symptoms. Absolutely has been the worst ever and I would NEVER get this shot again. Y?all need to do better. This is completely unacceptable for this to be side effects experienced by people even if it?s less than 10% experiencing the severity I felt. This is so messed up on so many levels. I?m going into medicine myself and although I believe in vaccines, this is not one I will be advocating for until research gets it together and provides a vaccine that is safer for people to receive. Completely anxious and worried and scared as to how my next few days and weeks will go especially with how severe my side effects have been and the news articles showing how some people seem to be dying within hours or days of the Moderna and Pfizer shots. Unacceptable. I can?t believe the amount of fear for my life I have right now.

24 2021-01-28 dizziness 24 y.o. female who arrived to the emergency department for an allergic reaction after receiving the... Read more
Close
24 y.o. female who arrived to the emergency department for an allergic reaction after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine today. Patient states she received the first dose of the Maderna vaccine in her left arm around 0910 hours this morning. Patient waited 15 minutes afterwards and within 30 minutes was back working in the trauma unit. However, she suddenly began to experience nausea, chest tightness, palpitations, shortness of breath, throat tightness, light headed, and overall shaky. Patient states she further went down to the vaccine clinic to inform them of her symptoms in which she was prompted to come to the ED for evaluation. She was not given an Epi pen prior to arrival. Patient reports overall feeling better now with only continued tingling in her tongue and fingers, as well as feeling mildly light headed. Patient also states her throat continues to feel tight, but denies any throat swelling. Chest tightness and palpitations have since improved, only with occasional flutters in her chest similar when feeling excited. Denies nausea, rash, itchy skin, or abdominal pain. No history of anaphylaxis or allergic reactions. Patient is prescribed Nexium, but denies taking any other daily medications. Physical exam shows to be unremarkable with no rash or throat swelling/erythema. Patient does not appear in respiratory distress. Lung sounds are clear. Will order an EKG. Will administer IV Epipen and IV Benadryl. Differentials: Allergic Reaction EKG shows NSR with sinus arrhythmia. Otherwise normal with a rate of 87 bpm. Patient was observed in the ED for 3 hours with improvement of symptoms. Provided follow up instructions to clinic list. Discussed return precautions. Vital signs are stable at time of discharge Initial Vital Signs [01/28/21 1019] Blood Pressure 132/91 Heart Rate 85 Respiratory Rate 24 Temp 36.6 °C (97.8 °F) Temp src Oral SpO2 99 %

I couldn't; I was stuck in the state of my body shaking and unable to see anything. After the two times, I had the shakes.

I believe because of the blood loss (substantial). I had headache and felt nauseous throughout the day. The nose bleed was very very heavy, I don't have nose bleeds. It started getting better with each day and it lasted about 6 days.

24 2021-02-03 dizziness Patient presented for her 2nd COVID vaccine at 17:30 and indicated she had hives after the first dos... Read more
Close
Patient presented for her 2nd COVID vaccine at 17:30 and indicated she had hives after the first dose of vaccine. She was pre-medicated with Benadryl 25 mg for her second dose at 17:37. Her second dose was given at 18:15 and was held at the vaccination site for observation. Pt. developed symptoms at 18:32 and c/o tightness in chest, SOB, itchiness, and hot feeling across her back and upper shoulders. Pt. indicated that she felt like "passing out", and was eased to the floor with Medical First Response activated. Epi 0.3 mg IM into L. Thigh and Benadryl 25mg IM on L. arm was given at 18:40. She was transported to the ED subsequently. Pt. was treated w/ decadron, famotidine in the ED and was discharged at 20:55. 2/4/2021- Doing well today overall. No further intervention after the ED visit.

24 2021-02-05 dizziness, gait disturbance On January 21 I received my first dose of Moderna vaccine on my left arm. After the vaccine I had a ... Read more
Close
On January 21 I received my first dose of Moderna vaccine on my left arm. After the vaccine I had a red lump that was hot and a bruise that only lasted 2 days. Everything was fine until the January 28th when I developed a large red lump during the day while at work that was severely itchy and hot. When I got home from work I had a low grade fever. I made an appointment with my primary care for the next day which was Friday the 29th. My doctor told me she believes I had cellulitis. I was given an antibiotic 2x a day for 7 days. She drew a purple circle around the area and told me that if it goes outside the marked area or I feel any new symptoms, to go to the emergency room. Saturday morning on the 30th i woke up to my entire arm red and hot. I felt like I had a huge sunburn. I couldn?t put my sweatshirt on because it was so hot. The emergency room doctor told me I was fine and to keep taking the antibiotics that were given to me yesterday from my primary care doctor. After the emergency room I went to work and started to feel dizzy and nauseous. My hands became sweaty but the rest of my body was cold. I started having a butterfly feeling in my chest. My Apple Watch alerted me that my heart rate was over 100 bpm. That night before bed I had another low grade fever. On Sunday the 31st I noticed the red area was gone but instead it was a dark purple. I felt okay Sunday besides a rapid pulse. Monday February 1st I woke up out of a dead sleep sweating, butterfly feeling in my chest and dizzy. I tried to take my pulse while laying down but it was so fast I couldn?t keep up with it. I put my Apple Watch on which alerted me immediately that my pulse was 152 bpm. I slowly got up but then I passed out falling off of my bed. I couldn?t get any words out because my heart was beating so fast that I couldn?t breathe. I was sweating horribly and had a hard time walking. Had absolutely no strength in my left hand, my arm was purple/red, cold and numb. My arm felt like someone punched me repeatedly and gave me a dead arm. I called my primary doctors office and they were able to get me in that afternoon. All morning my pulse was spiking and then drastically dropping. About an hour and a half before I went to the doctor everything was fine. I was able to talk but still struggled with breathing while talking. The doctor ordered an EKG which came back clear. My pulse and blood pressure was also fine. The doctor told me she believed all of the symptoms I had were from the medication I take at night (doxazosin-to relax my muscles and help with sleep.) She also told me she believed some of it was my mental health issues taking over. She told me the cellulitis looked fine and sent me home. Later that day I felt exhausted and when I woke up from a nap, I had a fever of 100.5. Took Tylenol and it dropped to 99.5 but wouldn?t go any lower. February 2nd I woke up to a large red ring outside of the purple marker, numb finger tips and butterfly feeling in my chest. All day I received alerts that my pulse was falling and spiking. I sent my primary doctor an email and she told me she didn?t think it was cellulitis anymore, maybe a hematoma but she wasn?t sure. Since January 28th I still struggle everyday with the butterfly feeling in my chest, blurry vision, low grade temps, alerts of pulse, dizziness and breathing difficulties. My arm is always hot, my finger tips are numb and sometimes the strength in my hand is gone. The top of my arm is always a dark purple with red blotches and other times my entire arm is red and hot. When my pulse is very fast, I have a hard time talking, remembering what I was going to say and focusing. I?ve had multiple coworkers ask me if I?m okay because I?ll randomly stop talking and stare off and then I?m alerted that my pulse has either spiked or dropped drastically after spiking. My pulse is never consistent. It is always ranging from 57-155bpm. I realized at first I may have what they call ?COVID arm? but my symptoms haven?t gotten any better. No answers have been given to me or a diagnosis. The first diagnosis that they thought was cellulitis. Then it was ?in my head and behavioral.? Then it was a hematoma. Now it?s an ?I don?t know.? I have tried Benadryl for the itching, ice packs for the days that I?m swollen, Tylenol for the fevers and pain but I never have any relief.

24 2021-02-05 dizziness Patient arrived to observation area. After 15 minute observation, patient reports she was experienci... Read more
Close
Patient arrived to observation area. After 15 minute observation, patient reports she was experiencing dizziness. Escorted to treatment area. 12:05pm BP 125/70 HR 54. She states she hasn't eaten anything today in anticipation of getting the vaccine. She also reports a 1 hour commute to vaccine site on 2 very heated buses. Patient given water and granola bar and seated near an open window to receive fresh air. Patient closely monitored and after some time reports she feels better. 2nd set of vitals: BP - 126/64/ HR - 61. Patient had desire to leave and have a full meal. Left observation area at 12:48pm. ambulated without difficulty.

I felt dizzy and light headed. Then my body felt very heavy and I passed out. I woke up in the ground and my mom and brother put a wet rag on my forehead. I felt faint for 30 minutes afterwards.
24 2021-02-05 mobility decreased, gait disturbance I got the first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 3pm 1/13/21. I was fine for the 30 minutes a... Read more
Close
I got the first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 3pm 1/13/21. I was fine for the 30 minutes after, not even sore at the injection site. Around 6pm, my muscles started aching, but not painful enough to be concerned. At 3am 1/14/21, I woke up in pain in every muscle. Enough to wake me, but not terrible. At 7am, I noticed a pinpoint pain in my armpit, and my muscles still ached. At 9:30am, I took ibuprofen to attempt to curb the pain a bit. Around 10am, it got so painful I was limping, and having trouble bending down or reaching above shoulder height. At 11:30am, I noticed the pinpoint pain in my armpit had gotten worse, and there is a hard, approximately quarter-sized round lump in this spot. Very painful. At 2:30, I went to move my shirt sleeve and the pain at the injection site was so intense I screamed when I touched it. This pain continued until 1/16/21 when I woke up feeling entirely normal. Since 1/16/2021, my hands have been randomly stiffening, either completely stretched out and dropping anything in them, or closing tight enough to leave fingernail marks on my palms. I will also reach to grab things and my hands will sometimes bend into odd shapes, instead of what I intended for them to do. This began at 1-2 times a day, and is becoming more often. It is now up to 2-4 times daily.
24 2021-02-05 mobility decreased Pain began in upper right arm and radiated down to wrist for first week. Upon slightest movement aro... Read more
Close
Pain began in upper right arm and radiated down to wrist for first week. Upon slightest movement around arm, pain ensued even worse as is and did not allow sleep. Pain has limited shoulder mobility for 2 weeks. Received Hydrocodeine-acetiminophen and Ibuprofen at ER on Monday January 25 for 3 days. Then, upon follow up with PCP, medication for pain relief was prescribed as followed: ibuprofen 800 mg and Gabapentin. Pain has subsided but remains upon slight movement of shoulder.

By the next morning, the headache and dizziness were still present and I also had body aches as well as hot/cold flashes, but no fever. This also lasted the entire day and into the following day. It has now been over 72 hours and I am still having dizziness and my head is spinning almost constantly, especially when I move around.

Determined to be about 1 cm. CXR, CMP, SED RATE, CBC all fine. 24 2021-02-10 dizziness I had on-and-off insomnia starting around 10pm. I woke up every thirty minutes on the minute with a ... Read more
Close
I had on-and-off insomnia starting around 10pm. I woke up every thirty minutes on the minute with a feeling like there was a fifty pound vest on my body. At 3:30, I felt nauseous. I walked from my bedroom to downstairs to the kitchen. My knees buckled several times en route. When I ate one bite of a protein bar, my nausea increased tenfold. I ask drank water at the time. I walked back upstairs to my room to sleep where remained awake until ~five am. I slept from ~five am until approximately 8:10am. I felt faint as I walked into the bathroom where I felt my faintness increase by the second. My knees buckled and I passed out on the bathroom floor tile for ~five - ten seconds. I payed there for a few minutes until I felt stable to stand. This morning, 45 hours after the injection and 22 hours after blacking out, I felt a goose egg on the back of my head. It has hurt all day at a level 4/10 on the pain scale.

Close
Around 5 pm on 2/11 (day of vaccination) I began to notice a very sore arm and dry mouth/dehydration. Drank water and continued as normal. Around 2 am of 2/12 I woke up with chills and had been sleeping very restlessly. I had body aches in my arm, legs and back. Around 3am my temperature was 100.2. I also felt very faint when standing and thought I may pass out. 3 times when standing, I had to quickly sit down to avoid it. I do suffer from vasovagal syncope so this may be unrelated to vaccination. I took Tylenol and drank more water. Temp rose to about 100.6 before beginning to drop at around 4 am. I continued to take Tylenol every 4 hours and it helped keep temp below 100 but towards the end of the 4 hours, it would start to rise again. I ate normally and drank extra water due to feeling dehydrated still. Around 1 PM 2/12 I started to feel nauseous and had an upset stomach. I was still have a general body aches and elevated temperature around 99.5. My normal temp is usually about 98.0. Nausea led to diarrhea 1 time. Symptoms continued until approximately 8 pm when very quickly the body aches, nausea, fever and soreness in injection arm all went away. None of these symptoms have returned and it is now 2/13 at 8 pm. I did test positive for Covid-19 on December 28, 2020 but have been fully recovered with no symptoms since 1/8/2021.

24 2021-02-26 dizziness the first day (1/16/21) following the first dose of the vaccine, i began experiencing nausea. the t... Read more
Close
the first day (1/16/21) following the first dose of the vaccine, i began experiencing nausea. the third day (1/18/21) i vomited that morning once but then not again throughout that day. after that for about two weeks, i was just generally nauseous and also had no appetite. food tasted off to me. this went away after two weeks, but then i got my second dose on 2/12/21. on 2/13/21, i spent about 12 vomiting very consistently, about every 10-15 minutes. i also had chills alternating with profuse sweating and hot flashes, but did not ever have a fever. other symptoms included headache, extreme fatigue, dizziness, body aches, shortness of breath, and chest pains. the next day, i was fine aside from some slight lingering nausea but no vomiting. since then, i have experienced nausea intermittently every day, and have vomited on more than a dozen of those days. i have no appetite, and have now lost ten pounds since getting the second dose. i realized that my main food aversion is to meat, i will vomit every single time i eat meat now. i?m not sure if this is my reaction to the texture and taste like i think it is, or if it?s actually more like an allergic response by my stomach. i also still struggle with shortness of breath and feeling like my chest is tight, as well as dizziness and a nagging cough.

24 2021-03-04 impaired driving ability, dizziness I had no immediate reactions to the vaccine. About an hour after my injection I developed a low grad... Read more
Close
I had no immediate reactions to the vaccine. About an hour after my injection I developed a low grade headache. The next day, 2/26, I woke at 7am with a headache still. The headache and fatigue worsened through the day (2/26/21). Around 3:00pm I started experiencing waves of dizziness. By 4pm I had begun experiencing temporary loss of feeling in various body parts. Each part's loss of feeling came and went separately and lasted about 2-5 minutes each. I experienced this in my left facial cheek, both wrists and hands, and my right hip. I had a coworker drive me home and by 5pm I had a migraine with severe sinus/head pressure and a fever of 99.4. My average resting body temperature is 97.4. I slept from 6:00pm friday till 10:30am on Saturday (2/27). When I woke I still had a headache, but no longer a migraine. I spent 2/27 dizzy, weak, and achy but no more episodes of lack of feeling in body parts or a fever. I have not experienced soreness in the arm I got my injection in, but I noticed on Tuesday March 2nd that I my injection site is very swollen, red and itchy. The swelling and redness (to my knowledge) has not gotten worse or better since then, but the itching has gotten worse and the actual puncture wound is now visible since yesterday (3/4) whereas it was not visible anytime before that.

Had vision problems where everything felt blurry and there were black spots in line of sight. Also had numbness in face, arms and legs/feet and tingling sensation.

24 2021-03-14 dizziness I received my second dose at 12:15pm on 03/06/2021. By about 9-10pm I began feeling chills. I went t... Read more
Close
I received my second dose at 12:15pm on 03/06/2021. By about 9-10pm I began feeling chills. I went to bed and my body wouldn?t warm up under the covers. I woke up around 1:16am feeling very hot. I was running a fever of about 102F. After removing the covers and using a cold compress it dropped to the 99F range and fluctuated quickly between about 98.7F-99.9F. I continued to have chills and feel very cold during this fluctuation. When I would stand to go to the bathroom my body would be very weak and I would get almost lightheaded. I fell asleep by about 3:30am. The following morning my fever was completely resolved. I continued to feel weak during the first half of the day with some mild intermittent nausea. By the second half of the day my side effects resolved entirely.

I got a B12 injection on my butt for energy(Friday, march 12). My legs feel like they are in pain and the hurt when I walk. I also had a lot of pelvic pain after the vitamin injection. I drank ibuprofen March 14 at night. I woke up feeling very weak. Before going to bed on March 15 I drank Tylenol. I still feel pain in my legs today and now I have lower back pain.

24 2021-03-17 fall, dizziness Patient came to the center for a Moderna vaccine at 5pm. The patient expressed that she felt dizzy ... Read more
Close
Patient came to the center for a Moderna vaccine at 5pm. The patient expressed that she felt dizzy shortly after immunization (before leaving the immunization chair). Her head began to fall backwards so I quickly supported the patient's head and neck area and was able to keep her from falling out of her chair. The patient fainted but regained consciousness approximately 3 seconds later. The patient came back alert but nauseous. The patient vomited in a trashcan and then felt fine. The patient blamed the reaction on her severe anxiety and said the exact same thing happened after a nose piercing. I observed the patient for 30 minutes and sent her on her way. The patient left healthy and happy. I told the patient to warn the pharmacist prior to receiving her second dose. No drugs were administered. Written up in SCRT and VAERS. I followed up with the patient at 7 pm and she was home safe.

Close
Dizziness, nausea, disorientation onset 10-15 min after vaccine - informed official at vaccination site & monitored me (took blood pressure, heart rate, listened to lungs) Symptoms became worse 30 minutes after vaccine - severe nausea and dizziness, very disoriented, feverish, throat started to swell - nurse had me lay in a comfortable reclining chair, put a fan on me and continued to monitor/take vitals Called the paramedics due to throat swelling becoming worse Paramedics assessed me again, vitals were normal, but took me to the hospital to be checked further Received 25mg of Benadryl once admitted to emergency - PA assessed me and gave me 3 prednisone to stop and further reaction Prescribed the Benadryl and prednisone , was discharged

24 2021-03-28 dizziness Patient was vaccinated around 10:55 AM. Within a couple of minutes she started feeling lightheaded, ... Read more
Close
Patient was vaccinated around 10:55 AM. Within a couple of minutes she started feeling lightheaded, sweaty, and had blurry vision while sitting. She reported no history of blood sugar issues, but she said she only had some donut to eat today. I initially gave her three glucose tablets and a bottle of water, which she sipped. She reported feeling better within a few minutes. I checked her blood pressure at 10:59 AM. It read low at 81/44 with a pulse of 73. But, I checked again since I doubted the accuracy of the reading. The second reading was 101/56, with a pulse of 79. Patient said she was feeling better, but continued to sit. I gave her one more glucose tablet to equal a total of 16 g of carbs given. She sat for at least fifteen minutes until she felt well enough to get up and shop. She checked back after shopping and said she was fine.

24 2021-03-30 dizziness Patient said she felt that she was going to pass out. We sat her on the floor, applied a cool compre... Read more
Close
Patient said she felt that she was going to pass out. We sat her on the floor, applied a cool compress to head and wrists. A couple minutes later she was feeling better, but she was asked to remain sitting for another 10 mins to monitor her. She claimed to be dehydrated, and had not eaten much of anything today. Her friend brought her some water and food. After eating a bit and drinking the water she said she was feeling almost normal. We provided a motorized cart for her even though she said she was fine to walk. I gave the patient a follow up call a few hours later and she claimed to be feeling fine.
24 2021-03-30 vertigo, dizziness Passed out/passing out; Vertigo; Uncontrollable muscle twitching all over body; Dizziness/lightheade... Read more
Close
Passed out/passing out; Vertigo; Uncontrollable muscle twitching all over body; Dizziness/lightheadedness; Clammy hands/feet; Diarrhea; Gas; Rapid heart rate; Tingling in both feet/Tingling in bilateral feet; Liquid in both ears; Tiredness/fatigue; Nausea; Chills; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, concerning a 24- year-old female who received Moderna's COVID vaccine and passed out and developed vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet/cold sweat, tingling in bilateral feet/paresthesia, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears/ear discharge, diarrhea and gas/flatulence. The patient's past medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event was reported as multivitamins (ascorbic acid, colecalciferaol, cyanocobalamin, pyridine hydrochloride, retinol palmitate, tocopherols mixed). On 04 March 2021 , prior to the onset of the event, the patient received first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot number:13A21A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID 19 infection. On an unknown date after receiving the first dose of the vaccine the patient passed out which was considered as serious event (medically significant). The patient also experienced vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet ,tingling in bilateral feet, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears, diarrhea, gas and tiredness. The patient reported that she passed out 30 seconds later after getting injection and it was not due to vasovagal reaction. As per patient, tingling started when she woke up early in the morning but in feet only. Treatment medications include dimenhydrinate and paracetamol. The patient took water and electrolytes for hydration. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to events was considered as unknown. The outcome of the events passed out and developed vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet/cold sweat, tingling in bilateral feet/paresthesia, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears/ear discharge, diarrhea and gas/flatulence was considered as unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 15 minutes . During the observation period, she experienced an adverse reaction with the following symptoms: felt flushed, "like I'm about to pass out", pale colored.. Assessment : Time of assessment 0920. Alert and oriented, Anxious, Diaphoretic and Clammy. After sitting for 5 minutes of a 15 minute observation, patient reported feeling like she will pass out. She was flushed, felt hot, color pale, clammy. She was placed on the floor and she says she was starting to feel better. She did not pass out. 0925: BP 108/68 lying on the floor, P 52, 97% oxygen saturation RA. She reported feeling better. 0928: She was assisted to the wheelchair and taken to the triage area. She was assisted to the stretcher. 0931: BP 116/65, P 51 Actions taken: 0943: Vitals sign taken VAERS form obtained and completed by RN. Standing BP 131/83 P 64 R 16, Oxgen 100% RA, ambulated around with no symptoms. There were no vitals filed for this visit. Medications administered: No medication administered. Disposition: Reports no further symptoms of adverse reaction after observation for 25 minutes. Discharged home. Instructed to call 911 for trouble breathing, rapid heart rate, dizziness, swelling of tongue or throat. The Patient was provided with Vaccine Information Sheet and instruction to access the V-Safe system.

PT self-administered 50mg Benadryl via Port-A-Cath from own medication bag at 1911; vaccinators were unaware that she had brought medical supplies with her. Close
couldn't sleep; Felt sick; Fell; Body went stiff; Hit head on the wall; Vomiting; Fainted; Had seizures twice; Back pain; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (Fainted) and SEIZURE (Had seizures twice) in a 24-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COVID-19 in October 2020. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced BACK PAIN (Back pain). On 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (Fainted) (seriousness criterion medically significant), SEIZURE (Had seizures twice) (seriousness criterion medically significant), INSOMNIA (couldn't sleep), MALAISE (Felt sick), FALL (Fell), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body went stiff), HEAD INJURY (Hit head on the wall) and VOMITING (Vomiting). At the time of the report, SYNCOPE (Fainted), SEIZURE (Had seizures twice), BACK PAIN (Back pain), INSOMNIA (couldn't sleep), MALAISE (Felt sick), FALL (Fell), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body went stiff), HEAD INJURY (Hit head on the wall) and VOMITING (Vomiting) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Labs included Electrocardiogram: and Urine analysis, no test results provided. Treatment information not provided. Company comment: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

24 2021-04-26 mobility decreased I received the vaccination on April 25th at 2:15pm. I waited at the facility until 2:30pm to be sure... Read more
Close
I received the vaccination on April 25th at 2:15pm. I waited at the facility until 2:30pm to be sure I didn't have any immediate side effects or allergic reactions. Upon arriving home around 3:00pm, I noticed the injection sight had become itchy. I then noticed later in the day that my arm was beginning to hurt and the pain progressively got worse. By the end of the day, I was unable to move my arm much without any pain. The next morning (April 26th), the injection sight was swollen upon physical examination but was not noticably swollen. I did not check the sight through the day but noticed at the end of the day when getting ready for bed (around 9:00pm) that the injection sight was swollen, itchy, red, and extremely sensitive to touch. Today, April 27th, the sight is still red, sensitive, and swollen but the pain level in relation to moving my arm has decreased dramatically throughout the day and I am able to move with little to no pain.

Patient is here today for COVID-19 immunization per federal guidelines/written order. See immunization activity for details. Patient was observed post-immunization for a minimum of 15 minutes with evidence of dizziness. Anaphylaxis Management Standing Order protocol initiated. Physician/APP notified of patient condition. Additional orders received: none. COVID-19 (MRNA) VACCINE Allergen added to patient's Allergies. VAERS reporting completed as appropriate. Standing order not needed, after 15 minute waiting time patient reported feeling lightheaded. Assisted to table and to lying down. She reports she has notified her Mother of this incident. VS 1440 BP 122/69, P 82, pulse ox 97%, alert. Oriented, skin warm and dry, pink. Patient states this has happened to her before with blood draws. Observed, 1455 BP 122/74, p 88, ox 98%. Assisted to sitting then standing BP 107/77, P 88, Ox 97%. Remains alert. After 30 minutes total observation patient was discharged in stable condition, feeling improved.

24 2021-04-28 dizziness Within 10 minutes of vaccination, patient developed increasingly blurry vision, hearing loss, a feel... Read more
Close
Within 10 minutes of vaccination, patient developed increasingly blurry vision, hearing loss, a feeling of faintness, cold, clammy skin, and sweating. Patient was asked to lie down on the floor with feet elevated but patient did not want to leave the chair she was sitting in. Patient was feeling increasingly faint and experiencing increasing panic due to her vision and hearing loss. EMTs were called and responded within 20 minutes of the call. Patient vision and hearing were returning by the time EMTs arrived. They checked her blood pressure, heart rate, oxygen saturation, and blood glucose - all were within normal range. The patient refused transport to the hospital and left with her significant other as her driver after she was feeling normal again.

Close
Approximately 24 hours after the injection, I began having persistent ice pick headaches, which lasted 1-2 hours. I have a history of these, but they are almost never so intense. About 25 hours after the injection, I began having intense pain in the center of my chest. It dissipated and returned a couple of times over the next 5 hours or so. The pain was so great that it was difficult to stand, and I came close to passing out. I have not experienced this severe level of pain since about 30 hours post-injection.

Close
Was called to patient observation area, pt slide out of chair to floor stated she felt light headed and was going to pass out. Pt commented that she was fasting. Vital signs obtained, pt was hypotensive BP 65/52 P 63, R 16 pusle ox 98% RA. Pt was transported by wheelchair to a private observation room and was seen by Dr. who encouraged pt to drink fluids and eat some crackers. Pt was observed for another 30 min, vital signs at discharge BP 97/63 P 71 R18 pulse oximetry 100%. Pt stated that she was no longer light headed.

I gave her Benadryl 25 and asked her wait around. After about 10 minutes she said that she needed my help. She said that she needed an EpiPen shot because her heart was racing, she was sweating, and her tongue was beginning to feel swollen. I gave her the EpiPen shot and called 911. She was released from the hospital about midnight.

24 2021-06-21 dizziness Loss of consciousness; Back pain; Dizziness; Nasopharyngitis; Chills; Nausea; This case was received... Read more
Close
Loss of consciousness; Back pain; Dizziness; Nasopharyngitis; Chills; Nausea; This case was received via FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1198122) on 08-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 08-Jun-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by a health care professional and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness) in a 24-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 025B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COVID-19 (Had COVID in October 2020) in October 2020. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness) (seriousness criterion medically significant), BACK PAIN (Back pain), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), NASOPHARYNGITIS (Nasopharyngitis), CHILLS (Chills) and NAUSEA (Nausea). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness), BACK PAIN (Back pain), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), NASOPHARYNGITIS (Nasopharyngitis), CHILLS (Chills) and NAUSEA (Nausea) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 03-Apr-2021, Blood test: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. On 03-Apr-2021, Electrocardiogram: 03-apr-2021 (Inconclusive) unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. This case was received FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1198122) on 08-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 08-Jun-2021. Other Meds : Symptom Text : The patient had experienced Severe back pain starting at 5pm on April 2, 2021. Frequent urination throughout the night, cold chills. April 3, 2021, 4:50am got up to use the bathroom and had extreme nausea and lightheadedness. Passed out and seized up. EMS arrived, BP 80's/50's and low grade fever. Put in chair to transport me downstairs and passed out and seized up again. Threw up. Transported to ER and still weak and severe back pain. Was given something for nausea. Two bags of fluid. EKG, blood work, and urine test. Left ER around 10 am. No Concomitant medication was not provided. No Treatment medication was not provided. Company Comment : Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

25 2021-01-06 injected limb mobility decreased ?Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA? The day I got the vaccine all that happened was a dead arm and then w... Read more
Close
?Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA? The day I got the vaccine all that happened was a dead arm and then when I was driving home after the 15 minutes of waiting in the parking lot, I got a metallic taste in my mouth, but it didn't last very long. The next day my arm was sore to move, but not at the injection spot, if looking at my arm (someone else) it was down 3 inches and to the left about 1 inch. The next day that same spot was still sore but to the touch, then it went away. What is more interesting and concerning is that on 1/6/2021 (a week after I got the shot), I noticed 3 little bumps on my arm (9:45pm), in that same location that was sore to move and touch on day 2 and 3 but they also were itchy. When I woke up the next morning (6:15 am) the area had spread to the size of my palm (3 inch by 3 inch roughly) it was all red, hard to the touch, stilly itchy and I had the feeling of a dead arm again. One of the nurses at my work drew a circle around the red spot so we could watch to see if it was still growing , by roughly 11:45 am it had grown an additional 2 inches.

Nausea immediately following injection that continued for 24 hours, Stoke like symptoms that began six hours after injection that persist currently (48 hours +) including severe headache (resolved after 24 hours with 800mg ibuprofen Q3, Benadryl 25mg Q3 ), confusion, cognitive impairment, vision changes (L), drift in the upper extremity (L), dizziness, lack of coordination, and difficulty with depth perception. Neck stiffness from 12 hours post injection to 48 hours post injection. Negative for fever, vomiting, hemiparesis, difficulty with speech or word finding, facial droop,

25 2021-01-08 dizziness, balance disorder Symptoms began with arm soreness with minor swelling around the administration area around 6-7 pm. C... Read more
Close
Symptoms began with arm soreness with minor swelling around the administration area around 6-7 pm. Chills began at 11 pm lasting for half an hour followed by a fever of 102f. The fever continued during the night of 1/5/21 and early morning of 1/6/21. Woke with a strong headache in the morning at 7 am. Headache caused dizziness and some loss of balance when walking. Had minor facial swelling with minor numbness around mouth and neck. The fever, headache, and swelling continued throughout the day of 1/6/21. The fever broke around 7 pm on 1/6/21. Nyquil and ibuprofen were taken for fever and headache. During the morning of 1/7/21, the fever and facial swelling had ended. The headache continued during the morning of 1/7/21 until midday. By the evening of 1/7/21, all symptoms had ceased.
25 2021-01-08 dizziness dizzy, nausea, high heart rate, sore arm, fatigue. symptoms lasted about 4 hours
25 2021-01-08 joint range of motion decreased I walked in to received my first dose of the Moderna Covid19 vaccine at approx 12:20pm 1/7/21. The R... Read more
Close
I walked in to received my first dose of the Moderna Covid19 vaccine at approx 12:20pm 1/7/21. The RN who was giving me my injection palpated the top of my shoulder and NOT my acromian process and administered the injection closer to the top of my shoulder, the vaccine did initially hurt more than a typical vaccine would when it was being administered but i thought that might have been normal. Approximately 1hr after receiving the vaccine my left shoulder joint started to have this pinching sensation in the anterior joint when I would raise my arm forward. The pain got progressively worse throughout the day with significantly decreased range of motion in that shoulder and significant pain in my shoulder joint. The pain was so bad it actually kept me from sleeping that night. I never had any muscular pain or any other symptoms beside the joint pain, which was alarming since it should have been administered into the muscle. I believe the vaccine my have been incorrectly injected into the shoulder joint or potentially a smaller muscle in the shoulder. The pain and decrease ROM is preventing me from doing most of my regular day to day activities. Today 1/9/21 has been a full 48hrs after receiving the vaccine and the joint pain has not gotten any better and my range of motion is still significantly decreased, which would prevent me from performing my tasks as an RN.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. Patient's aunt called me and told me that niece (patient) is 25yo having issues with coordination about a week after 1st Moderna vaccination shot. Unsure of exact vaccination date and onset of symptoms. really having to focus to place hands under water to wash them, walking through doors without bumping into them, turning on faucet, getting dressed; left hand is worse than right and not able to easily align things properly; "feels like her brain isn't doing what she's telling it to do". Aunt said the symptoms are not improving. Patient had tested negative for Covid the day she got the vaccine.

Close
Received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday 12/30/2020. Sunday 1/3/2021 started with some dizziness. On Tuesday 1/5/2021 developed hives on feet and ankles. Dizziness worsened and hives had spread to hands and wrists the following day. Upon arriving to work on Thursday 1/7/2021, hives had progressively gotten worse and I was tachycardic. Called employee health where I was instructedto go to the ED. Was tachycardic 100-130 bpm and hypertensive 156/112mmHg upon arrival to the ED. Received IV Benadryl and Decadron for the reaction/hives. Viotals were normal upon discharge. Continued with Prednisone and benadryl. Taking Meclizine to help with dizziness.

25 2021-01-13 dizziness Vasovagal syncope (loss of consciousness) Tonic seizure (tensing and twitching of arms) Irregular he... Read more
Close
Vasovagal syncope (loss of consciousness) Tonic seizure (tensing and twitching of arms) Irregular heartbeat (per EKG) Extremely low blood pressure I received the vaccine at a public health pop-up, drive through clinic for first responders - I accessed the vaccine through my employer as a first responder. The vaccine was administered to my left arm without complication at approximately 1:00pm (my scheduled appointment). I proceeded to the area designated for patients to be observed after receiving the vaccine and was asked to wait 15 minutes. I recall getting to the observation area then telling my spouse I felt unwell - after the event he notified me that I told him I was about to pass out and asked him to get medical help. I lost consciousness approximately 5-10 minutes following the vaccine. My husband reported that after losing consciousness I seemed to have a minor seizure, as evidenced by my head jerking and my arms and fingers "tensing and curling up". I was sitting in the passenger seat of my car at this time, so I suffered no fall or fall related injury. Public health officials and EMT responded. They indicated to my spouse that I had experienced a vasovagal syncope episode and that I had "gone tonic"/ had a "tonic seizure". They took my blood pressure, which was very low (I don't recall exactly but it was 80 over something). They also took my blood sugar among other things that I do not recall. I was given oxygen and put into an ambulance. I was shaking, so they wrapped me in blankets. I believe they may have done an EKG and placed a blood pressure cuff while I was in the ambulance, but I do not recall any specifics about this. The EMT also drew my blood, placed an IV, and administered IV fluids while I was in the ambulance. I was taken by ambulance to the emergency department

Client has a history of vaso-vagal reactions to blood draws and vaccinations. Post vaccination she was seated in the passenger seat in vaccine pod observation lot and felt like she "was going to pass out". Her husband got the attention of the paramedic overseeing the area. She did not become unresponsive at any time but became very pale. Her BP was 80/40 when initially checked. EMS was call and she was shortly thereafter taken to a local ED via non emergent transport. Her husband had driven her to the pod site and did not receive a vaccination. She was discharged home yesterday.

Close
I received my vaccine around 12:45pm. They had me go to waiting room and wait for 10 mins. I sat down and was waiting for a few minutes when I started to get dizzy. I looked up and told the lady checking people in ?hey I?m getting really dizzy can I lay down? she said yes come in the room. When I stood up my heart started beating really fast. I sat on the table and my chest started feeling tight and heavy. There were 2 ladies in the room at this point so I asked one of them if they had an epipen on hand just in case. My throat wasn?t swelling but it was getting harder to breath from the tightness in my chest. She said they didn?t have an epipen and would have to call emergency services if I needed one. I told her I didn?t know what was going on, that I didn?t need one yet but she should probably call emergency services if they can?t do anything to help me. (ER is right across the street) my symptoms went away shortly after they called. But came on a couple more times but much milder over the next 30 minutes or so. The EMT gave me Benadryl and the ER ran some tests.

Close
Patient was observed for 15 minutes after vaccination with no adverse effects during that time period. Patient experienced throat closing, tightness in back of throat, dizziness, light headedness, heart racing approximately 20 to 25 minutes following vaccine. Adverse effects were sudden in onset. Patient was in her car when adverse event started. Patient called 911, ambulance arrived, EMS administered epinephrine IM. Patient was given 50 mg of diphenhydramine orally 30 minutes after event. Patient reported no breathing issues within 3 minutes of epinephrine. Patient reports no other problems following that except for feeling jittery.
