Several minutes after the vaccine she became light headed, EMT evaluated her and stated she was tachycardic (did not give a pulse) and was initially unable to find a BP. She appeared pale and was crying and hyperventilating. She stated she had a funny feeling in her throat and numbness in her fingers. We prepared to administer an epi-pen but she was increasingly anxious so we had to place her in a supine position first. Immediately she started to feel better, her color was normal and her blood pressure was 110/70 with a pulse of 67. Her throat no longer felt ?funny.? We continued to monitor her and did NOT administer epinephrine. An ambulance arrived and she was ambulatory and feeling normal so declined transport. Follow-up with patient 1/18/21, she states she is feeling good. She said she and her mother both have a history of passing out with any procedure involving needles and she does not feel her symptoms were caused by the vaccine itself. She plans to receive her scheduled 2nd dose from us.
25 2021-01-17 mobility decreased By 3:30pm I had a fever and experienced arm soreness to my right arm. By 11:30pm I could not move my... Read more
Close
By 3:30pm I had a fever and experienced arm soreness to my right arm. By 11:30pm I could not move my arm and also could not pick my son up who weighs 30 pounds. On the following day I continued with severe body aches and joint pain. I went to see a doctor about 10:00am who examined me and advised my to take Tylenol and Ibuprofen for pain. They did a Covid-19 swab which as negative. My symptoms are improving and I can say that it took about 24 to 48 hours to recover from my right arm.

Close
Upon receiving the vaccination the onset of nausea, migraine, and arm aches were experienced. Several hours later the aches moved to upper body aches causing pain breathing. Upon night, dizziness had set in. I fell unconscious hitting my head and received treatment for a concussion. I am currently pending a CT Scan to check for brain bleeding.
25 2021-01-19 dizziness PT began shaking immediately after vaccine administration. RN stayed in room with Pt to monitor symp... Read more
Close
PT began shaking immediately after vaccine administration. RN stayed in room with Pt to monitor symptoms. Ten minutes later, Pt reported feeling dizzy. She was placed in a recumbent position on the exam twith legs elevated and vital signs were obtained, they were within normal limits. Pt then reported that it felt like she had something in the right side of her throat - she declined epinephrine injection. RN and LVN stayed at bedside. Pt then stated that both sides of her throat felt blocked and gave consent for epinephrine injection. RN administered 0.3 mg epinephrine and activated EMS. Vitals signs, breathing and circulation monitored closely until EMS arrival. Pt was transported by ambulance to the hospital emergency department for evaluation.

After around 15 minutes or so after vaccination, she was feeling little light headed, and nauseating and tried throwing up during the observation period as per protocol after vaccination. We advised her to stay longer and as precaution, we reached out to our facility, who advised to observe her for some more time and if she does not feel better, she can go to Urgent care accompanied by someone. We gave her Gatorade and after around 40-45 minutes she was feeling better and someone from her family came to pick her up. She did not wanted to go to Urgent Care at that time but we advised her if she does not feel good, she should go to Urgent Care.

Then I went to see my allergist around 11AM and the itchiness and redness had gone down a lot but the itchiness was still there. The allergist told me to take some more Allegra that day and it ended up working.

My arm started to hurt at the injection site at about 7PM. It hurt to touch and put pressure on it. I woke up around 1AM on the 31st feeling cold and went back to sleep, but I couldn't lay on the arm that had the injection due to the pain in my muscle. I woke up again at 3AM with chills, cold sweats, and body aches; it felt like I had a fever but I don't own a thermometer so I can't say for sure. Later in the day on the 31st, I did not have an appetite and when I tried to eat, I experienced nausea. Even the slightest touch to the injection site caused pain and I couldn't raise that arm. My fatigue, aches, loss of appetite, nausea, and chills lasted until January 1st. The pain in my arm lasted for another week or so before I could lay on it or touch it. To this day, if I scratch the injection site or accidentally bump into it in the exact spot I received the shot, it will cause pain that I did not experience before.

25 2021-02-03 dizziness, joint range of motion decreased, gait inability, gait disturbance Approximately five minutes after receiving the shot, I began to feel a burst of pain rush through my... Read more
Close
Approximately five minutes after receiving the shot, I began to feel a burst of pain rush through my entire left arm. A few seconds afterwards, I started to feel nauseated. Immediately, I felt weak, light-headed, and tired. I began to sweat profusely, as well. I could barely move my arm to flag down one of attendants who was monitoring us. She asked me what was wrong, and I tried to describe what was going on, but I could barely talk or keep my eyes open. She radioed for help and the paramedics came over to me. They wanted to move me to a private room and asked if I could walk. I tried to walk there, but I started to fall so one of the paramedics hoisted me up to help me. They asked me some questions will they were waiting for a stretcher, all of which I could hear and understand, but I was unable to response to. The stretcher came and I laid down, but I was already starting to feel better by then. I was very out of it, but I think this entire process took maybe 10-15 minutes. I laid there for maybe another 15 minutes, and I began to be able to talk again and open my eyes. I tried sitting up and that went alright. I answered some questions for them while they took my blood pressure, monitored my pulse, and took my temperature. After another 15 minutes or so, I felt well enough to walk back to my office in the Health Department. I didn't have any other problems for the rest of the day.

25 2021-02-07 dizziness Fever, muscular pain, dizziness, headache, heaviness, changes in sense of smell.
25 2021-02-07 movement disorder, balance disorder, dizziness, gait disturbance Brain hemorrhage (inflammation, swelling); Dizziness; Difficulty with coordination; Difficulty with ... Read more
Close
Brain hemorrhage (inflammation, swelling); Dizziness; Difficulty with coordination; Difficulty with balance; Vision changes in left eye; Drift in left arm; Issues going through daily routine; Neurological symptoms; Was confused; Headaches; Very nauseous; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, who was a 25-years-old, white female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced the events, very nauseous, neurological symptoms, headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination, difficulty with balance, vision changes in left eye, drift in left arm, issues going through daily routine, confusion, and brain bleed. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included gluten allergy. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included ethinylestradiol/ ferrous fumarate/ norethindrone acetate. On 06 Jan 2021 at 10:30am, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 06 Jan 2021, after receiving the vaccine, the patient became very nauseous through 08 Jan 2021. On 09 Jan 2021, the patient started having neurological symptoms. She started having headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination and balance, and vision changes in the left eye (not specified). She reported that she had a "drift" in the left arm and described it as "when you try to manipulate the arm, but it does not go where you want it to go". On 11 Jan 2021, the patient still had neurological symptoms, issues moving left arm, colliding with objects all day, and issues going through daily routine. On 12 Jan 2021, the patient was seen by a neurologist and magnetic resonance imagining (MRI) was scheduled. The MRI revealed inflammation, and brain bleed and swelling. The patient was sent to the emergency room and admitted on 19 Jan 2021. Treatment for the events included calcium carbonate for nausea, ibuprofen for headaches and diphenhydramine. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The event, very nauseous, was considered resolved on 08 Jan 2021. The events, neurological symptoms, headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination, difficulty with balance, vision changes in left eye, drift in left arm and issues going through daily routine, confusion, and brain bleed were considered not resolved. Follow-up received on 23 Jan 2021 included patient details, medical history, lab tests, concomitant medications, hospitalization, and updated events.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a female patient, who experienced a non-serious unexpected event of dizziness, coordination abnormal, balance disorder, visual impairment, movement disorder, loss of personal independence in daily activities, and neurological symptom, and non-serious expected event of nausea, and headaches. The events of nausea occurred 1 day (same day) after first dose of mRNA-1273, lot # unknown. The event of neurological symptoms, dizziness, coordination abnormal, balance disorder, visual impairment, loss of personal independence in daily activities, and movement disorder occurred 3 days after first dose of mRNA-1273, lot # unknown. Treatment for the events included, Tums, nauseam, ibuprofen and Benadryl. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and onset of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Paralyzed on the right side down to her foot; Numbness in her hands and feet; Slurred speech; Felt really heavy in her face area, hurt really bad; Shooting pain; Feels tingly; Felt really heavy in her neck, hurt really bad; unable to walk; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer who was also a 25-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly, unable to walk and shooting pain feelings. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was not provided. On 21 Jan 2021, approximately two hours prior to the start of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot 032L20A) intramuscularly in the right arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Approximately two hours after receiving the vaccine at 12:30 pm, the patient experienced heavy feeling in her neck and face area that hurt really bad. Later, she noticed numbness in her hands and feet. Slurred speech was reported from a bystander. By 3:30pm, the patient was completely paralyzed on her right side. She was taken to the hospital, and a code stroke was initiated; however, all labs were normal. On 26 Jan 2021, the patient was still paralyzed on her right side, unable to walk, had shooting pain feeling, and two fingers on her right hand were able to move but still felt tingly. The doctors planned to discharge her on the next day to a rehab center because she could not function alone. Treatment for the event included pain medication and hospitalization. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the events, developed heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly, unable to walk and shooting pain feelings were considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: A spontaneous report concerns a 25-year-old, female, patient, who experienced heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly and shooting pain feelings. The events of heavy feeling in her neck and face area, numbness in her hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side occurred on the same day after the administration of the first dose of mRNA-1273 (Lot number 032L20A, expiration date unknown). The events of inability to walk, had shooting pain feeling and two fingers on her right hand were able to move but still felt tingly occurred the following day after the vaccine administration. Treatment included pain medication and outcome is unknown. Based on the information provided, which indicates a strong temporal association between the reported events and administration of mRNA-1273 vaccine (onset latency of 2 hours), a causal association cannot be excluded.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Three days following the injection I had most of the symptoms. The injection site was hot, hard and quite painful (I couldn't sleep on that side of my body for three nights). I felt generally unwell and achy. After about three days all of my symptoms went down and most of them were gone except for I could still feel a small amount of swelling under the skin that continued to go down. On Tuesday Feb 10, almost a week out I started to experience an itching feeling that increased throughout the day to a deep itch that feels like it goes down to my bone. The injection site has become red, hot and hard again and the lymph node in my left armpit is extremely painful and swollen. I feel dizzy and nauseous.

25 2021-02-18 dizziness Starting about 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, I felt feverish (no fever), lightheaded and di... Read more
Close
Starting about 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, I felt feverish (no fever), lightheaded and dizzy. The doctor on site had me wait for an hour until I felt well enough to drive home. Over the next several hours, my lightheadedness became so bad I felt as though I would faint if I stool for longer than a few minutes. On Saturday, 2-13-21, I did pass out on the stairs and again in my livingroom. On Sunday, 2-14-21, I decided to go to urgent care in which I was told to "wait it out". However, my symptoms had gotten worse over the last couple days to include body aches, headaches, muscle/joint pain, congested sinuses, slight cough, and feeling feverish (no fever) along with being dizzy. Therefore, I went to the ER later that morning 2-14-21, to see if I could get better treatment for my symptoms. I received IV fluids and they preformed blood work, a urinanalysis and an ECG. I was released from the ER around 8pm. My symptoms were better for the remainder of the evening, but have gone back to what I was feeling before for the last several days. My symptoms have been unresolved now for 1 week. I am getting tested for COVID-19 on Saturday 02-20-21.

Close
Initially sore arm and chills around 8pm. Around 2 am notes Fever, chills, body aches all over, a killer headache, nausea and I could not stay asleep. I took 2 extra strength Tylenol at that time, put an ice pack on my forehead, and drank a Pedialyte. In addition to those, at about 4 I had ringing in my left ear and then lost the hearing in it. I just went to bed. When I woke up, around 10am on Friday, I could hear, but super dizzy. I couldn?t really walk without feeling like I?m going to fall over, especially with turns. All symptoms continued throughout all of Friday. Took a warm shower around 7PM which seemed to help some with body aches and chills, however, dizziness/vertigo remained. Saturday I woke up several times drenched in sweat. Around 9am my fever was gone. Still feeling a little ?off? in terms of balance/vertigo but nothing compared to Friday. Slight body aches remain. Other symptoms gone.
25 2021-03-14 dizziness pounding heart, heart rate increased; panic; Total body flushing; Sensation of hot and cold; Shaking... Read more
Close
pounding heart, heart rate increased; panic; Total body flushing; Sensation of hot and cold; Shaking; lightheadedness; feelings of passing out; nausea; arm numbness; extremity tingling; headache; exhaustion; fever; fluctuating blood pressure; racing heart ,heart palpitations; mild flushing; brain fog; A spontaneous report was received from a healthcare professional concerning a 25-years-old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out, nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness, headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever. The patient's medical history, was not provided by the reporter, but patient had a tuberculosis test done in recent days prior to vaccination, reports were not provided. Concomitant medications reported included vitamin B-12 complex and ibuprofen. On 04-Mar-2021 at 5:55 pm, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013A21A) intramuscularly in the deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 04 Mar 2021, approximately after 23 minutes after receiving the vaccine patient developed panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out. Patient pulled over and called 9-1-1, and she was taken by ambulance to a nearby hospital. Patient had reported that the symptoms persisted during ambulance transit and continued during her three hour hospital stay. Patient reported to have development of nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness while being admitted. Patient reported that a friend of her drove her home from the hospital, and her brother was monitoring her condition. No medicinal treatments were administered at the hospital for the patient. On 05 Mar 2021, Patient took advil to treat the headache and brain fog that has developed. Patient reported that the symptoms headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever were continuing. As treatment for events no medicinal treatments were administered at the hospital. Patient reported that she had taken ibuprofen to treat a headache and brain fog. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of events, panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out, nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness was unknown and headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever were not recovered.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
25 2021-03-15 mobility decreased Around 6:00 pm on the day of vaccination I started to feel very fatigued and developed body aches - ... Read more
Close
Around 6:00 pm on the day of vaccination I started to feel very fatigued and developed body aches - this felt similar to the beginning of developing Covid-19 symptoms. (I had Covid-19 back in November of 2020) Around 8:00 pm I had developed some head congestion and swollen lymph nodes along with some throat pain and sinus congestion - again feeling very similar to Covid-19 symptoms. Around 10:00 pm as I was heading to bed the symptoms became a lot worse, I had pretty intense body aches and started to experience chills as well as a slight fever (around 99.5 in F). At this time the symptoms felt similar to how I had felt during the worst of my previous Covid-19 symptoms, very weak and achy, headache was very bad, and felt very uncomfortable overall. Around 2:00 am on March 13 I woke up with a fever of 101.8. The previous symptoms had also gotten worse, I was having a hard time getting out of bed because things were very uncomfortable, I drank a lot of water and took some ibuprofen to combat the fever, about an hour after this the fever had come down to about 99.9 and I was able to fall asleep, but before taking the medication I couldn't have fallen asleep because of the discomfort of the aches, chills, and fever. Throughout the following day I was unable to complete many of my day to day activities without taking a daytime cold and flu medication. With the medication I still felt sick but was able to walk around and complete some simple household chores, this carried through into the evening, when the medication wore off the chills and aches and headache were much worse and I still had a fever around 99-100. That night I was able to sleep with the cold and flu medication taken right before bed. Upon waking up the next morning (March 14) I still had some congestion, headache, and general discomfort but the worst of the aches were gone and I no longer had a fever, these symptoms continued to diminish throughout the day. On March 15 and March 16th I have had a slight lingering congestion headache, this also feels really similar to the lingering headache I had upon recovering from Covid-19. It is not debilitating and is continuing to improve. Otherwise I am feeling healthy again and have been able to complete my usual activities and even exercise. Overall the symptoms felt like a couple days of having Covid-19 again, but recovery was much faster, and it was definitely worth receiving that first dose of the vaccine and getting started with the process of doing my part to reduce community spread.

25 2021-03-18 dizziness A few minutes after receiving the shot I noticed extreme tiredness and light headedness. I got up to... Read more
Close
A few minutes after receiving the shot I noticed extreme tiredness and light headedness. I got up to notify staff and my vision went and I began to feel nauseated. They helped me to a seat and I began sweating profusely and the nausea intensified. After several minutes the nausea and vision changes subsided and I continued to feel extremely tired and light headed. The staff put a heart rate monitor on me and I saw that my heart rate was sitting around 38-42. I felt like I just wanted to close my eyes but the staff kept asking me questions. After several more minutes a cop arrived. Later on an ambulance arrived and when they put the blood pressure cuff on I noticed tingling in my hand from it. I continued to feel light headed and extremely tired through arriving at the hospital via ambulance around 10:30am. These symptoms gradually subsided throughout the afternoon leaving me with light headedness only when walking or moving around. While at the hospital they did an EKG which showed inverted T waves (from what I remember of the PA's description) and so admitted me for observation and performed an echo which came back normal. I was discharged around 10pm on the same night.

Close
Patient had a syncopal episode at 2:55pm lasting less than 1 min. Vaccine was taken at 2:30pm. The patient fell on her right side off the chair after approximately 10min. of sitting upright in the chair in the observation area. The patient responded to both verbal and painful stimuli (shake and shout). EMT began taking vitals @2:56pm, HR:50, RR: 18, BP: 130/86, SpO2 100%. Pt. was able to answer orientation questions asked by EMT . Pt. reported right sided pain s/p fall. Pt.'s skin was pale with redness in areas of impact. Pain rated @ 3/10, non-radiating, "soreness" quality. After 12 minutes PPTS was reassessed and EMT took vitals, BP: 118/82, HR: 76, RR:18, SpO2 99% .

Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine the patient began to feel dizzy, felt like she could not breathe and state her throat felt tight. She was given Adrenaline 0.5ml (0.5mg) IM and Benadryl 50mg IM and 911 was called. EMS arrived shortly and she was transported to the local Emergency Room.

Patient's mother reported that patient had taken Ativan PO at 0945, same day.

25 2021-04-01 dizziness I received my first Covid - 19 vaccine on March 25, 2021. The next day I felt extremely dizzy starti... Read more
Close
I received my first Covid - 19 vaccine on March 25, 2021. The next day I felt extremely dizzy starting around 4:00pm. This was able to be resolved by increasing hydration. The following morning I felt much better with no other side effects. Just over a week later (4/2/21) I woke up around 7:00am and noticed a rash around the injection sight. It is not itchy but it feels warm and hard to the touch. The shape is somewhat of an irregular oval about two inches long and an inch wide. I also have a smaller circular spot just below the larger spot. The rash is currently only located on my left arm right near the injection site.
25 2021-04-01 dizziness Client described electric pain in her arm which traveled up her arm to her neck and head, feeling li... Read more
Close
Client described electric pain in her arm which traveled up her arm to her neck and head, feeling like a migraine for a moment and then disappearing. Her vision blurred; she felt dizzy; she had a hard time hearing herself, although she could hear me fine; and she felt faint. We had her sit back down and got her some water, checking on her every 5 minutes or so. She was still dizzy, but not as faint. She also reported a cold sweat. We got her some orange juice and continued checking on her. She called her husband to come and get her. She was able to get up and walk out of her own accord with her husband. We will follow up with her tonight to see how she is doing.
25 2021-04-01 dizziness These were symptoms after 2nd shot. I started with a mild headache and sore arm. Then things got wo... Read more
Close
These were symptoms after 2nd shot. I started with a mild headache and sore arm. Then things got worse. At night on Wednesday, 24th, I got a severe headache that was at the back of my neck and could feel in the back of my head. Then I became so achy. My bones and joints hurt so much. It hurt to sit or lay down. All I could feel is the pain in my joints. I became so weak and so achy that I could barely get up and walk to the restroom. I could it stand for more than 2 minutes due to the pain. The subsided slightly on Thursday night, 25th, at 6pm. But then returned in another way. I became very nauseous and dizzy. My muscles instead of my bones began to hurt extremely. I could barely move. I broke down crying a couple of times due to the pain being so intense. Throughout this time, I did try to eat or snack and continue to drink water and Gatorade. Then finally the pain just all of a sudden went away on Friday, 26th, at 1:00pm. I felt like a different person. The pain was gone. The only lingering effect was when I would get up from sitting down, I would be dizzy and my head would throb for a few seconds. That went away on Saturday night, 27th. I will say if that type of pain had continued on much longer, I might have had my husband take me to the Emergency Room.

The ?snow? in front of my eyes got worse too where I couldn?t almost see anything for over probably 3 minutes and I broke in cold sweat.After the diarrhea I had a very sharp pain in my lower abdomen. That all lasted a few minutes and I didn?t have phone on me and I was alone so I helplessly sat on the floor through it all til I started feeling bit by bit better.The fever continued for 48 hours as well as extreme arm pain for 3 days where I got my vaccine.

Close
Fatigue onset 4 to 6 hours after receiving the shot (vaccine received Monday 1:30pm). Low fever, dizziness, and chills set in around 24 hours later (Sunday midday), including a change in color and consistency of nasal mucous (thicker, green). At about 40 hours post-vaccine (Monday morning) most of the symptoms had dissipated aside from the fatigue and an atypical level of brain fog, which has gradually improved over the course of the week and is still present. No treatment taken. Normal amount of sleep & caffeine intake, normal daily dosage of Vyvanse 60mg since Monday.

Close
I received the injection in my shoulder joint and immediately I knew something was wrong. It was not in the deltoid and was extremely painful. It felt like someone was shoving a pencil in my arm. Since then, I have experienced a loss of ROM and severe pain (all over my upper arm constantly with a shooting pain if I try to move my arm). I am in extreme pain and still cannot move my arm. I have tried doing some range of motion exercises, but it is not helping. The pain is keeping me from sleeping and working. I went to my primary care doctor and they said the symptoms would go away in a week, but I am very worried that it would be a SIRVA issue.

Close
25 year old female exhibited signs of mild allergic reaction to Moderna covid-19 vaccine. Rash on upper R arm and anterior throat. Nausea, dizziness. BP 148/85, pulse 93, SPO2 95% with room air. C/O mild throat discomfort, nausea, fatigue, dizziness and mild itching at rash sites. Administered Benadryl 50mg oral by EMT. Patient was monitored in clinic for 20 minutes by EMT's along with PA. Patient complained of nausea, dizziness, hoarseness and discomfort in her throat. Patient's mother agreed to have her transported to the ER for evaluation by ED staff. Patient agreed as well. Ambulance was called to the site and patient was evaluated and transported by paramedics at 10:40am PA gave verbal transfer of care as senior medical staff on site. 4-13-21 RN tried to call patient twice to follow up. No answer and can't leave message

25 2021-04-12 dizziness Immediately after receiving the vaccine, the arm it was given to me in was basically dead - very wea... Read more
Close
Immediately after receiving the vaccine, the arm it was given to me in was basically dead - very weak, achy, hand couldn't really grip anything. About 3 minutes after, I was very dizzy and sweaty, and a bit nauseated. Felt like I might pass out. Starting about 11 hours after the vaccine, and lasting almost 3 days, I had: Extreme body pain, much worse than usual (I have chronic illnesses and I'm always in pain) and more widespread. Low fever. Tiredness. The hand on the arm where I received dose one of the vaccine still doesn't have its strength back almost 4 weeks later - can't open bottles or spray hairspray. Cannot consume things with bergamot anymore - 1 week following the vaccine I tried to drink a tea that I drink weekly that has bergamot in it. Became incredibly dizzy, there was nausea, vomiting, excessive sweating. Tried it again a week later and had the same reaction. Decided I'd wait until a month after the SECOND dose before trying it again, so may still be sensitive.

25 2021-04-16 dizziness 1 hour after (Day 1): fatigue, some dizziness, arm pain began; 2-3 hours after (Day 1): fatigue, hea... Read more
Close
1 hour after (Day 1): fatigue, some dizziness, arm pain began; 2-3 hours after (Day 1): fatigue, headache, body aches; 6 hours after (Day 1): nausea, fatigue, headache (bad, but not as bad as a migraine), feels like the flu, felt like I had a fever but temperature around 99F; 20 hours later (Day 2, morning): Could not sleep that night, extreme fatigue, headache, bad nausea, took 2 extra strength Tylenol. The headache felt like a migraine, but went away with the Tylenol. I could not think straight all day.; 24 hours later (Day 2, mid day): threw up once, felt like I could not walk 10 feet without overdoing it. Motion made the nausea worse.; 30 hours later (Day 2, afternoon): took pepto bismol for the nausea. This helped reduce the nausea, but I was still queasy; 32 hours later (Day 2, evening): headache came back. Took 2 extra strength Tylenol to treat. Still very fatigued. I did not feel like I could get out of bed.; 44 hours later(Day3, morning): woke up with a headache, fatigue, and nausea. At this point, I could keep down water, pedialyte, and saltine crackers. Took 2 extra strength Tylenol to treat the headache. Still could not think straight; (Day3, mid-day): Tired, nausea going away (Day4): Neck pain, could not think straight, tired, appetite coming back (Day5): Tired but mostly back to normal The arm pain was bad days 1-2 but got better on day 3. This was way worse than any time I have ever had the flu or pneumonia. I have never been so fatigued that I felt like I could not walk anywhere. The nausea and fatigue were inhibiting to daily activities.
25 2021-04-17 dizziness I received my vaccine in the evening and felt alright until I woke up the next morning. I typically ... Read more
Close
I received my vaccine in the evening and felt alright until I woke up the next morning. I typically do chores first thing on Saturdays, so I got up to do my chores and recognized that I needed to lay down less than 10 minutes into cleaning the kitchen. I felt weak, slightly dizzy, achy, and had a mild headache. I laid there from 7:30am-6:30pm only getting up to potty. I drank 100+ oz of water and a large energy drink while in bed. Over the course of the day, the headache is what became unbearable. My sinuses filled up and it turned into a migraine around 3pm. I had rice around 10am so my partner made me soup with a baguette at 6:30. I ended up calling my dad at 6:30, a 30+ year Hospital CEO, to confirm that taking a tylenol would be okay. He said it would be fine. When I took it, I felt better within 20 minutes. Within an hour I felt like I only had allergies. I was eating and watching TV. However, I was tired and wouldn't have walked far. The next morning I woke up with a severe enough headache that I took a tylenol and drank a coffee (I hear caffeine expedites medication) and by 10am I was at a hardware store buying stuff for house projects.

Final BP reading before letting patient go was 115/73 HR 69. R: Pt states feeling better and mother is waiting for her in the parking lot. Patient is a 25 year old female who has completed a 45 minute observation period with the following signs and symptoms of an adverse reaction dizziness and tingling on lower extremities: . #1 vaccine in series administered. 25 2021-04-28 dizziness, mobility decreased, balance disorder Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Symptoms were experienced 8 minutes after first dose was administered. ... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Symptoms were experienced 8 minutes after first dose was administered. Symptoms included dizziness with the feeling of loss of balance while seated. I felt weak and couldn't lift my hand up. Fast heart rate: it felt like my heart was beating in my mouth. My throat (underneath the chin area) felt hot and later elevated to a burning sensation under my skin. Symptoms lasted for 30 seconds to less than a minute. Symptoms gradually reduced and once past the 15 minutes observation window, I mentioned these symptoms and asked if I was free to go. Since I felt alright and didn't need EMS to check with me, they let me drive back home. I have not experienced any other side effect post this event.

Patient sat in the waiting area and soon she said she is feeling dizzy and wants to lay down. Helped her get on the floor to lay down. She said she also had a vision black out. She was conscious throughout and said she is feeling better after laying down. This was her 2nd shot and she had done fine with that. She had not eaten for a while and then said she had similar reaction with the 3rd HPV shot. Took her BP and it was normal. She laid on the back for a while and then sat in the chair with her feet elevated. After about 40 minutes she said she is doing fine and left.
25 2021-04-28 dizziness Pt has history of fainting and dizziness from blood drawn and vaccines. It was answered and document... Read more
Close
Pt has history of fainting and dizziness from blood drawn and vaccines. It was answered and documented on the screening questionnaire. Pt felt dizzy and then fainted for approximately 10-20 seconds in the chair as she was being held and regained consciousness. She was given cold compresses which helped tremendously and waited a total of 30-45 minutes to ensure no further adverse reactions. There were none and pt went home. Will follow up and call patient.

syncope/ vasovagal response. sweating, dizzy, then unconscious for 15 seconds. was seated, so was placed lying down so as not to fall. return to normal after 15 seconds, with slight nausea. recovered fully after 10 minutes with water.

25 2021-05-05 dizziness 0831: Patient walked up to writer and stated that she felt like she was going to pass out. Patient b... Read more
Close
0831: Patient walked up to writer and stated that she felt like she was going to pass out. Patient brought over to post vac recovery area and placed into supine position with feet elevated and vital signs obtained for patient. Vitals taken at 0832 and were 112/60 HR 64 and oxygen 98% RA. Pt grandmother at her side during occasion. Patient states that she feels much better at this time and another set of vitals obtained from patient at this time. 0836 BP 112/66 hr64 o2 97% RA. Pt brought to sitting position and another set of vitals signs obtained. 0837 116/62 hr 62 o2 98% RA. Last set of vitals obtained at 0839 after patient was sat up into regular chair was 106/68 hr 63 o2 98% RA. @ 0842 patient brought back into regular area after incident and grandmother at her side. Patient to stay and recover for next 30 minutes prior to being able to leave, patient made aware and states that she understands. Patient walked out with all belongings in stable condition with grandmother at their side at 0900 am.
25 2021-05-05 dizziness 2:22 pm- vaccine given, 2:37 pm- 15 minutes observation completed, no complained of issue after 15 m... Read more
Close
2:22 pm- vaccine given, 2:37 pm- 15 minutes observation completed, no complained of issue after 15 minutes observation. She went back to work. 4:15 pm- companion called that patient is not feeling well. I directed patient to go to the medical clinic for evaluation. 4:17 pm- staff and I assessed patient VS: BP 109/77, P-102bpm, O2 98%RA, R-18, Temp 99.3F. Patient complained of hot flashes, dizziness. She wanted to drive home. Staff advised her not to drive in this condition. Patient tried to reach her supervisors by phone to report her condition. I notified staff that patient is not feeling well. 4:29 pm- patient said she is feeling better. Pulse-88bpm, O2 98% RA. She denied feeling dizzy, still feels hot, arm sore, and requested water. I notified Dr that patient requested to go back to her break area to eat and drink some water. She wants to take her break from now until 545pm. Patient wants to resume her duty after her break. Dr. agreed. Dr. provided her phone number to patient over the phone. Patient may contact Dr. anytime until 8 am tomorrow if she starts to feel bad again. Patient acknowledged and understood. I notified staff that patient wants to go back to work after 545pm.

25 2021-05-08 dizziness Patient vomited and got dizzy within 15 minutes of receiving vaccine. She stated her tongue felt num... Read more
Close
Patient vomited and got dizzy within 15 minutes of receiving vaccine. She stated her tongue felt numb and she had chest pain. We gave her 50mg of Benadryl and sat her down to observe her. She said that her symptoms somewhat resembled what she experiences in an episode of POTS but she never had the tongue numbness or chest pain before. When talking to us she could not make eye contact and her responses were slow but clear. Within the next 15 minutes her symptoms did not improve and she stated her right hand felt numb. We called 911. The EMTs said all her vitals were good but they took her to the closest ER.

Patient felt lightheaded (about to faint) about 10 minutes after the second dose of moderna COVID 19 vaccine. We let her lay down and raised her feet and she said she felt better immediately. She stayed at that position for about 20 minutes and then sat and standed for a while until she was confident that she was fine and left the pharmacy.

25 2021-05-10 dizziness Approximately 10 minutes after the patient got her second moderna vaccine she became faint and dizzy... Read more
Close
Approximately 10 minutes after the patient got her second moderna vaccine she became faint and dizzy. The patient was sitting at the time. A law enforcement officer witnessed her becoming faint and ran over to attend her. I was called over to assess her as well. The law enforcement officer called EMS. The patient stated that she felt faint, dizzy, she said she had a headache, blurry vision, and was nauseous. The patient appeared sweaty and she appeared to loose consciousness briefly twice. She did not show any signs of redness, rash, or swelling. After sitting for a few minutes, and before EMS arrived, the patient said she was improving. She did not lose consciousness anymore but she still had a headache, nausea, and blurry vision. When EMS arrived they recommended that she get checked out at the emergency room, but the patient refused stating that she did not want to go to the hospital and that she was feeling better. The patient called her parents and they came and picked her up.

Close
Dry feet. The day after my first shot the bottom of my feet were very painful, so painful I could hardly walk and couldn't sleep. This was my second shot, and the pain was not as bad but it still hurt to walk and I had to tiptoe around the day after. My feet are mostly better but are still painful and abnormally dry. This has never happened to me before.

Secured patients neck and had her leaning to the side on me. As I was getting ready to get her to the floor she came too. Patient was very pale. Applied cold packs to her back/stomach/head. After she started to feel better and her color came back she asked for water and we gave her that. Patient stated with me until she was better and felt herself again.

25 2021-05-19 dizziness fainted; Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed; Dizzy; Aches and pains; Fever of 102.5 degrees; rig... Read more
Close
fainted; Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed; Dizzy; Aches and pains; Fever of 102.5 degrees; right arm soreness; Vomiting a little; very nauseous/nausea; Headache; Dry heaving; She can't drink a lot of liquids; Can't keep food down; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (fainted) in a 25-year-old patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 023b21 and 016b21a) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No medical history was provided by the reporter. Concomitant products included ETHINYLESTRADIOL, NORETHISTERONE ACETATE (JUNEL) and ISOTRETINOIN for an unknown indication. On 07-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 05-May-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 05-May-2021, the patient experienced FOOD INTOLERANCE (Can't keep food down), RETCHING (Dry heaving), DYSPHAGIA (She can't drink a lot of liquids), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (right arm soreness), VOMITING (Vomiting a little), NAUSEA (very nauseous/nausea) and HEADACHE (Headache). On 06-May-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (fainted) (seriousness criterion medically significant), BEDRIDDEN (Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed), PAIN (Aches and pains), DIZZINESS (Dizzy) and PYREXIA (Fever of 102.5 degrees). On 05-May-2021, PAIN IN EXTREMITY (right arm soreness) had resolved. On 06-May-2021, SYNCOPE (fainted) and DIZZINESS (Dizzy) had resolved. On 07-May-2021, PYREXIA (Fever of 102.5 degrees) had resolved. At the time of the report, FOOD INTOLERANCE (Can't keep food down), BEDRIDDEN (Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed), RETCHING (Dry heaving), DYSPHAGIA (She can't drink a lot of liquids), PAIN (Aches and pains), VOMITING (Vomiting a little), NAUSEA (very nauseous/nausea) and HEADACHE (Headache) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 06-May-2021, Body temperature: 102.5 (High) 102.5 degree F. No treatment medication were received. Company Comment : Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
25 2021-05-19 dizziness Patient recieved her first dose of Moderna. Within 10 minutes she was feeling dizzy and lightheaded.... Read more
Close
Patient recieved her first dose of Moderna. Within 10 minutes she was feeling dizzy and lightheaded. I lowered her to the floor and lifted her feet above her head. An ice pack was applied to the back of her neck. She started complaining that her throat was closing up so an epi pen was administered and 911 called. The epi pen was a temporary fix but her throat started closing up worse than before. I administered a 2nd epipen. Patient was violantly shivering. A 3rd epipen was administered with no relief. At this time the paramedics arrived and she was transported to the hospital.
25 2021-05-19 impaired driving ability, mobility decreased Confusion/inability to complete tasks: within 20 minutes of getting my vaccine, I was unsafe to driv... Read more
Close
Confusion/inability to complete tasks: within 20 minutes of getting my vaccine, I was unsafe to drive (drove on the wrong side of the road). Within 2 hours, I could no longer focus enough to work (I'm an engineer). It's been 6 days since my shot and I'm still confused, forgetful, unable to focus, and unsafe to drive. I forget steps during work tasks, and forget what I'm doing while I'm doing it. It's like a short term/prospective memory issue. Lack of coordination: 5 days after shot, could not navigate stairs without assistance. Could not remember ADL (did I get mail, did I eat, did I shower, day of week...) Fatigue: Slept/ rested all day for 2 days after the shot. It's now 6 days after the shot and I'm still unusually tired, needing 2-6 extra hours of rest a day. It's tiring to walk short distances, to focus/converse, to work. Sore arm: my arm was very sore for 2 days after the shot (painful at rest, worse if touched, like a bruise). By 4 days after the shot, it was not sore even if pressed/hugged. I do not have any headache.

Close
Heart palpitations with lightheadedness (continued for 1 week, subsided on own without interventions).
25 2021-05-24 dizziness Patient is a 25 year old female. She presented to the clinic for her second dose of Moderna LOT #003... Read more
Close
Patient is a 25 year old female. She presented to the clinic for her second dose of Moderna LOT #003C21A. According to patient's husband she has no significant past medical history but has ?passed out? with vaccines. No reaction noted with her first COVID vaccine. Approximately 10 minutes after receiving her injection today she told her husband that she wasn?t feeling well. She said was light headed and nauseated. Patient then proceeded to become nonresponsive. Her eyes deviated upward and her whole body became stiff. Her skin had notable pallor. She was lowered to the ground by staff, myself, and her husband, and put in a supine position with her legs elevated. 911 was called. This episode lasted approximately 40-60 seconds when she became responsive and cried out for husband. Her muscles relaxed and she became notably upset. She kept saying she wasn?t able to see or feel her extremities. Her lack of vision resolved within 10-15 seconds. She had weakness in her arms and legs but was able to squeeze her hands on command. She was alert and oriented X3. BP was 130/90. The patient was stable when the ambulance arrived to transport her to Hospital.
25 2021-05-28 dizziness Experienced dizziness that lasted several weeks. This dizziness lasted most of each day. Took about... Read more
Close
Experienced dizziness that lasted several weeks. This dizziness lasted most of each day. Took about 8 weeks to subside. Then, started to have tinnitus in both ears for about a month, and now this has started to subside. Primary care doctor did basic lab workup and everything was normal. Went to ENT doctor and was given steroids, however elected not to take them. ENG showed horizontal nystagmus to both right and left side. Was told usually this sort of thing happens due to inflammation and is usually post-viral. However, there is a slight possibility it could be due to anything that causes inflammation (aka the vaccine).

25 2021-06-01 joint stiffness, vertigo, dizziness 0-24 hours after receiving 2nd vaccine: general aches, soreness at injection site, mild dizziness, s... Read more
Close
0-24 hours after receiving 2nd vaccine: general aches, soreness at injection site, mild dizziness, slightly elevated body temp (WNL, but 1 degree F higher than my average) 24-48 hours: fever over 101F, chills, muscle aches (mostly upper body), moderate to severe lower back pain, moderate pain in both wrists, inappetence, moderate fatigue, dizziness upon sitting upright or standing . Took 500mg Tylenol at 7:30am, 12:30pm, and 6:00pm; fever went away but all other symptoms remained the same 48-72 hours: no fever, back pain or wrist pain, mild fatigue and mild dizziness upon standing or sitting upright, inappetence, Took 500mg Tylenol at 10:30am and 5:00pm 72-96 hours: inappetence and mild dizziness when hunched/bending over. Went back to work, experienced mild to moderate wrist pain when lifting or carrying moderate weight. Did not take Tylenol 96 hours - present: mild wrist pain when not in use/not moving, moderate to severe wrist pain when using/moving wrists 9 days post-second vaccine: moderate to severe bilateral knee pain that progressed to tightness in knee joint and muscles in lower legs, moderate pain in both wrists regardless of use. Pain now comes and goes but has never stayed this long nor has it been this severe without use. Felt normal

25 2021-06-07 dizziness Sat in the chair for 30 mins with no reaction. So I went back to work, 15 mins later left arm went n... Read more
Close
Sat in the chair for 30 mins with no reaction. So I went back to work, 15 mins later left arm went numb and then went up to face, neck, head, and 1/3 of tongue all completely numb. Couldn't even feel a needle. Lasted for 8hours. Numbness in tongue went away, slightly have feeling in rest of the affected area. Still do not have feeling completely back to this day. Did not seek care for numbness. 3 weeks after receiving vaccine chest pain, intermittently and constant dizziness. Last day of march I was driving and stopped at a hotel, next morning woke up and still had severe chest pain and heart palpitations and dizziness. Went to ER April 1st they did x-ray and labs.

She regained consciousness quickly and was given water. She said this was not an unusual reaction for her to have after a shot. She was nauseous and vomited a small amount. 911 was called and she was assisted by EMS. Patient was conscious, alert, and responsive. Left with EMS, outcome unknown.

25 2021-06-14 dizziness Client received her Moderna Covid vaccine dose 2 lot #: 027C21A and expires 7/1/21 at approximately ... Read more
Close
Client received her Moderna Covid vaccine dose 2 lot #: 027C21A and expires 7/1/21 at approximately 1:05pm. PHN noticed client had mask down and asked client to cover her nose, since she was waiting for her mother to get medical consult. Client then reports she "just feels really hot." PHN observes client is alert and oriented x4 and reports no dizziness, no shortness of breath, no blurred vision, and no chest pain. At 1:15pm, vitals are: blood pressure: 160/100, heart rate:81 and unable to get oxygen saturation due to long acrylic nails. Client reports not taking any medications, no known allergies and only has history of rosacea. PHN alert Lead PHN to come assist with client who is having a reaction. PHN assesses client and observes flushed face and rash on upper back and front neck area. Client reports to that she feels "lightheaded", PHN asks RN to get gravity chair and switch client to gravity chair. Client able to transfer herself to anti-gravity chair by herself. PHN offered client Benadryl and client accepted. Client reports she can get family to pick her up. At 1:18pm, PHN provides client with oral Benadryl 50 mg. Vitals are heart rate: 81 and blood pressure: 170/100. Client reports she feels "hot", her head "feels weird" and she feels like her "heart is racing." RN assists by fanning client. RN takes over vitals blood pressure: 180/130 at 1:20pm and client reports feeling hot everywhere. While PHN is assessing client PHN activates 911 at 1:23pm. At 1:25pm, client reports she feels "throbbing in her head and chest", "heavy breathing", "lightheaded" and PHN notes flushed face. Vitals are: Blood pressure:180/120 heart rate:86 and oxygen: 98%. Fire department arrives at 1:29pm and assumes care. At 1:34pm client was wheeled out of facility on gurney and was taken to hospital.
25 2021-06-14 mobility decreased Starting 4 hours after the vaccine, over the next 8 hours fever rose continuously up to 104F, accomp... Read more
Close
Starting 4 hours after the vaccine, over the next 8 hours fever rose continuously up to 104F, accompanied by episodes of tachycardia (up to 140 bmp) and severe pain in all bones, leaving patient extremely weak and unable to move for about 16 hours. Most symptoms subsided completely within 30 hours after the vaccine was administered, but a general state of fatigue remained for another week.

25 2021-06-21 dizziness After receiving the COVID vaccine, Patient started to develop itching all over her body. She was bro... Read more
Close
After receiving the COVID vaccine, Patient started to develop itching all over her body. She was brought back to exam room. Heart and lung sounds normal. Vitals stable: BP: 115/67 and Pulse: 88, O2 sat 95%. No visible rash but patient scratching a lot and causing excoriation on skin. No SOB, chest pain. No swelling or tightness of throat. Patient breathing comfortably. Also reported dizziness which resolved when laying down. Patient was given 25 mg Benadryl with little improvement. Given an additional 25 mg after 15 minutes. Patient then reported she felt like her hands were swelling-palms of hands were pink and warm to touch. Because patient was not noticing any improvement in her symptoms and scratching a lot, patient was sent to ER via ambulance for further evaluation and monitoring
25 2021-06-21 mobility decreased Severe shoulder and arm pain with swelling after 2nd dose of Covid vaccine. Unable to use left arm a... Read more
Close
Severe shoulder and arm pain with swelling after 2nd dose of Covid vaccine. Unable to use left arm at all for 2 weeks and then slowly got more mobile. Six weeks after still had limited mobility and pain. Made a doctor appointment and was diagnosed with frozen shoulder and prescribed prednisone and specific exercises. Was told if this doesn?t work will have to have shots in my shoulder and physical therapy.
